loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 28 years old.  She has 2 children who are 6 and 8 years old. Her husband sells foodstuffs while Jeannette plaits hair. She has been able to pay for her children’s school fees from the profits of her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a salon hair cutting machine.  Jeannette plans to open up another salon in a different place in the future.

loans.use: buy a hair cutting machine for her salon

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles W. M. has been selling charcoal for about five years and earns KES.15,000 per month. He is married to Mary Mueni.
	
He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of KES.20,000, with which he plans to add more stock of charcoal for sale. 
	
In the future, he plans to grow his business and own a wholesale shop. He is a hardworking gentleman.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Zaira's Group

texts.en:
Zaira, the leader of this group, is 31, married to a farmer, and the mother of two sons; the first son is at school and the second is yet too young to attend.

In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, Zaira sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 15000 soms and now earns 6000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Zaira wants to purchase more vegetables for resale. In the future she wishes to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old, married to Jamleck, and together they have 2 children, ages 13 and 8. She has been in the shoe sales business for the last 11 years, getting a profit of 30,000 KES per month.
 
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to add more stock of gumboots for this rainy season. She hopes to use the anticipated profit from the loan to open a stall in the market and sell shoes wholesale.

In the future Mary hopes to have 3 wholesale stores. She is a very hard-working woman.

loans.use: to add more stock of gumboots for this rainy season

loans.name: Leocadio Freddy

texts.es:
Leocadio, de 48 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad Palo de lapa ubicada en el departamento de León, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, de oficio agricultor el siembra granos básicos ,también se dedica a la ganadería. El empezó a los 18 años de edad, comenzó sembrando algodón  con su papa, de esta manera fue adquiriendo experiencia en la siembra e cultivos desde entonces no parado de trabajar. Incluso ha laborado con financiamiento que le ha sido de gran ayuda, a el le gustaría exportar su producto directamente a quien le pague mejor su cosecha, pues quiere diversificar la siembra de hortalizas.
Solicito el préstamo para compra de insumos para sembrar yuca, maíz, ajonjolí. Con esta inversión desea ampliar sus cultivos, mejorar sus condiciones de vida. En lo futuro quiere sembrar chiltoma, tomate, cebolla, papaya.
texts.en:
Leocadio, 48, is from the community of Palo de Lapa located in León Department.  He’s married and has five children.  He’s a basic grains farmer and also raises livestock.  He started out at the age of 18 growing cotton with his father.  He acquired experience in planting and caring for crops this way and hasn’t stopped working since.  He has even worked with financing which has been of great help to him.  He’d like to export his products directly to whoever will pay the best price for his crops because he’d like to diversify his crops.

He asked for the loan to buy farming supplies to plant manioc, corn and sesame.  He hopes to use this investment to expand his crops and improve his living conditions.  In the future, he wants to grow peppers, tomatoes, onions and papayas.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 46 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married with two children.  Lucy sells ripe mangoes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more big and wide wicker baskets of mangoes for her mango retail business. Lucy has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of mangoes for her mango retail business

loans.name: Los Microempresarios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Microempresarios” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, corte de leña y venta de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Diana quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en el segundo puesto de izquierda a derecha vistiendo una chaqueta color azul con aplicaciones en color celeste y pantalones de color morado estampados, se dedica al corte y confección de ropa. Comenta que le gusta innovar con sus productos, por lo tanto también compra ropa en la ciudad de Santiago y la vende directamente desde su domicilio.
Sus clientes van a su casa para solicitar sus servicios de confección y además aprovechan de comprar ropa que Diana compra en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará telas y ropa con novedosos diseños.
Sus metas son establecerse en su negocio para abrir una boutique de ropa.
Diana vive junto a su hija de 4 años de edad, ella asiste al jardín infantil, por lo que Diana aprovecha éste tiempo para organizarse con su negocio, sin embargo su horario en general debe ser flexible debido a la compatibilidad en el horario de su hija. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se debe a que quiere obtener su casa propia y brindarle a su hija una mejor situación socioeconómica. Para concretar su primer proyecto postulará al subsidio habitacional, por lo que pretende que se concrete durante el mes de agosto.  
Diana se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias en un futuro. Respecto a la relación con los demás emprendedores, ésta ha sido muy buena y se encuentran organizando diversas actividades grupales.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Microempresarios” (the small entrepreneurs)  is made up of 19 businesspeople who work in different areas such as: cosmetology, firewood, clothing sales, etc.  All live in the city of Temuco.
Diana, who is pictured second in the photo going from the left to right, is dressed in a blue jacket with sky blue decorations and purple patterned pants.  She makes and sells clothing.  She says that she likes to be innovative with her products so she also buys clothing in Santiago and sells them directly from her house. Her customers go there to place orders for the clothing that she makes and also to take advantage of the trip by purchasing what she buys in Santiago.
She will use the loan to buy fabric and clothing with new designs.   Her goal is to establish herself in her business so that she can open a clothing boutique.

Diana lives with her 4 year old daughter.  She goes to a nursery school and Diana uses this time to organize her business.  But her schedule is flexible in general since it works well with her daughter’s schedule.

The reason why she continues with her business is that she wants to have her own house and to offer her daughter a better standard of living.  To firm up her first project she will use the housing benefit and that’s what she hopes to do during the month of August.
Diana is very happy and thankful for the financing offered her by Fondo Esperanza since it lets her invest in her business and generate higher earnings in the future.  She gets along well with the other members of the bank and she organizes various group functions.  

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region and is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There are a series of bathing spas (Pucón, Villarrica) around the city and beautiful flora and fauna concentrated in the nearby natural parks.    It is notable that 50% of the Mapuches, a native people of Chile, live in the area.

loans.use: To buy fabric and clothing with new designs.

loans.name: Sarah Meriol

texts.en:
Sarah is 36 years old, widowed, and has two children aged ten years old and six years old. She runs a nursery school in Kisumu. 

Sarah has been running this business for four years now and hires four employees. She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has are financial constraints. She is using her loan of Kes. 20,000 to repair and renovate the furnishings and the classroom.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and give knowledge to as many children as possible. She describes herself as a very humble lady.

loans.use: to do repairs and renovation.

loans.name: Femibc Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Fatima from Gweru. She is widowed with six children. She also cares for one dependent. Fatima runs a retail business selling poultry and fabric. She employs two people. The business has been in operation for 30 years. She says the main challenge faced is a lack of working capital. 

Fatima has requested a loan of $400 to buy chickens, chicken feed, and fowl run materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to help sustain her family. In the future, Fatima plans to expand her business and increase profitability.

loans.use: To buy chickens, chicken feed and fowl run materials

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero vive solo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Julio se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra en mayoria y los vende en Chillanes. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar más hectareas de terreno para producir m+as y que las utilidades sean superior para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre tranquilo, honrado y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 31 years old, single, and lives alone in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar.

The communal bank "San Jacinto" is located in the San José del Tambo parish, San Jacinto region, belonging to the Chillanes canton. The members of this bank devote themselves to agriculture, mainly growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and practicing animal husbandry.

Julio devotes himself to growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and to animal husbandry. The producer buys his supplies wholesale and sells his products at the Chillanes market.

He is seeking the loan for the purchase of compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids to prevent infestations and diseases in the crops and keep the products in good condition, and to buy feed for the animals that he raises in order to sell them later at a better price.

The loan will provide him support in meeting his financial needs and improving the quality of the product and his agricultural activities. He faces challenges such as falling prices for the products he sells, as well as the middlemen. His dream is to be able to buy more hectares of land so he may produce more and make higher profits for the well-being of his family.

He characterizes himself as an easygoing man, honorable and very responsible, prompt with his payments. He likes to go out and enjoys the holidays, especially the Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids and to buy feed for the animals.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la elaboración de baleadas, pastelitos, pan, enchiladas, tacos y refresco natural, sus ventas son en una esquina de la cuadra donde vive, ahí tiene ubicado su negocio que todos los días desde muy temprano empieza a vender junto con su sobrina,  las baleadas que son su especialidad son consumidas por sus vecinos y personas qué transitan por dicho lugar.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar alimentos para preparar sus deliciosas golosinas.
Su sueño es  que su hija la menor se le gradué de la universidad..
texts.en:
María Guadalupe earns a living preparing baleadas (a Honduran snack in which beans, cheese, eggs, and other ingredients are stuffed in a wheat tortilla), savory pastries, bread, enchiladas, tacos, and fresh-squeezed juices. Her business is on the corner of the block where she lives. Every day, she and her niece open the shop very early and get to work. Her neighbors and passersby enjoy eating her baleadas, which are her specialty.
She will use the loan to buy ingredients for preparing her delicious treats.
Her dream is one day to see her youngest daughter graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, beans, flour, pork, beef, chicken, vegetables, lard, oil, condiments, eggs, cheese, and fruit.

loans.name: Sibale Yg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Bridgity is the facilitator of Sibale Youth Group.  She and Sibale group members have been part of One Acre Fund since 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  As with the majority of families in Western Kenya, the members of Sibale Youth Group are maize farmers and depend on maize year round to feed their families and provide income.

Bridgity and her husband Crispinus take care of four children at home. They joined One Acre fund in order to save money to buy livestock and to buy land.  In the recent 2011 season, the family had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on a one-acre piece of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bridgity's family was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 4 acres of land.
	
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Bridgity and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from maize sales, Bridgity intends to buy livestock and to get food for her family.

In 2012, members of the Sibale Youth Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, some children of a Sibale group farmer have joined in the photo and the farmers are holding maize cobs from the recent harvest.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Don Daniel vive, en el  barrio  asunción, el es casado con la señora adula y con quien procreo  tres hijos quienes  dos ya están casado  y una  a su responsabilidad.

     El  solicito e l préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  herramientas para  su taller mecánico, en donde viene trabajando  hace  ocho  años y   ocho meses y comenta que le va bien ya que   con ello  a sacado a delante  a su pequeña familia.

   Su inspiración ´por esta actividad comenzó  desde muy pequeño  ya que  su papa lo corrió de su casa y busco la  manera de  sobrevivir  y trabajo  en un taller mecánico en  la que aprendió y desidia  dedicarse a  lo  mismo .
     Lo que desea  es que con esta péquela actividad pueda  ir a aumentando  su    negocio para  poder  apoyar otras personas que deseen  trabajar con él  y así logren tener sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Asunción neighborhood.  He’s married to Adula and has three children.  Two of them are already married and one is still his responsibility.  He requested the loan to buy tools for his repair shop where he’s been working for the last 8 years and 8 months.  He comments that he does well because he’s been able to support his small family through the business.

His inspiration for this type of work started when he was a young boy because his father threw him out of the house and he had to find a way to survive and worked in a repair shop where he learned and decided to go into the same occupation.  What he wants is that with this small activity he can gradually build up his business in order to be able to offer work to others who might want to work with him and so that they can earn their own income.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 48 years old and lives in Labo Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children. 

Rizalina has a snack vending business. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending.

Rizalin has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Rizalin hopes to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has six children age 21, 18, 15, 9, 6 and 2 years. Five are school-going children. 

In 1991, Mohamed established his ready-made clothing business. He began his business by selling cola nuts and later changed to articles. Currently, he is selling clothes. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,953,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now he requires a new loan in order to purchase jeans: 15 dozen @ 300,000 SLL. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to open a shop; he also has plans to educate his children up to university. This loan will help him to generate more income. He is straightforward and hard-working business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase jeans for resale.

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.en: Jamilya is a 51-year-old woman who sells food products. She has six years of experience in this field. Jamilya runs her business together with her husband. She has three daughters. Her current income from the business is 300 Azerbaijani Manats (AZN). Jamilya applied for a loan of 1300 AZN to purchase more products and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: purchase more products to increase profit

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 43-year-old Lebanese divorced woman, living with one parent. She has owned a clothing store since 2004. She sells only women’s and children’s clothes. 

With her requested loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to diversify her merchandise selection and purchase new clothes from different brands and trends. She notes that selling good quality clothes will help her attract more customers, and so augment her sales and her income. 
In the future, she plans to expand her business and target a wider clientele.

loans.use: diversify her merchandise selection and purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, onions, and maize flour for her business. In the future, Emma aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since receiving her last Kiva loan, Emma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, onions, and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: La señora María Josefina a sus 54 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos, se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades como muñecos de tela, accesorios, bisutería, entre otros productos. La señora María Josefina trabaja sola en su casa y vende sus productos en diferentes almacenes del municipio de Rionegro ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. La señora María Josefina requiere de la compra de materia prima tal como telas, botones y moldes para realizar muñecos navideños para vender en la temporada de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora María Josefina podrá aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a futuro crear su propia empresa y en ella generar empleos directos para sus familiares y amigos.
texts.en: María Josefina is 54 years old and is the mother of four children. She makes crafts such as cloth dolls, accessories, and jewelry, among other things. She works alone at home, and sells her products to various stores in the municipality of Rio Negro, located in the eastern part of Antioquia. Maria Josefina needs to buy raw materials like cloth, buttons and molds to make Christmas dolls to sell for the holiday season. With this purchase, Maria Josefina will be able to increase her income and thus improve her family's quality of life. In the future, she hopes to be able to create her own business in order to generate jobs for her friends and family members.

loans.use: buy raw materials like cloth, buttons and molds to make Christmas dolls

loans.name: Aura Del Carmen

texts.es: Aura Del Carmen es una emprendedora que emprendió su propio negocio de la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este medio de vida, uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido que tiene que salir todos los días bajo el sol para ofrecer sus productos. Siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy independiente. Aura Del Carmen, ya tiene un buen tiempo trabajando con Fundación y ha mantenido un excelente record crediticio, nos explica que atrvez del financiamiento ha aumentado tanto sus clientes como en  mercadería. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, bolsos, ropa en general entre otros. Aura desea ampliar su negocio cada día más y al mismo tiempo incrementar su inventario.
texts.en:
Aura del Carmen is an entrepreneur who started her own business selling general merchandise.  This has been her source of income for five years.  One of her greatest challenges is the fact that she has to go out every day in the hot sun to offer her products.  She always has enjoyed being very independent.  

Aura del Carmen has been working with the Fundación for a long time and has an excellent credit record.  She explains that the financing received has increased her customer base as well as her stock of merchandise.  This loan will be used to buy shoes, cosmetics, bags, and general clothing, among other items.  Aura wants to increase business daily, while increasing her inventory.

loans.use: To buy shoes, cosmetics, bags, general clothing, among other items.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa, tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos, tiene un bodega y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años.
Primitiva pudo ver que su negocio ha aumentado, ahora ella puede estar tranquila, también pudo lograra educar bien a sus hijos gracias a las capacitaciones que recibía, ahora lo que desea es poder tener un supermercado poder sostener a toda su familia, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite por mayor.
texts.en:
Primitiva is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) Communal Bank. She is 39 years old and the mother of 4 children. She has a store and has been a member of Finca Perú for 3 years. 

Primitiva has seen that her business has grown. Now she can relax. Also she has been able to give her children a good education thanks to the training she’s received. What she wants now is to be able to have a supermarket to be able to support her entire family. She will invest the loan she’s asked for into the purchase of bulk rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Claudia Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Dalila es casada, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó el segundo básico de educación, tiene 1 hijo que aun no estudia, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica para damas, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo, lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo negocio.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compras de mercadería consistentes en: güipiles, blusas, cortes, suéteres, fajas, entre otros. Quiere que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Claudia Dalila, 24, is married.  She completed second level of basic education.  She has a son that does not yet go to school.  She sells traditional women’s clothes.  She started the business thanks to support from her husband and has five years’ experience.  Her husband is in the same kind of business and supports her efforts.

She’s asking for a loan that she’ll use to buy merchandise consisting in: “güipiles” [traditional skirts], blouses, fabric, sweaters and sashes, among others.  She wants her business to continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is 33 years old and married. He lives in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a banana plantation, which he has cultivated for five years. 

Silver is requesting a loan, which he will use to rehabilitate his banana plantation. His major challenge is the banana wilt disease, which has destroyed almost half of his plantation. He dreams of building a permanent residential house and owning more plantations.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation..

loans.name: Andrea Jusseth

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo de 4 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones se separó de su esposo, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Andrea no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Andrea trabaja como cajera en un supermercado de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, se siente bien en su trabajo ya quien hay un buen ambiente laboral, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Andrea se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir, tales como: polos, pantalones, blusas, chompas, casacas, entre otras prendas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños; de esta manera Andrea desea poder iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, para así poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le ayudarán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y con ello asegurar la educación y bienestar de su pequeño, a quien sueña verlo convertido en un buen profesional y en un hombre de bien.

loans.use: Para realizar la compra de prendas de vestir.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.en:
My name is Blanca B. and I produce as well as sell tortillas. I have had my business for 5 years and I have the help of my two children to help distribute them. I have many customers because I sell my tortillas in various local places like small markets and grocery stores. My business generates earnings enough to support my family and my goal is to increase production and sales of tortillas. With the added earnings I would continue to support my family and be able to pay for higher education for one of my children.

Mi nombre es Blanca B. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, tengo la ayuda de mis dos hijos para la reparticion del producto, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que se reparten las tortillas a varios locales comerciales como mercaditos y pulperias, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y tener una mayor venta de tortillas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder mantener mi familia y poder pagar el estudio superior a uno de mis hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood, matches

Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, agua, leña, fosforos.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung and her husband Truyên have a small shop selling mainly vegetables, as their only source of income. They own no land at all except the 17 m2 of their little house and shop.

They have children between 16 and 22, all students and education is very expensive in Vietnam. But their present income is only $10 per person/month.

With the loan they will open a small booth at the market.

loans.use: Loan to increase the capital of their shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
KI. married in 1972 and has 4 children. She started her grocery store in 2000 on a small scale. After receiving a first loan from MAXIMA last year, she was able to expand her business. KI.'s husband is currently serving as a member of the commune council. Neither of them was able to finish primary school. Therefore, they are working hard to support their family and send their 2 younger children to school.

KI. has asked for a loan of $500 from MAXIMA to continue to expand her grocery business by purchasing more grocery items and soft drinks. With her grocery store, she will have no problem repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items and stocking soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Valeriya

texts.en:
Valeriya A. has a little business located at the Progress market in Beregovo, southwestern Ukraine. Her business is very aptly named “1000 Gadgets.” She sells a huge variety of all those little household items that everyone needs at one time or another.

Valeriya has been in business for about a year. She has been able to obtain a good location at the market and has built up around $3000 in working capital. She currently makes about $500 a month in profit. Valeriya has requested a loan of $500 that will allow her to broaden and replenish her inventory so she can continue developing her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her kiosk

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi P., 52 years old, lives in Xuan Hoa District, Phuc Yen Commune. She was an employee of her province' general store. When it disintegrated, her life became much more difficult because her husband was away in the army and she was the sole bread-winner of her family (with two kids at school). In 2002 Mrs. P. borrowed 50USD to buy vegetable and sell it in the local market. When another store was about to disintegrate, she found it a good opportunity to buy those household products at cheap price for her grocery store. With her great experience and the high demand of local people and students from nearby schools, her store always attracts a lot of customers with a variety of products. The smile on her face proves how her life has improved. Her husband is now retired and helping her with her store. Her oldest son graduated from college and starts to work. Mrs. P. would like to borrow 450USD to invest more on her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thị Phấn, 52 tuổi, sống tại phường Xuân Hòa, thị xã Phúc Yên là nhân viên HTX dịch vụ tổng hợp cũ, sau khi chuyển đổi cơ chế HTX giải thể, khi đó cuộc sống gia đình cô gặp nhiều khó khăn, chồng cô đang còn trong quân ngũ, một mình cô xoay sở nuôi 2 con ăn học. Năm 2002 cô tham gia vào Quỹ, vốn vay khi đó chỉ là 50 USD cô chỉ đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ như rau quả sinh hoạt hàng ngày. Khi cửa hàng quyết định thanh lý một số gian hàng, cơ hội đến với cô và gia đình cô đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư mua sắm một số đồ dùng sinh hoạt, với kinh nghiệm sẵn có cộng với điều kiện rất thuận lợi là nhu cầu mua sắm sinh hoạt của khách hàng rất cao. (Đặc biệt là các sinh viên ở các trường chuyên nghiệp đóng trên địa bàn). Đến nay cửa hàng của cô đã thu hút rất đông khách, với nhiều mặt hàng đa dạng và phong phú. Nhìn gương mặt rạng ngời của cô cũng đủ thấy cuộc sống của gia đình cô đã thật sự thay đổi. Chồng cô đã nghỉ hưu và giúp cô công việc hàng ngày, con trai lớn đã học xong đại học và đã đi làm. Cô mong muốn được vay 450 USD để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy household products for her grocery store

loans.name: Evon

texts.en: Evon is 18 years old and is married with a one year old child. She has been selling some spare parts together with her husband, U., who is also a driver . She usually earns US$10 per day. She needs a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is a trader who owns a cosmetics, gift and cards shop. She is married to a formal head of an institution. They have two children. Their family is surviving through Mary’s hard work.

At the moment Mary wants to increase her income by increasing her capital to purchase more stock for her shop to meet the growing demand for her goods. She is therefore asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more cosmetics, gifts and cards to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more cosmetics, gifts and cards to meet the demand of her costumers.

loans.name: Ni Kadek Artini

texts.id:
Ni Kadek Artini had been wanting to raise boars for breeding and meat producing. Finally with loan from Dinari for 3,000,000 IDR (Translator's note: 1USD ranges between 9,000-9,500.00 IDR) Ni Kadek Artini could purchase two piglets, one for breeding and another one for meat producing. Ni Kadek Artini wishes that her hog farming can grow without further buying piglets from other farmers or insemination. Good boar typically is 8 or 10 month old. An old enough boar can be loaned to breed other farmers' sow. Each week 3 to 5 people loan Ni Kadek Artini's boar for 50,000 IDR. Each week the boar can produce 150,000 IRD to 250,000 IDR. Ni Kadek Artini maintains the quality of feed given to her boar. Beside polard and concentrate, Ni Kadek Artini also feed the boar with free range chicken eggs to maintain the boar's condition to breed a high quality piglets. The meat producing side costs 500,000 IDR for animal feed, giving her a gross of 900,000 IDR. Hence the total income from breeding and meat producing is 1,000,000 to 1,500,000 IDR per month

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dari dulu Ni Kadek Artini berkeinginan untuk pelihara pejantan dan penggemukan. Akhirnya dengan modal yang didapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.- Ni Kadek Artini bisa membeli 2 bibit babi yang dipakai untuk pejantan dan yang satu lagi dipakai untuk penggemukan. Ni Kadek Artini berkeinginan supaya usaha ternak babinya bisa berkembang biak tanpa harus membeli bibit di peternak lain atau memakai kawin suntik. Pejantan yang bagus berumur 8 atau 10 bulan. Pejantan yang sudah cukup umur, bisa disewakan untuk mengawini induk peternak lainnya. Setiap satu minggu, 3 s/d 5 orang yang menyewa pejantan milik Ni Kadek Artini dengan ongkos Rp. 50.000.- sekali kawin. Dalam satu minggu, penghasilan yang didapat dari pejantan bisa mencapai Rp.150,000,- s/d Rp.250,000,-. Ni Kadek Artini menjaga sekali mutu makanan yang diberi untuk pejantannya. Selain dedak padi dan konsentrat, Ni Kadek Artini juga memberi telur ayam kampung supaya kondisinya tetap kuat dan sehat sehingga mampu menghasilkan keturunan yang berkwalitas. Sedangkan untuk penggemukan sampai panen menghabiskan pakan Rp.500.000.- dengan hasil kotor Rp. 900.000.- . Jadi keuntungan bersih pejantan dan penggemukan per bulan rata-rata Rp.1.000,000,- s/d Rp.1.500.000,-

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and piglets

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
My name is Parween A. and I am a group leader of four other women. These women are: Khalida, who runs a beauty parlor; Farzana B., who wants to buy a donkey cart; Haseena, who will invest her share of the loan to improve her family's vegetables business; and Rubina B., who will spend her share to fix her husband’s car.

I am 42 and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. My son runs a food stall in a busy nearby market. I also help him to prepare the snacks for his stall. He wishes to expand his business, for which he requires a loan. His income has lessened many of our economic difficulties.

loans.use: Expand food stall

loans.name: Ni Komang Sutarsini

texts.id:
Baliness daily life as Hindunese is full of religion rituals, which is very time consuming, for they have to prepare all ritual materials. Therefore, many of Hindunese prefer to buy finished products that they do not have to spend time to prepare them. This condition is an opportunity for Ni Komang Sutarsini to produce and snacks as “jajan uli, satuh, and pelpelan” as components of ritual materials. She started her business with Rp 150,000 as the initial capital. The business gives her Rp 125,000 income a week. Even though earns small amount, she is not pessimistic. Ni Komang Sutarsini manages her business diligently to help her husband who is a truck driver paying their two children tuition fees with a hope seeing their bright future. Her spirit to see a better life increase her passion in working, even more when she received loan from Dinari to increase her production by purchasing more materials to produce more snacks.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Kehidupan masyarakat di Bali yang dominan beragama Hindu sangat disibukkan oleh upacara keagamaan yang menyita banyak waktu, karena mereka harus mempersiapkan segala macam sarana upacara. Untuk menyiasati hal ini kebanyakan dari mereka memilih untuk mengadakan segala sarana ritual tersebut dengan membeli yang sudah jadi sehingga tidak perlu membuat lagi. Hal inilah yang membuat Ni Komang Sutarsini melihat peluang yang besar dalam usaha produksi jajanan seperti: jajan uli, satuh, pelpelan (rengginang) yang juga termasuk salah satu bagian dari sarana ritual tersebut. Memulai usaha dengan modal Rp 150.000,- setiap minggunya usaha produksi jajan ini memberikan keuntungan Rp 125.000,-. Walaupun keuntungan yang diperolehnya tidak banyak namun hal ini tidak membuatnya berkecil hati. Dengan tekun usaha ini dikelolanya untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk pasir, menyekolahkan kedua anak mereka supaya bisa sukses dan memiliki masa depan yang cerah. Keinginannya untuk bisa hidup lebih baik membuatnya tambah semangat apalagi setelah mendapat pinjaman modal usaha dari DINARI yang kemudian dipergunakan untuk meningkatkan omzetnya dengan membeli bahan baku dan produksi jajan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (flour, sugar) and equipments to produce snacks

loans.name: Santos Esteban

texts.es:
Santos is 37 years old, married and lives in Ticuantepe. His wife is a salesperson and they have three children, two who are students. He has twenty years of experience which began with his own efforts, but hasn’t had the financing to improve his harvest. He will purchase agricultural supplies with the loan in order to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Don Santos es casado y vive en Ticuantepe su esposa es comerciante le tienen tres hijos dos están estudiando, tiene 37 años de edad. Con veinte años de experiencia que comenzó con esfuerzos propios, con el préstamo va a comprar insumos agrícolas para mejorar la producción que le ha faltado financiamiento para mejorar las cosechas.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en: Bintu S. is a fashion designer. She has three sewing machines in her local shop. She is 24 years old and single. She has been in this business since the year 2007.  She acquired the skill for 3 years. She needs the loan of $425 to buy tailoring materials so that she can meet the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you!

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Solia

texts.en: Solia M., 46, is married with four children. Solia M. has been in business for more than ten years now, she is one of our most successful clients, who has shown and proven the efforts in achieving her goals. She is a very hard working lady that loves to try out new business, and hates to fail.She has many years of experience in the bakery shop business. She sells to the passing traffic 3 days per week. She has 6 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1500 Tala (~$625 USD). SPBD loans are Solia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Solia would like to renovate her shower, build a small proper shelter for selling her products and also to purchase ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Les Lingueres De Keur Mambaye Group

texts.fr:
They are part of a large group named Les Lingueres and have a lot of loan experience with IMCEC de Mbour.

They are accelerating in small-scale commerce of the district. They buy vegetables, fish, and second-hand clothing to resell in their districts, located around the community of Mbour.

These are good and honest mothers with families. They are going to use these loans to fortify their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Elles font partie d'un grand groupement dénommé les Lingueres. Elles ont une bonne expérience de crédit avec l'IMCEC de Mbour.

Elles s'activent dans le petit commerce de quartier. Elles achetent des légumes, du poissons et de la priperie pour le revendre dans leurs quartiers situés dans les environs de la commune de Mbour.

Ceux sont des braves meres de familles. Elles vont utiliser ces crédits pour renforcer leur fonds de roulement.

loans.use: To bolster working funds

loans.name: Mawunyo

texts.fr: Mawunyo  D. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois sont à l’école.   L’infatigable Mawunyo  aime beaucoup l’agriculture notamment le jardinage qu’elle pratique depuis des années avec plus de passion à Apéyémé, une Zone semi urbaine située à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle  souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité pour une production en quantité plus importante permettant d’avoir un rendement meilleur. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer
texts.en:
Mawunyo D. is thirty-five years old. She is married and the mother of five children, of which three are in school. A tireless woman, she loves agriculture and especially gardening, which she has done passionately for years. She lives in Apéyémé, a semi-urban area about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this, her first loan from FECECAV, she hopes to increase the size of her garden to grow more crops and have a better overall yield. The profits earned in this occupation will allow her to share the financial burden of her household.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase amount of farmable land

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario de 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde el primer momento en que se instaló en su domicilio, por su amabilidad y buena atención, cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, que siempre le sugieren por cosas que faltan en su bodega y ella trata de cumplir con sus gustos, porque como nos dice “el cliente siempre tiene la razón”. Es madre de 2 hijos, siendo el mayorcito estudiante, su esposo Wilson es vendedor de madera y la apoya mucho, ambos desean salir adelante y desde luego brindar a sus hijos lo necesario para que sigan adelante.Rosario quiere ampliar e implementar mejor su negocio, así como también quiere modificar algunas partes de su vivienda, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo para realizar su sueño más anhelado.
texts.en:
Rosario is 36 years old, and she sells groceries. Since the first moment she established the business in her home, because of her kindness and good attention, she had many clients. These clients always give her suggestions for things that she lacks in her store, and she tries to comply with their tastes, because as we say, “the customer is always right.” She is the mother of two children, and the older one is a student. Her husband Wilson sells wood, and supports her a lot. They both desire to go forward and offer their children what is necessary for them to succeed. Rosario wants to expand and stock her business better. In addition, she wants to modify some parts of her home. Because of this, she requires a loan so that she can achieve the dream that she longs for.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and stock her store better and to modify some parts of her home.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun S. is a farmer in Pro Soung Village in the Take Province. Aside from running her  plantation, she is also a pig breeder. Since the breeding business is going well, she would like a loan to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets for breeding.  Her husband, Mr. Touch Nora, sells Prohok which is made from small fish. Mrs. Khun S. is 33 years old and the mother of two children. One child is attending the local school while the youngest one is only 3 years old.  Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase ten more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Zaripova

texts.ru: Зарипова Гулистон проживает в районе Вахш. Ей 30 лет и она не замужем. Детей не имеет. Имеет высшее образование. По специальности врач. Но не работает по своей профессии. Занимается торговлей. Уже пять лет торгует овощами и фруктами. Арендует место, но для того, чтобы беспроблемно проработать длительный срок она должна получить кредит и оплатитьь арендную плату. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
G. Zaripova lives in the Vakhsh District. She is 30 years old, unmarried, and has no children. She has completed university, where she was trained as a doctor. She does not work in her specialty though, but in sales. For the past five years she has been selling fruits and vegetables. She rents a place, but in order to work out a long rent term without any conflicts she needs to take out a loan for the rent payment. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent payment

loans.name: Natacha

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Kara, Madame S. Natacha vit aujourd’hui dans le village de Djrékpo-Hagou (P/Lacs). Elle est mariée et mère d’une fille. Très dévouée, elle ne cesse de mettre en évidence son esprit d’initiative à travers les activités génératrices de revenus qu’elle exerce. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale et de premières nécessités. Elle a une capacité d’entreprendre et de gérer des activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, le manque de moyens financiers reste son handicap. Elle sollicite un financement pour ouvrir une boutique convenable et agrandir son commerce d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Kara, Ms. Natacha S. currently lives in the village of Djrékpo-Hagou (P/Lacs). She is married and a mother with a daughter. A very devoted woman, she continuously demonstrates her initiative through the income-generating work she does. She sells staple items and groceries and has the ability to take on and manage commercial work. Yet her lack of financial means remains as her handicap. She is requesting financing to open a suitable shop and to expand her commerce in grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with groceries

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su propia casa. Hace año y medio que trabaja en la venta de comida, inicialmente tenía un restaurante, pero por el alza de los precios de alquiler de local tuvo que cerrar, ya que no le generaba las ganancias, es así que sigue vendiendo comida, pero prepara los alimentos en su misma casa y lo lleva en por porciones a los trabajadores de una institución pública cercana a su casa, de esa manera, Rosa se genere ingresos y lo sigue haciendo con la esperanza de reabrir su restaurante, meta que se ha propuesto y desea cumplir a corto plazo. Su negocio le es rentable, y además le agrada cocinar y siempre habrá comida disponible para su familia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y en el anterior ciclo ha cumplido con todos sus pagos, siendo muy responsable en las tareas de grupo que realizan en su banco comunal. Rosa está solicitando esta cantidad para alquilar un nuevo local para su restaurante y también para la compra de muebles para su ambientación.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old, lives with her husband and 6 children in her own house. She has worked in food sales for a year and a half, first owning a restaurant which had to close due to the rise in rental prices in the area as it was not making money and then she continued to sell food, preparing it in her own house and taking it in portions to the workers of a public institution near her home. This way Rosa generates income and continues to do so with the hope of reopening her restaurant, a goal she has proposed and wishes to accomplish in the short term.

This is her second loan with MFP and in her last cycle she completed all her repayments, being very responsible in the group tasks which are carried out at her communal bank. Rosa is asking for this loan amount in order to rent a new location for her restaurant and also to purchase furniture to create its atmosphere.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting of a location for her restaurant

loans.name: Tanith

texts.es:
La señora Tanith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el futuro II”, vive en el jr. Napoleón Chu s/n, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 26 años y es madre de una niña. Es conviviente, su pareja se dedica al transporte (motocarrista), es quien le apoya con las tareas  de la casa.
Tanith con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en frutas para venderlo en el mercado.

En la actualidad cuenta con un puesto en el mercado, donde vende frutas de la región, variando los productos todos los días para mejorar las ventas, esto le genera ganancias diarias para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/. 1,500 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara frutas en sacos, plátanos de la región en racimos, cocos frescos en racimos, y además una parte comprara productos de belleza para la venta en su casa.

Tanith manifiesta su alegría por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos de crecer como empresaria y realizarse como mujer.
texts.en:
Tanith belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres para el futuro 11" (Women For The Future II). She live is in Jr. Napoleón Chu s/n, in the distict of Tarapoto, and the state of San Martín. She is 26 years old and is the mother of a daughter. She lives with her boyfriend, who makes a living driving a taxi driver. He also helps her a lot with all of the housework. With the first loan that Tanith received she decided to invest in the purchase of fruit to sell at the market.

Presently, Tanith has a space in the market where she sells fruits from the area. She sells different fruits each day so that her sales will be better. She makes a profit each day and this makes her be able to pay her loan on time.

Now she is asking for a loan of 1,500 Soles, which she will pay back in 4 months. She will buy fruit in large sacks, bananas from the region, fresh coconuts, and she will also buy beauty products which she will sell from her house.

Tanith is very happy because of the opportunity that Manuela Ramos gives to her. She is growing as an entreprenuer and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit in large sacks, bananas from the region, fresh coconuts, and beauty products

loans.name: Ni Wayan Jendri

texts.id: Setelah mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan dari pinjaman tahap pertama, Ni Wayan Jendri semakin semangat dalam mengembangkan usaha ternaknya karena pengetahuan tentang usaha ternak babi sudah dapat dimengerti dan dapat dilaksanakan berkat bimbingan dokter Hewan  dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Jendri bermaksud untuk melanjutkan pinjaman tahap kedua yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli makanan ternak babi yang pada saat ini makanan babi cendrung bertambah mahal karena situasi saat ini semua harga harga semakin meniongkat termasuk juga makanan ternak. Dengan pinjaman tahap kedua diharapkan penghasilannya  meningkat sehingga dapat menambah penghasilan keluarganya guna mencukupi kebutuihan keluarga demi masa depan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
After successfully getting returns from the first loan, Ni Wayan Jendri is now more determine to expand his pig farming with the knowledge from Dinari's Vetrinary. Ni Wayan Jendri intends to use the financial loan to buy more pig feedings. As prices of raw material has gone up, so has pig feedings. Ni Wayan Jendri hopes that with this round of financial assistance, she can increase the income of her family for the sake of her children.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda a sus 56 años sigue con mucha vitalidad para continuar trabajando, y gracias a su hijo construyeron la casa donde ahora habitan tranquilamente. Ella siempre estuvo dedicada a la venta de diversos productos, esta actividad la vino realizando en las calles de su ciudad de manera ambulante y con el pasar de los años tuvo serios problemas de salud que impedían que siguiera en sus labores. Sin embargo, su hijo le apoyó en instalar un negocio en su domicilio, el cual viene funcionando hace dos años, desde entonces solo se dedica a la atención de su tienda, todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las once de la noche, pero las horas de trabajo es lo de menos, porque está dentro de su casa y ahí su actividad no es agitada. Pero sus proyectos no han terminado, Hilda tiene el anhelo de mejorar su tienda con nuevos congeladoras para sus bebidas y mejorar la apariencia de su bodega para atraer a nuevos clientes e incrementar sus ingresos. Este es su préstamo número trece, y todo este tiempo ha sido de aprendizaje y de cambios de actitudes de sus compañeras, pues no solo tuvieron la oportunidad de obtener un crético, sino también de desarrollar capacidades de organización. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, pero su prioridad es la adquisición de algunos mostradores para mejorar el ambiente de su bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda at her 56 years of age continue to work with much vitality. Thanks to her son they constructed the house where they now live peacefully. She has always sold a variety of products, an activity that came to her in the streets of her city as she worked in travelling sales. With the passing of the years she had serious health problems that impeded her abilities to carry on her work as a travelling saleswoman. However, her son supported her in constructing a store in her home; which she has been running for two years. Since then she has given all of her attention to her store, everyday from 6:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night. But her working hours are less because the store is in her home and her home activities are not disrupted. Her projects are not finished, Hilda has the dream to improve her store with new refrigerators for her drinks and to improve the appearance of her store to attract more clients and increase her income.

This is her thirteenth loan and all this time she has been learning and changing the attitudes of her companions; they not only had the opportunity to obtain a loan, but also they were also able to develop abilities in organization. The money that she solicits will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, but her priority is the purchase of some display cases to improve the environment of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Santos Hermogenes

texts.es:
Ambulantemente en las calles de Chichigalpa el señor Santos B. vende los raspados en un pequeño triciclo el cual va sonando una campanita para indicar a los niños su llegada. 

Esta actividad la inició desde hace 15 años y ha logrado salir avante por sus múltiples esfuerzos y dedicación a su negocio. La razón por la que el señor Santos ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito ya que requiere de la compra de materia prima como es azúcar, hielo, leche, piña, tamarindo, entre otros para continuar en la elaboración de los raspados para su respectiva venta.
texts.en:
On the streets of Chichigalpa, Mr. Santos B. sells snow cones from a small three-wheeled cart that has a little bell which he rings to signal to the children that he has arrived.

He began this activity 15 years ago, and he has successfully emerged ahead because of his great effort and dedication to his business. The reason that Mr. Santos had gone to Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan as his business requires the purchase of raw materials like sugar, ice, milk, pineapple, and tamarind, among other things, to continue in the preparation of the snow cones for sale.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Fatou Gueye

texts.fr: Madame Fatou Gueye C. sollicite un crédit pour acheter des marchandises de quincaillerie qui viennent de Dubai.  Elle va aussi acheter des habits de Dubai pour diversifier son activité.  Elle a une cantine qui se trouve au marché central de Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.   Elle a déjà reçu et bien remboursé quatre crédits depuis 2004.  Elle a 50 ans et elle est mariée.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou Gueye C. is requesting a loan to buy hardware items which come from Dubai. She is also going to buy clothing from Dubai to diversify her business. She has a little shop at the central market of Thiès, a town situated 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She has already received and correctly reimbursed 4 loans since 2004. She is 50 years of age and married.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware and clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 20 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, who is a 39-year-old married man with two children living in Dawhet Aramoun in Aley, has owned his own soft drinks and cocktails shop since 2004. Today, Hassan is requesting to borrow $1,000 in order to purchase merchandise and a new juice machine.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a new juice machine.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres charges, ce monsieur a commencé l’an dernier le commerce de chaussures, il exerce son activité dans sa propre boutique, il a aussi commencé à approcher les gens dans leur services pour leur proposer d’acheter les chaussures, cela lui permet d’augmenter encore plus ses recettes. Il a reçu des commandes de ses clients, pour pouvoir les satisfaire il doit se réapprovisionner, il s’adresse alors à WAGES pour demander un crédit et acheter 5 cartons de paires fermés et une douzaine de chaussures pieds nus.
texts.en:
Unmarried and having to support himself, this gentleman started doing commerce in shoes last year. He operates in his own shop. He also started approaching people as a service to offer shoes to buy. This enables him to increase his income even more. He has received orders from his customers. To satisfy them, he must stock up again. He is therefore inquiring with WAGES to ask for a loan to buy five boxes of close-toed shoes and a dozen pairs of open-toed shoes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Germán Buch, se reúne la asociación “Esmeralda”, está formado por doce mujeres, demostrando responsabilidad en sus seis años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer. Una de las socias más  antiguas es Teodocia L., quien es una de las fundadoras de la asociación, ella se dedica al tejido de ropa para invierno, además en su tiempo libre ayuda a su esposo como voceadora de transporte público.
Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, tales como: costura de ropa, venta y/o accesorios para celular, venta de abarrotes, bolsas desechables, tejido de alfombras, tejido de ropa para bebes, venta de papas fritas, venta de pescado  y otros. Ellas afirman que necesitan comprar mercadería y/o materia prima (compra de lana, tela, azúcar al por mayor y otros).
texts.en:
In the central community of Germán Buch, you will find the Esmeralda Association. They are a group of 12 women who have demonstrated responsibility in their six years of working together with Pro Mujer. One of the oldest members is Teodocia L., who is one of the founders of the association. She sells fabric used to make winter clothing. In her free time, she helps with her husband’s taxi business as a “voceadora” (a street barker who helps attract customers).

Several types of businesses are represented in this group: tailoring, mobile phone accessories, selling groceries, disposable bag sales, carpet weaving, knitting baby clothes, selling French fries, fish vending, and more. The members say they need to buy merchandise and raw materials (wool, cloth, sugar and other items).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Rehema Musoke‘S Group

texts.en:
Rehema is the leader of a four-member group. She is 48 years old and married with five children, aged between 17 and 25 years. Only three of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with five people.

Rehema takes care of ten additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Rehema stays in Mulago Katanga zone selling bananas and water in Kalerwe, one of Kampala's suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Besides the banana business, Rehema also sells chicken and pig feed. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people, excluding children. She works six days a week.

Rehema sells mainly retail. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. Rehema has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy bananas. Regina is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: George Maiko

texts.en: George O., 39-years-old and married, has been in the embroidery business for nine years and manages his rental houses on the side.  George learned about KADET through existing clients, and is requesting his first loan of ksh 50,000, with which he plans to add to his stock of embroidery materials and buy an embroidery machine. With the extra profits that accrue, he plans to build more rental houses.  Focused and hardworking, George's goal is to have several more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and add to his stock of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Upper Traders Group

texts.en:
Vida is 46 years old she is married and given birth to six children. Currently they are all in school. She sells porridge at her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taking with what we called Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Upper Traders’ which. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Ejerose

texts.en:
Ejerose L. is a 22-year-old rice grower in Veruela Agusan del Sur, in Mindanao. She has two children. Her eldest is three and ready to go to preschool next year. Currently, her family tills a 1-hectare farm which she expects to help support their needs like food, clothing and medicines. Aside from her income from growing rice, she also tried selling food items in school as a way to augment their family income. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay for the equipment that she rented and the laborers that helped on her farm during land preparation. 

She said that she likes the program of CEVI a lot because it really helps many farmers like herself have access to funds to sustain their livelihood.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La socia Mariela, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, la socia tiene 29 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo, nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia compra cuyes, aves de corral y otros animalitos en la feria de Inquilpata que se realiza todos los viernes y una vez que se reproducen ella los vende, la socia requiere el préstamo para reinvertir en la compra de sus animalitos y así incrementar sus ganancias

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda T. is a married woman with three children. She started her business out of economic necessity; her husband's salary was not enough to meet their family's expenses. Mavluda began to consider what work she could do to help her family.

About six years ago, one of her friends recommended she start to sell clothing, which she did. Little by little Mavluda brought in more clients, which increased her income. As her commissions increased she was able to buy and then sell more clothing.

Mavluda is applying for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy more merchandise and to fill existing client orders. She hopes that you will collaborate with her. Together with her family, she thanks you for supporting them and helping the family move ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. Additionally, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase working capital to expand the business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia G. S. es una señora muy trabajadora que ha logrado muchos propósitos y también que hemos observado que es una persona responsable con el crédito, ella con este va por su tercer préstamo de esta institución los anteriores los utilizo para mejorar su vivienda en el que ella esta muy agradecida por que pudo realizar su proyecto. Ella siempre trabajo como  estilista desde hace 10 años y su negocio lo tiene establecido en otra parte de la ciudad donde ha tomado clientela por que confían en su trabajo. El salón de belleza es llamado “ESTETICA KENIA” por el que ahora requiere de un automóvil para poder trabajar ya es muy requerida por sus clientas para que el trabajo lo realice en casa como cuando es una boda, quinceañera o un evento especial. Patricia esta viendo mas oportunidades de trabajo es por ello que requiere de este carro para poder darle gusto a sus clientes y si sea recomendada para ella obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Patricia G. S. is a very hard-working woman who has achieved many things, and also we have observed that she is a responsible person with credit. This will be her third loan with this institution. The previous ones were used to improve her home, for which she is very thankful, because she was able to carry out her project. She has worked as a stylist for 10 years, and she established her business in another part of the city, where she has built up a clientele because they trust her work. The beauty salon is called "ESTETICA KENIA", for which she now requires an automobile. It is required by her clients so that the work can be carried out in their home, when there is a wedding, a quinceañera (15th birthday party for girls), or other special events. Patricia is seeing more job opportunities, for which she requires this car, in order to please her clients and obtain a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An automobile to help with her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.es:
Fabiano se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Curva Pucara  Sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposa le colabora con los cuidados del ganado y quehaceres  del hogar. 

Como segunda actividad trabaja como albañil en la misma zona.
 
 Tiene seis hijos de los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Fabiano raises cattle, and he sells the milk they produce to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). He lives in the Curva Pucara community in the sector of Laja, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz, located three hours outside the city of La Paz. His wife assists him in caring for the herd and with the household chores. As a second job, he works as a bricklayer in the same part of the city. He has six children, all of whom are school aged. This loan will be used to buy cattle of a better breed, and thereby increase his milk production and his income as well. This is his first loan with Impro, and the initial assessment qualified him to be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Badamjav

texts.en:
Badamjav G. is 59 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a "ger". Her older daughter is 25 years old and helps with the family business and her younger daughter is a university student. Her husband is disabled and currently unemployed.

Badamjav operates a dairy products trading business in her town. She sells a variety of local dairy products to her many customers. Badamjav started her business in 2003 and has built a stable operation over the years. She is a very hardworking woman and is focused on supporting her family. She says, “My business is our only source of income because my husband cannot work.” Badamjav hopes to soon buy a stall at the local market at which to sell her dairy products. She is requesting a 1,600,000 tugrug loan to purchase dairy products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products for her business

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 25-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has owned a hairdressing salon for almost two years. He also sells beauty products and does makeup, tattoos and hair removal. Imad is valued for his work because he knows how to treat his customers, and because he offers a lot of services. His clients feel comfortable going to his salon, knowing that he is good at his job and is aware of the new hair style fashions.

When Imad first started his business, he had no problems because he already had faithful customers from his previous job. He decided to open this business because he learned the skills in an academy and wanted to have independent work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase beauty products and make some décor changes in his salon. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and make some décor changes in his salon.

loans.name: Roberto Adán

texts.es:
El Señor Roberto S. es un agricultor de la zona del municipio de el Viejo y se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde  hace 15 años, siendo esta atividad la que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 4 hijos.
 
El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de 3 mamanas de sandia y 2 de melones. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para continuar con su actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
Roberto S. is a farmer in the area of the El Viejo municipality. He has devoted himself to planting vegetables for the last 15 years. It is this activity that allows him to support his family, which is comprised of his wife and four children. The loan he is requesting is to buy farming supplies to plant three fields of watermelon and two of cantaloupes. That is the reason he is asking for a loan, to continue his farming activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Deysi es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Deysi se dedica a la venta de queques que ofrece a tiendas, cafetines en la ciudad, además Deysi tiene un pequeño bar en un local alquilado.
