Daysi necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y cerveza.
Los sueños de Deysi son trabajar para sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Deysi is a member of the Communal Bank “Trigales” (Wheat Fields). She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Deysi sells cupcakes to shops and cafes in the city. In addition, she operates a small bar at a rented location.

Deysi needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase sodas and beer. Her dreams include working to support her children and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc, nails, timber, etc.

loans.name: Ma De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora Maria De La Luz V. y sus esposo el señor Victoriano Estrada son padres de dos hijos de mediana edad, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.  
Con ahorros han construido un su casa pero le esta haciendo falta el techo de una cuarto que será para sus hijos. Tiene el proyecto de realizarlo de concreto ya que es más duradero y seguro. 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene trabaja en una casa particular de limpieza, ya que sus esposo el Don Victoriano se encargara de los gastos familiares con las ganancias del taller de herrería. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio en la casa y que vivan en un lugar mejor.
texts.en:
Maria De La Luz V. and her husband, Victoriano Estrada are the parents of two children for whom they want to provide the best. They have used savings to build their house but it still lacks a roof over a bedroom that will be for the children. She wants to install a concrete roof because it is more long-lasting and more secure. They plan to repay the loan with income she earns working as a domestic employee in a private home since her husband, Victoriano, will see to family expenses with earnings from his ironworks shop. They want their children to have their own space in the house and that they live in a better place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For concrete roofing.

loans.name: Lilliam Victoria

texts.es: Lilliam Victoria tiene 36 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 que realiza este negocio, con la ayuda de su esposo que le brindaba todo su apoyo mejoro lo suficiente en sus ingresos para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día y poco a poco fue logrando obtener más productos para vender. El crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de ropa usada,  bolsos, calzado y cosméticos, ya que tiene bastantes pedidos. El sueño es llegar a tener una tienda grande y si Dios lo permite, convertirse en una distribuidora de productos al por mayor de sus productos.
texts.en:
Lilliam Victoria is 36 years old, married and has 2 dependent children. She works selling general merchandise. She has been working in this business for 10 years. With the help of her husband who has given her his support, she has improved their income enough to provide for their daily necessities. Little by little she was able to get more products to sell. The loan will be invested in purchasing mainly used clothes, pocketbooks, shoes and cosmetics since she already has a lot of orders. The dream is to have a big store and god willing, become a wholesale distributor of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Mr. Kean H., 39 and his wife, Mrs. Kunthea Thoem, 33, have been married since 1998 and have three daughters. Two of them attend school and the third is still young and stays at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Kean has built wooden houses since 1992, while his wife is a silk weaver. He is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: Cipriano tiene 50 años, vive en su casa propia, solo al lado de su esposa Emilia de 49 años, pues nunca llegaron a tener hijos. Este trabajador hombre se dedica a las labores agrícolas, desde muy joven aprendió observando todas las técnicas necesarias para sembrar y cosechar la tierra. Cuando se casó continuo con  el cultivo, pero ahora con ayuda de su esposa,  pues dice que la tierra por esta parte del país son muy productivas, es por esta razón que siembra habas, papas y alverjas. El trabajo en el campo no es nada fácil, por ello Cipriano cuida  sus campos con mucha dedicación, se despierta todos los días al amanecer y empieza la faena agrícola, echa las sustancias necesarias, como abono y fertilizantes, preparándolas para que la cosecha sea muy productiva. Llegado el momento, contrata operarios que lo ayudan a recoger la producción, para luego ser vendidos a los mayoristas que le ofrecen buenos precios y con las ganancias obtenidas puede ahorrar y vivir cómodamente al lado de su esposa. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor, tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad alverja, cuyo precio es muy bueno en el mercado. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, además se siente satisfecho con el trabajo de su grupo comunal ya que todos los integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. Cipriano invertirá el crédito que solicita, en la compra de semilla de alverjas y habas, ya que la siembra empezará a partir del mes de mayo, y quiere tener todo lo necesario para que su siembra sea fructífera.
texts.en:
Cipriano is 50 years old and lives with his wife Emilia, age 49, in their own home. They never had any children. This hardworking gentleman is dedicated to his farm work. At a young age, he learned by watching all the necessary techniques that are needed to plant and harvest crops. When he got married, Cipriano continued with his farm work and now has the help of his wife. He says that the land in this part of the country is very fertile. For this reason he is growing beans, potatoes, and peas. The work in the fields is never easy, but Cipriano cares for his crops with great dedication. His farm work begins every day when he wakes up at dawn. He applies the necessary substances, such as compost and fertilizers, to prepare the land for a productive harvest. When the time comes, he will hire workers to help gather the crops to sell to the wholesalers who offer good prices. The income he earns allows him to save and live comfortably with his wife. Being an enterprising individual, he plans to grow more peas since the price is very good at the market.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Cipriano is satisfied with the work of his Communal Bank because all the members complete their payments on time. He will invest the loan he requested in the purchase of seeds for planting peas and beans. Cipriano will begin planting in the month of May, so he wants to have everything he needs to begin a successful crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting peas & beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional supplies of meat to sell to his customers

loans.name: Vaipanoa

texts.en:
Vaipanoa V. is 46 and married with six children (ages 3 - 18).  She owns a business venture, 0.  Vaipanoa has one year of experience in this business. Vaipanoa needs a loan of WST $1,000 0.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Vaipanoa joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vaipanoa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetable to resell

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 50-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon who is married and has one child.

Amal has been working as a sewer, having experience in sewing and repairing clothes and curtains. Today, for the first time, she requested a loan to purchase thread and cloth to sew. She works upon the demand of her clients who are people from her region.

When she first started her business, Amal passed through some financial issues. She decided on doing her business because of her experience, as well as because she wanted to have independent work where she can schedule her working hours.

Amal hopes that in the future, she will be able to sew clothes.

loans.use: To purchase thread and cloth to sew

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Amparo del Socorro tiene la edad de 61 años, Su actividad económica es la comercialización de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación del negocio es de manera ambulante, y con el tiempo decidió incrementar su mercadería. El financiamiento que solicita es para  la compra de los productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, bolsos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Amparo del Socorro is 61 years old. She has worked for over 12 years selling general merchandise as a street vendor. As time has gone on she has decided to increase her merchandise. The loan that she is applying for will be used to purchase pants, tops, skirts, bags and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie R. is from the village of Unidos Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Julie is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Julie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, soap powder, sardines, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en:
Oussama is a 34-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and three children. He works as a plumber with 20 years of experience, on his own for 17 years. 

This is the 2nd time Oussama has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy a Rapid, a useful car that will make his travel to his appointments easier. 

Oussama’s clients can be anyone in need of his plumbing services. What specializes him among his competitors is his experience and his honesty in his work and in his appointments, unlike most plumbers. 

He hopes to expand his work and to start taking jobs with big construction projects in the future.

loans.use: To buy a Rapid (car)

loans.name: Benkola Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkola II sont dix femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Siguila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités agricoles. 
Les spéculations cultivées par ces femmes sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TAH D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre  pour entretenir environ 1, 5 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkola II Group are ten married women who are on average 34 years old with two children. Most live in polygamous families in Siguila, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro region in the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI with the intent of better organising their agricultural activities. The cash crops cultivated by these women are among others millet, peanuts and beans. This is their fourth loan request, the preceding ones having been fully reimbursed. With this new loan Tah D. intends to buy agricultural inputs, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate approximately 1,5 hectares (3.7 acres) of peanuts and beans. After harvesting the crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to both men and women customers. By end of season group members hope to attain average earnings of approximately 60,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertiliser, herbicides, weeding and small farming equipment

loans.name: Ma.luzviminda's Group

texts.en:
Ma.luzviminda R. is from the village of Delusom. She is 43 years old. Ma.luzviminda is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ma.luzviminda is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ma.luzviminda operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ma.luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma.luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma.luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma.luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ma.luzviminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Yuri es una de los miembro del Grupo Mujeres de esperanza 1 y 2, compuesto por 10 mujeres microempresarias dedicada a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su esposo y dos hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es cobrarle a los clientes que le deben. 

Yuri está muy emocionada de recibir su Segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, despues de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su prestamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 15 años, el cual inició vendiendo sabanas y ropa interior, utilizando un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Yuri está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Productos y medicamentos de la marca Amway, nuestra asociada es distribuidor de los mismos y tiene una amplia clientela que le hacen pedidos, pero tambien vende de modo ambulante ofreciendolos al detalles para las personas que no pueden comprar un frasco. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Su sueño es poder lograr sus metas como familia, viendo sus hijos ya adultos, profesiones y piensa lograrlo cuidando de su negocio, tomando mas prestamos y ahorrando a través de Esperanza. 

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenia la necesidad de invertir capital a su negocio, y por que cree mucho en el programa. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya economía depende del sector inmobiliario y la industria del Turismo, aunque este sector ha sido opacado por las nuevas zonas turisticas emergentes.
texts.en:
Yuri is one of the members of the “Mujeres de Esperanza 1 y 2” (Women of Hope 1 and 2) group which has 10 micro businesswomen who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, etc.  Her family is composed of herself, her husband and two children.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge is collecting from customers that owe her.

Yuri is very excited to get her second loan from Esperanza Internacional having successfully repaid her previous loan and taken a step towards her business’ growth.  She has had her business for about 15 years that she started using her savings to buy bed sheets and underwear to sell.

Yuri is planning to use her new loan to buy Amway brand products.  She is an Amway distributor and has a wide clientele that places order but she also sells the products in an itinerant manner selling the products piecemeal to customers who can’t afford to buy the whole jar.  She will use her profits to reinvest in her business and make it grow.  Her dream is to reach her goals as a family, to see her children grow into professional adults and she plans to do so caring for her business, getting more loans and saving through Esperanza.

This Esperanza associate started with us because she needed to invest capital in her business and because she believes in the program.  Her history is being used to exemplify her other group members as well as clients of Esperanza, both the Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them quite recently) as well as the Dominicans who generally live in very poor communities like this zone and many others like it in the Dominican Republic which have few resources; they lack drinking water and reliable electricity.

This group is located in an area of few resources called Puerto Plata, a city whose economy depends primarily on real estate and Tourism although the latter has recently been overshadowed by new, emerging tourist areas.

loans.use: To buy Amway products.

loans.name: Raquel Nataly

texts.es:
Raquel de 20 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes), vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Comenzó vendiendo productos de uso personal con el código de vendedora de una amiga, poco a poco fue obteniendo clientela y decidió tener su propias ventas. Cuando obtuvo capital para invertir en los productos Yambal comprando cremas, perfumes, desodorantes pudo tener aun mas clientela. En la actualidad cada perfume lo vende desde $ 25.00, cremas desde $ 12.00 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, desodorantes cremas de distintas marcas para surtir mas sus ventas. En el futuro quiere ser lider vendedora en Yambal.
texts.en:
Raquel is 20 years old, she sells Yambal products (Company that offers young entrepreneurial women a start in independent sales), and lives in Orquideas de Guayaquil (urban zone called orquideas because when discovered there were many Orchid flowers).

She started selling personal hygene products using a friend's code and little by little she gained clients, so she decided to sell on her own. When she had investing capital for the Yambal products she purchased creams, perfumes, deoderants, and gained even more clients.  She sells each perfume starting at $25.00, creams starting at $12.00 etc.

She would like to purchase perfumes, deoderants, and brand-name creames to bulk up her sales.  In the future, she wants to become lead salesperson at Yambal.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, deoderants

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es:
La señora Zoila María Álvarez es comerciante  desde hace 30 años vende revistas y novelas usadas,  tiene su clientela a las que les gusta su producto.
Tiene 2 años y medios de trabajar con nuestra institución en los cuales todos estos financiamientos los ha solicitado para compra de mercadería para su negocio ella coloca su mercadería a sus amistades 
Es madre soltera cuida a sus nietos en tiempos libres pero se dedica a su trabajo fuertemente para salir adelante con los financiamientos que Ceprodel le ha brindado ha mejorado su casa poco a poco y sus ventas se mantienen su calidad de vida también la ha venido mejorando.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila María Álvarez is a merchant who has been selling magazines and used novels for 30 years. Her customers enjoy her products.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for 2½ years. All of the loans she has requested were used to buy merchandise for her business, which she then sells to her friends. Zoila is a single mother who cares for her grandchildren in her free time, but she is strongly committed to her work so that she can get ahead. As a result of the loans CEPRODEL has provided, she has been able to gradually make repairs to her house, maintain her sales, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her magazine stand

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn M. (was in the photo with her young son), has been a silk weaver since she was 14 years old. She now is a single parent because she was divorced. 
Simorn is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase weaving materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Kadidu Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
It has been 25 years since Emmanuel M. opened his pharmacy along Church Road in the middle of Kayunga Town. This business doubles as a pharmacy and a clinic. He started that business on his own, unlike many of his business contemporaries who have relied on others. Prior to the establishment of this pharmacy, Emmanuel had many odd jobs, primarily working at a neighborhood school. 

Emmanuel is happily married and has six children. His business earns shillings 140,000 each week. With this loan, he will purchase more drugs. He is affiated with the Kadidu loan group.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel L. is from the village of Sumalag, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Rocel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells snack foods, soaps, detergents & beverages. Her husband repairs motors & vehicles. Rocel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rocel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock such as snack foods & instant noodles. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 30 años, convive con Aidé, de 29 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Alexander, de 10, Lesly, de 9 y July, de 5 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La siembra de café, plátanos y palta, son los principales sembríos de Wilmer, los cuales fertiliza, cuida y cultiva constantemente, en su hectárea de terreno agrícola. Ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta a él, es poder solucionar los constantes problemas que se presentan en el periodo del sembrío, según recuerda que hace algún tiempo la maleza que crecía entre sus cultivos afectaron el crecimiento de sus sembríos. Por ello, Wilmer, ya comenzó a hacer viveros de café, comenzando con 3 mil plantas; con ello piensa renovar sus plantaciones, de esa manera tener plantas nuevas y fuertes posteriormente. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera adquirir nuevas experiencias y nuevos éxitos con el trabajo conjunto que realizará en está nueva constitución de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que espera recibirá, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus diferentes sembríos.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 30, lives with Aidé, 29.  They have three children together:  Alexander, 10, Lesly, 9 and July, 5. They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  Wilmer’s main crops are coffee, bananas and avocado which he fertilizes, cares for and constantly cultivates on his hectare of farmland.  

He has been farming for 10 years now and what he likes best is being able to solve the constant problems that arise during the growing cycle.  As he remembers, a time ago the weeds growing among his plants affected their growth.  Because of this, Wilmer has started up coffee nurseries, starting with 3000 plants.  He plans to renew his plantations this way thus having new, strong plants later on.

This is the first time he’s had a loan with MFP and he hopes to acquire new experiences and new successes with the joint work he’s starting in his communal bank.

He will use the loan he’ll receive to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among his different crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of manure.

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es:
Esther es una joven emprendedora que desde muy joven la mama le enseño administrar el negocio de la papelería. Viviendo en una zona periurbana ha trabajado en conjunto con su mama para poder generar ingresos para el hogar. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con el negocio ya que se levanta desde muy temprano para atenderlo. Su abuela en ocasiones también le ayuda en la atención vende papelería de todo tipo y algunas prendas de vestir. 

En el futuro quiere continuar apoyando a su familia con el negocio por eso quiere ahora comprar con el préstamo ropa para tener mas variedad para los clientes.
texts.en:
Esther is an entrepreneurial young woman whose mother taught her when she was very young to run their stationary store. She lives outside the city and works together with her mother to generate income for their family.

She has many hopes for the future. This is why she wants to keep working at the store and why she gets up early in the morning to go work there. Her grandmother also helps her out from time to time selling a wide variety of stationary and a few items of clothing.

In the future, she would like to continue supporting her family by working at the store. This is why she wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing in order to offer their customers a greater variety.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Naira Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Naira Magdalena V. P. tiene 26 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en un Barrio de la ciudad de Tarija. Naira es madre soltera de una hija, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hija. Naira se dedica desde hace mas de 7 años a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rápida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan Pollo, pero tiene mejores ingresos por la venta  cosméticos. 

Naira quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hija , pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprar un cierto monto de cosméticos porque le dijeron que los mismos subiran de precio, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito sera destinado para la compra de dichos cosmeticos para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Naira  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas mercaderia porque le esta yendo muy bien en ese negocio.
texts.en:
Naira Magdalena V. P. is 26 years old and lives in a rented home in Tarija.  Naria has a daughter and is a single mother.  Because of life’s circumstances, she’s had to work in order to get ahead with her daughter.  For the past seven years, she’s worked for a well known company, Crocan Pollo, selling fast food, broasted chicken.  She also earns a small income by selling cosmetics.

She would like to increase her income in order to get ahead with her daughter, and wants to buy a certain quantity of cosmetics because she was told that the price would be going up.  Since she already has some experience with financing.  She will use the money to buy said cosmetics so that she can increase her income.

Naria tells us that she would like to improve her living conditions, and so the next loan she requests will be for more merchandise, since things are going well for her in this business.

loans.use: Inventory (cosmetics)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman with five children, owning a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in agricultural produce for the last ten years starting with ten bags of coffee but later increasing to three hundred bags. Her hardship is high transport costs and her vision is increased business capital plus educating her children. Grace needs the loan to buy bags of maize and cotton for resale.

loans.use: Buying  bags of maize and cotton for resale

loans.name: Anesbelia

texts.es:
Anesbelia casada, su esposo trabaja como inspector en una empresa privada, sus dos hijos estudian en la primaria. Mejora la infraestructura de su humilde vivienda está dentro de los proyectos a corto plazo que se realizaran. Inicio su propio negocio de ventas de recargas, gaseosas, refresco, hielos y helados. Para obtener un ingreso extra y ayudarse con algunos gastos del hogar.
Lo inicio con fondo propios siendo una dificulta ya que requería de mayor inversión para obtener la ganancia necesaria para mantener e invertir. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: golosinas, gaseosa, frutas y cereales para elaborar sus helados, bolsas plásticas, recargas telefónicas entre otros productos.
Agradece a la financiera por su oportunidad de creer con su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Anesbelia is married and her husband works as an inspector at a private business. Their two children attend primary school. One of the projects they hope to accomplish in the short run is to improve the infrastructure of their humble home.

In order to earn extra income and help with household expenses, she started her own business selling cell phone credits, soft drinks, sodas, popsicles, and ice cream. She started it with her own money, but is experiencing some difficulty because she needs more of an investment in order to maintain her business. She will use this loan to buy merchandise like: candies, soft drinks, fruit and cereals to make frozen desserts, plastic bags, cell phone credits, and other products.

Anesbelia is grateful for this financing because it will provide her with an opportunity to grow with her small business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Elmurot

texts.en:
K. Elmurot is 36 years old. He is married with four children. Elmurot is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the most commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most. Elmurot requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his cows. His goal is to increase his product and thereby increase his household income in addition to being solvent in order to continue working in his buying and selling of animals.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.ru: Додохочаева Махмуда проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж занимается торговлей на рынке. Дочка и сыновья учатся в средней школе. Сама Махмуда имеет среднее образование. Она более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется мебельный магазин. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов мебели.
texts.en: Mahmuda D. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband trades in the market. Her daughter and sons study in high school. Mahmuda has a secondary education. She has been in trade for more than five years. She has a furniture store. She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of furniture.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of furniture for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. C. is a woman of 38 years, married to Meshack Wekesa and together they have five children. They live in a place called Baharini in Eldoret. Her husband Meshack works as a security guard and helps to bring income to the family and Mary does maize farming.


This will be Mary's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan for the farm by buying maize seeds, fertilizers etc. She will use the income that she will get to buy two hectares of land. 


In the future, she wants to buy a tractor to help with the digging work and to hire to other farmers. Also, she wants to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds, fertilizers etc

loans.name: Maleyo Ole

texts.en:
Maleyo Ole T. is 26 years old. He is married to Sein T. and blessed with two children who are in school. He has been farming on his own piece of land for a period of five years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his third loan. He plans to buy eight bags of Kenya certified wheat seed and eight bags of fertilizer. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity. His dream is to construct rental houses and educate his children in order to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy Kenya certified wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 34 years old, married and blessed with four children.  He started his carpentry business four years ago.  He was able to start the business after getting capital from Faulu Kenya.  Then, he left his employment and went fully into business.  Currently, he is setting up a barbershop and a video show business in his rural home. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy timber, plywood and block board.

loans.use: To buy timber, plywood and block board

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from the village of Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan. She is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria works as a baby-sitter (nanny). Victoria has been engaged in this work for 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to pay her children's tuition fees. This will be Victoria's tenth loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:   Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Kairbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kairbubu, 60, is the leader of this group. Despite her age, Kairbubu leads an active way of life. For the past sixteen years she, together with her husband, has been working selling of various types of goods. The major part of the assortment includes consumer goods and tobacco. The working spot is in a local big market. 

The size of the town Kochkorka, where our group leader lives, isn’t very big, therefore almost every buyer makes purchases here. Kairbubu has only one financial dependent, her  youngest son, while the older ones live on their own. Her start-up capital sixteen years ago totaled 2 000 soms. Fortunately at the moment her monthly income is five times more than that. The gradually increasing profit has assisted the couple to provide their livelihood and finish their son’s tuition payment. 

Kairbubu believes that increasing the variety of her assortment will attract more customers. She hopes Kiva lenders’ financial assistance will allow her  to increase circulation of her goods and she can stock her stand with new products. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour, macaroni, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María, vive con su hija, se dedican a vender papas fritas y comida rápida, ella trabaja de 7:00am a 5:00pm, este negocio lo atiende en su propia casa y tiene una experiencia de 30 años aproximadamente, aprendió sola y por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en insumos para la elaboración de comida rápida, como papas, aceite, condimentos, esta inversión le permitirá cubrir mejor la demanda, teniendo la cantidad suficiente de materiales para la preparación.
Su aspiración es construir una mejor vivienda, ya que tiene espacio para poder mejorar y hacerla más segura.
texts.en:
María lives with her daughter.  Her business is selling fries and fast food.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  She runs her business from her home and has approximately 30 years experience.  She learned the business herself because she needed to earn a living.

María is requesting a loan to invest in supplies for making fast food such as potatoes, oil and condiments.  This investment will allow her to better meet her demand by having available the materials she needs to prepare her food.

María's aspiration is to build a better home since she has space to improve it and make it safer.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil and condiments

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is aged 33 and married with two children, one of whom is currently attending school. He has a mixed farm in Kitale town that produces maize, milk, beans and eggs which are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for seven years now and employs three farmhands. He earns additional income from his motorcycle transport business in the same town. 

Martin has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to purchase additional stock of poultry. He plans to use the extra income from this project to improve his family's livelihood. His primary challenges have been diseases and fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. He plans to expand his poultry farm in future.

He further comments that Juhudi loans cater for the low income farmers and this they do appreciate.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of poultry.

loans.name: Alicia Margarita

texts.es:
Alicia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
Desde hace nueve años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de un par de animales (chanchos), también se dedica a la venta de comida, ropa, bebidas gaseosas y venta de ganados, es decir, productos en general.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, comprará ganados y mercaderías como gaseosas, calzados, chamarras.  La señora nos cuenta que a veces vende ropa de segunda mano.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo.
Su sueño es tener una pequeña casa y tienda de bazar en Puno o Pomata.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas porque dice que las mujeres son buenas para superarse en el negocio, también le gusta la garantía de las socias y la colaboración que se brinda entre ellas.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) communal bank located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province in Puno Department.  She’s 58 years old and the single mother of one son.  She studied up to secondary school.

She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last nine years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy a pair of pigs.  She also sells food, clothes, and soft drinks and sells livestock, that is to say, products in general.

She will use this new, 2500 new sol, loan to buy livestock and assorted merchandise like soft drinks, footwear and jackets.  She tells us that sometimes she sells second hand clothing.  Her son helps her in the business.  Her dream is to have a little house and general store in Puno or Pomata.

What she likes about the communal bank is the chats because she says the women are good at improving in business and she also likes the guarantee and mutual collaboration the members provide for each other.

loans.use: to buy livestock and merchandise like soft drinks, footwear and jackets.

loans.name: Julliet

texts.en: Julliet is married and has four children. She sells men's wear, sacks of water, "gari" (which is made from cassava), and roasted groundnuts at Takoradi, which she has done for 7 years. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Julliet uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenditures. She will invest the loan in the bulk purchasing of men’s wear. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase men’s wear in bulk.

loans.name: Jehazeel

texts.en:
Jehazeel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jehazeel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Jehazeel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jehazeel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises, de 34 años, un hombre bueno y alegre; está casado con Julia. Ambos tienen dos hijos, Hildebrant y Anali , con los cuales vive en una casa alquila, ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. El trabajo primordial de él, se centra en el arado diario de diferentes terrenos de cultivo. Los que realiza gracias al toro que adquirió, hace algunos años, y que gracias a su escasa competencia, le genera muchas ganancias. Pero la actividad que más le gusta, es la agricultura, ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello, sus principales productos se centran en la siembra de papa, arveja y cebada; las que cuida con mucha dedicación y ahínco. En cada campaña agrícola, el apoyo de su banco comunal es muy importante, ya que cada día tiene una producción de calidad. Ahora que no hay lluvias y sus terrenos no son productivos, está trabajando como seguridad en una empresa importante en la ciudad de Oroya, donde espera tranquilo la temporada de sembrío. Por ello más adelante desea sembrar en mayores cantidades, para abastecer la demanda que generar sus productos en esa época. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde asegura que cada cosecha, gracias a su banco comunal le genera mayores ganancias. Además agradece al apoyo de todos los que hacen posible el crédito. Ulises de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de papa y avena.
texts.en:
Ulises, aged 34, is a good and happy man.  He is married to Julia, and they have two children together: Hildebrant and Anali.  He lives with them in a rented house, located in the Huaricolca area.  

His main work is the daily plowing of different farmlands.  He does this thanks to a bull he acquired several years ago, and given there is scarce competition, he earns good income.  However, the work he most enjoys is farming.  He has spent five years farming; his principal products are growing potatoes, peas and barley, which he tends to with much dedication and effort.  The help of the communal bank is very important to each of his agricultural efforts, as he need to maintain a quality production on a daily basis.  Currently there has been no rain, and his farmlands are not productive.  For security, he has been working for an important company in the city of Oroya, where he is calmly waiting for the growing season.

Looking forward, he wants to grow bigger quantities, in order to meet the demand that his products generate in season.

He belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza"  ("New Hope") communal banks, and this is his fourth loan through MFP.  This will assure that each harvest will generate more income, thanks to the communal bank.  He is also grateful for the support of everyone who has made this loan possible.  

On receiving your support, Ulises will invest the requested money in purchasing natural fertilizers for his next planting of potatoes and oats.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 33 años y es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años de edad. Hace dos meses la señora Juana vio la oportunidad de empezar su propio negocio vendiendo queso y crema en su comunidad ya que en su comunidad no hay tiendas que vendan productos de la canasta básica. La señora Juana se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para ir a comprar el queso que vende. Para llegar a la avenida por donde pasa el bus en el que se transporta, ella tiene que bajar una colina rocosa, cruzar un rio, y subir otra colina. No hay puente para cruzar el rio, y el recorrido toma unos 20 minutos. Ella llega donde su proveedor a las 5 de la mañana, y compra 30 libras de queso que transporta de regreso a su casa en bus. Una vez en su casa, la señora Juana divide el queso en porciones de 1 libra y los empaca en bolsas individuales. Para vender el queso y la crema, la señora Juana sale de su casa a las 8 de la mañana y camina todo el día de comunidad en comunidad vendiendo sus productos a pie. Le toma 3 días vender las 30 libras de queso que compra. Desde que comenzó con su negocio ha vendido todo su producto satisfactoriamente, y con un margen de ganancia saludable.

La señora Juana ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de queso e introducir otros productos como frijol, arroz y aceite para la venta. Para ella lo más importante es ser inteligente y tener la costumbre de ahorrar. La señora Juana sueña con abrir una tiendita en un futuro en su casa donde sus clientes puedan venir a comprar sus productos.
texts.en:
Juana, 33, is a single mother of a 4-year-old son.  Two months ago Juana had the opportunity to start a business of her own selling cheese and cream in her community since the community has no stores selling basic foodstuffs.  Juana rises at 4am to go buy the cheese she sells.  To get to the road where she catches the bus she has to hike down a rocky hill, cross a river and climb another hill.  There is no bridge spanning the river and the trek takes her about 20 minutes.  She reaches her supplier at 5am and buys 30 pounds of cheese that she transports back home by bus.  Once at home, Juana divides up the cheese into one-pound portions and packs them in individual bags.  To sell the cheese and cream, Juana leaves home at 8am and spends the entire day going from community to community on foot to sell her products.  It takes her three days to sell the 30 pounds of cheese that she buys.  Since she started the business she’s sold all her product satisfactorily and with a healthy profit margin.

Juana has asked Fundación Campo for a loan to be able to buy a larger amount of cheese and to introduce other products like beans, rice and oil to sell.  For her, what’s most important is to be intelligent and have good saving habits.  Juana dreams with opening a little store at home in the future where her customers can come to buy her products.

loans.use: to buy cheese and other basic foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 24 años; es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo José y su hijo Daniel, de 6 años. En una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Tapo. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura, de eso ya 8 años. En todo este tiempo pudo aprender las técnicas de cultivo como también los conocimientos para poder progresar y salir adelante. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, alverja y habas, los cuales siembra en terrenos de su comunidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder compartir con su esposo las ganas de salir adelante; pues juntos salen a trabajar todos los días en los pastizales. Más le dificulta obtener su propio capital de trabajo, por los gastos que realiza en el alquiler anual de sus terrenos y los estudios de su hijo. Por eso también se dedica a la ganadería con la crianza de sus 40 ovejas y 50 cuyes. Muy pronto cosechará papa y cuenta que después de ello piensa continuar con la siembra del tubérculo; ya que tiene buena demanda. Sus planes son incrementar su ganancia y comprar su propio terreno agrícola, ya que muy pronto recibirá la llegada de su nuevo hijo. Ella está embarazada. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San jerónimo de Queta” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues el apoyo que recibe de su asociación le ayuda en la mejora de sus cultivos. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Nelly, tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “andina” por ello de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
24-year old Nelly is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband José and their 6-year old son Daniel in a rented house in the village of Tapo. Ever since she was a girl she has worked on the land. In those eight years she was able to learn certain skills such as how to make progress and get ahead. 

Nelly's principal crops are potatoes, peas, and beans which she grows in the fields in her community. What she most enjoys is being able to share with her husband the wish to do well; they go to work together every day in the fields. Her greatest difficulty is obtaining sufficient money to pay for their expenses such as the annual rent for the fields and their son's education. For this reason Nelly also raises 40 sheep and 50 guinea pigs. Soon she will harvest her potato crop and plans to then plant yucca for which there is a high demand. In the future Nelly would like to earn more money so she can buy land of her own as a new baby will be arriving soon. She is pregnant.

Nelly belongs to the San Jerónimo de Queta Community Bank and this is her eighth loan with MFP. She feels she has done well because the support she has received from her Association has helped her improve her crops. For this reason she promises to pay back the money punctually.

She is sowing the Andina potato variety and will use the loan money to buy organic fertilizer to spread on the fields.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce, la señora María del Carmen ha sobresalido por ser una dama muy trabajadora que en todo momento ha sabido suplir las necesidades que se han presentado en su hogar.

María del Carmen es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo el cual ha desempeñado su papel de padre y madre a la vez. Cabe señalar que se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en uno de los centros educativos del casco rural del municipio de El Sauce. 

 Actual mente ha acudido a Ceprodel  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de medicamentos para sus hijos y también para gastos de colegiatura de los hijos y compra de vestuario  ya que con esto mejorará las condiciones de vida de su querida familia
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce, señora María del Carmen has excelled for being a very hard-working lady that in every moment has known how to supply the needs that have been presented in her home.  

María del Carmen is a single mother with two children in her care.  She has played the role of father and mother at the same time.  She tells us that she acts as a teacher of primary education in one of the educational centers of the rural center of the municipality of El Sauce.  

At the present time she has approached Ceprodel in order to request a loan for the purchase of medicines for her children and also for college expenses of her children and to purchase clothing, since with this will improve the living conditions of her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, medicine and pay for college expenses.

loans.name: Shaheena's Group

texts.en:
Shaheena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery store business. She operates her business from her home where she sells different grocery items like spices, lentils, soaps etc. to her clients at reasonable rates. With the loan, she will put more groceries in her store that will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time and increase her profits. 

Her husband operates a traditional Punjabi food business selling naan channey (made with chickpeas and served with bread). It is very popular food in the city and he makes good profits. 
 
Shaheena has given birth to six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past 10 years. She is very confident that an investment will be a productive one for her and will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en:
Sam Art is married with three children. She is a 31-year-old farmer. She also raises pigs and sometimes she works for others for additional income. Sam Art has been a farmer for 11 years.

This is her first loan from VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields with good quality and sell for a good price to increase family income, to have some savings for future needs, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba, D. nuevo se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere aumentar en sus ingresos y por eso comprara más maíz por mayor ya que luego subirán los precios, el propósito D. ella es tener lo suficiente para atender a los clientes con su venta D. tortillas y mejorar su negocio. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron a aumentar en sus ventas, ya que tenia disponible la materia prima, esto le permitió tener una mejor calidad D. vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Alba decided again to have another loan because she wants to increase her income, so she will buy more corn wholesale since later the prices will go up.  Her goal is to have enough to take care of her customers and improve her business.  The previous loans helped her to increase her sales, since she had the ingredients on hand.  This allowed her to have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Kibisi Farmers Group

texts.en:
Salome is the facilitator of the Kibisi Farmers group. Her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Salome takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed the family and produce enough surplus to sell. In the recent 2011 season, Salome had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Salome was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Salome and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Salome will educate her children. In 2012, the members of Kibisi Farmers group will each plant maize plots between 0.5 and 1 acre.
In the photograph above, Salome is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elisa;  La socia tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 9 años de edad; la socia se dedica  la agricultura y a la ganadería, la socia tiene vacas, toros y también cria animales menores, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de un torete pequeño para criarlo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un torito.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the 'Virgen Concebida de Arin' community bank which is located in Arin district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

Elisa is 26 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 9-year-old son.  Her business is farming and livestock raising.  She owns cows, bulls, and also raises other animals.  She would like to invest this loan in buying a young bull to raise.  She is requesting this loan to buy a young bull.

Elisa is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying a young bull

loans.name: Emily Viky

texts.es:
Emily es socia del Banco Comunal Lucinda, tiene 23 años, es madre de 3 hijos y socia de Finca desde hace 1 año y medio.
Emily vende frutas en el Grifo de Ayacucho, estudia cosmetología, recuerda que empezó vendiendo comida en el Seguro de Salud, ella poco a poco pudo progresar, en el momento mas indicado recibió la invitación para pertenecer a Finca, ahora esta muy bien pudo cambiar de negocio y se siente mas tranquila, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la campaña navideña traerá juguetes. La meta que tiene es poder terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Emily is a member of the “Lucinda” communal bank.  She’s 23 years old and the mother of three children.  She’s been a member of Finca for a year and a half.  Emily sells fruit in El Grifo Ayacucho and is studying cosmetology.  She recalls that she started out selling food at the health clinic and gradually was able to progress.  At the most propitious moment she received an invitation to join Finca and now she’s very good.  She was able to change business and she feels more tranquil.  She will use the loan to buy toys for the Christmas season.  Her goal is to complete her studies.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: El Papagayo (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los dos socios y las diez socias  del Grupo De  Crédito El Papagayo. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Ellos hace poco y al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse para poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir recibiendo los créditos.

En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 5 años, el mismo que está en jardín de infantes. El marido es mecánico automotriz.

Ella es una joven ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de varias marcas. Trabaja cuatro días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que a esta hora su hijo está en el jardín y así puede realizar mejor sus ventas. Sus productos los recibe en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene más de un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños ya que tiene varios pedidos. Este es el primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en  su negocio.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Los Bosques in the city of Portoviejo, two men and ten women that make up the Communal Bank “El Papagayo” meet every fifteen days. They engage in a variety of business activities such as general retail, providing services, and other trades. A short time ago they learned about the benefits offered by Fundación ESPOIR, so they decided to join together in order to access the loans provided by the organization. This is their first loan as a Communal Bank and they hope to do very well so that they can continue receiving loans.

It is in this place where Sra. Virginia lives. She is 24 years old, married, and has a five-year-old son who is in kindergarten. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Virginia is a young homemaker who sells clothes through catalogs of various brands so that she can earn her own income. She works four days a week by going door-to-door and taking orders. Virginia offers her products on credit and collects payment each week. She takes advantage of the morning hours while her son is at school and has been able to improve her sales. Virginia receives her products at a distribution center. She has been in business for more than a year and has done very well.

Her loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing since she has several orders. This is her first loan cycle with the Communal Bank. Virginia serves as the president and enjoys the speed by which she was able to secure the loan. Her dream is to continue forward in her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, continua vendiendo en su pulperia, en donde su objetivo es invertir mas en productos, ya que tiene poco en mercaderia, ya que ha sido un año dificil para ella,  primeramente se enfermo de sus pies, y luego su hermano murio, en donde tuvo que hacer gastos.
Siempre cuenta con el apoyo economico de su esposo, quien vende productos lacteos, sus hijos trabajando, y hoy con esta nuevo financiamiento desea, comprar en mas cantidad, productos de granos basicos en quintales de arroz, frijoles, azucar, maiz, caja de jabon, bidon de aceite, golosinas, productos de la coca cola, cereales y otros que son mas demandados por los clientes.
Lo cual espera poder seguir equilibrando sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria continues to sell goods in her grocery store, and her goal is to invest in more products as she doesn't have much in stock because it has been a difficult year for her. First, she had a problem with her feet, and later her brother died, and she had to make expenditures. 
She can always count on economic support from her husband, who sells dairy goods, and her working children. And now, with this new loan, she wants to buy in greater quantity goods such as staple grains, large quantities of rice, beans, sugar, corn, boxes of soap, oil, candies, Coca Cola products, cereals, and other things that are in demand from her customers.
She hopes to continue balancing her sales and to have better returns.

loans.use: to invest in staple grains, cereals, and candies so that she will have better sales.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is acquiring a loan to buy timber for furniture making. He is a 43-year-old man living in Masindi-Uganda. He is a carpenter and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his wife and four children. Price fluctuations, inflation, and creditors hinder his business.

Baker dreams of educating his children and saving for a wedding.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 29 years old and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married businessman with two children. One of the children attends school. 

For the last six years David has been running a cereals business. He is a taxi driver himself and therefore he has employed someone to run the business on his behalf. He hopes that his business will grow big and he can be a supplier in the next five years. 

David knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy packing bags for cereals in his shop. The extra income that he will raise will improve his standards of living and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy packing bags for cereals

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M., age 66, was born in Marracuene, one of the districts in Maputo Province. He did not have the opportunity to study because his parents required him to work in the fields at the beginning of the day. When he was young, he left the district where he was born and went in search of a job, and got his first one at a ceramics company by the name of Umpala, which coincidentally was also the name of the neighborhood. He worked at this company until reaching retirement and is now a successful businessman in the neighborhood.

He has a business that is very well accepted and successful, since it is the only commercial enterprise in the neighborhood of around 250 families.

With this loan request, he plans to reinforce the stock of basic products to meet the demand during the Christmas and new year holidays, in order to better serve the clientele in his community of around 250 families.

With this business, in addition to providing a high quality service in his community, he also supports the expenses of his family with five (5) members, including himself, his wife, a child infected with HIV/AIDS and two orphaned nephews, and he employs one (1) recently married young man.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localizaçao: Umpala, Boane Cliente: Samuel M. Sector: Comércio Montante: 15.000,00MTN (577 US$) Aplicaçao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Inicio : 30/11/2006 Periodo: 13 meses

Samuel M., 66 anos de idade nasceu em Marracuene um dos distritos da Província do Maputo, não teve oportunidade de estudos porque os seus pais obrigavam-lhe a trabalhar na machamba quando iniciasse o dia. Quando jovem deixou o distrito que lhe viu nascer e foi a busca de emprego, tendo conseguido o seu primeiro numa empresa de cerâmica de nome Umpala que por coincidência é nome do bairro. Trabalhou nesta empresa ate atingir a reforma e hoje comerciante de sucesso no bairro.

Tem um negocio com muita aceitação e bem sucedido, por ser o único empreendimento comercial no bairro com cerca de 250 famílias.

Com este pedido de empréstimo pretende reforçar o stock de produtos de 1ª necessidade para responder a demanda da quadra festiva natal e fim do ano de modo a servir da melhor forma a clientela da sua comunidade com cerca de 250 famílias.

Com este negocio, para além de providenciar um serviço de alta qualidade a sua comunidade, ele sustenta as despesas da família com cinco (5) membros incluindo ele próprio, sua esposa, um filho infectado pelo HIV/AIDS e dois sobrinhos órfãos e emprega um (1) jovem recém casado.

loans.use: To buy products to respond the clients needs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: I am a single woman, a mother of 6. I am a tailor. I intend to use the loan to diversify and expand my business to enable me to pay for my children’s school fees.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) living in the Bilasuvar district of Azerbaijan. He is 57 years old, married, and has 5 children. He started his business in 1990 with small loans from friends. After that, using the revenues from his business, he was able to expand his business slightly and improve the living condition of his family. He has applied to Agroinvest to borrow $500 to further expand his business by purchasing an additional animal.

loans.use: To buy one more calf

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description:

Mr. Jose has eight years dedicated to the business. He started this activity when he was very young, because he would help his mother in order to obtain income for their home. He sells all kinds of pants, jeans and skirts. His business is located in a market close to his home. What is more he travels to various provinces of Guayaquil also to complete his sales. Jose works from 7 am until 2 pm from Monday to Sunday. He travels one day a week to the provinces to sell his merchandise.

Use of the Loan:

Mr. Jose desires the loan to buy more pants, since he does not account with sufficient capital to invest. He travels to the city of Cuenca to buy merchandise and what is more spends for travel expenses. He desires the poan to be able to travel with more money and in this manner acquire more merchandise which will permit him to give a better sales price to his customers.

Personal Information:

Mr. Jose is 45 years old, is married to Mrs. Monica and they have two children of minor age who are in college. His wife helps him in the business when he goes out to travel. His house has two floors but is in construction. They have a stable home and good family realtions. Mr. Jose aspires to grow his business through loans and in this manner to give a better education to his children and better the quality of life for him and his family.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don José lleva 8 años dedicado al comercio, el inicio esta actividad desde muy joven, porque ayudaba a su mamá para obtener los ingresos para el hogar. El vende todo lo que son pantalones jeans y faldas. Su negocio esta ubicado en un mercado cerca de su domicilio. Además el viaja a distintas provincias de Guayaquil para también realizar sus ventas. José trabaja desde las 7am hasta las 14pm de lunes a domingo. El viaja 1 vez a la semana a las provincias para vender su mercadería.

Uso del Préstamo

Don José desea el crédito para comprar más pantalones, ya que no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir. El viaje a la ciudad de Cuenca a comprar la mercadería y además gasta en viáticos. Desea el crédito para poder viajar con más dinero y de esta manera adquirir más mercadería lo que le permitirá dar un mejor precio de venta a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Don José tiene 45 años, es casado con doña Mónica ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que están en el colegio. Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio cuando el se va de viaje. Su casa es de 2 pisos pero esta en construcción. Tienen un hogar estable y buena relación familiar. Don José aspira crecer son su negocio a través de los créditos y de esta manera darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia

loans.use: Increase his inventory of pants - Incrementar su inventario

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary I. is 36 years old, and is a happily married mother of 4 children. She hails from the urban sector of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years as a secretary of her union. She has a boutique where she sells all kinds of women's clothes and she needs the loan amount of $1175 to buy more clothes for sale. She has been in this business since 1999.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
Miss Leocadia belongs to the Rosales Communal Bank. Her business is located at San Martin de Alao, El Dorado province, San Martin state. Her charisma and working spirit has allowed her to maintain her clients. Her clients have also recommended her to other people. She has her store at home but she preferst to go out to sell at the village town centers. She feels that going to the town centers allows her to have more direct contact with her clients.

With the recent loan given by Manuela Ramos of S/. 2,000.000 (US $667.00) which will be repaid in 6 quotas, she will purchase various assortments of merchandise. The end of the year holidays are coming and it is the time of year when her clients purchase the most. She will assort her business with the purchase of gentleman's dress pants (two dozen of diverse colors), lady's dresses (12 units), ladies', gentleman's and boys' underwear (6 dozens of each), dress polos ( two dresses), dresses and outfits for girls (two dozens) and other clothing items requested by her clients.

She is 48 years old and her adventurous spirit has allowed her to have a better contact with her clients because she is not afraid of knocking on their doors to offer her products. She has four children, two boys and two girls. The two oldest, a girl and a boy, help her sell her merchandise from home.

Her husband works in agriculture. This activity has allowed her to meet more people and increment her sales. She always does her best not to miss an opportunity to increment her client portfolio.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

señora Leocadia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Rosales, su negocio está ubicado en la localidad de San Martín de Alao, provincia de El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Su carisma y espíritu trabajador le a permitido mantener a sus clientes y que ellos mismos la recomienden.
