Karine had a bee allergy and initially kept the animals at a great risk to her health, but during the years of her work she has gained immunity. Karine developed her business on her own land and sells all her honey very quickly, because she has regular customers. With the good income from bee-keeping Karine solves most of her family problems. She is requesting a loan of 450.000 AMD in order to increase the number of bee families she keeps.

loans.use: To pay for additional bee families

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and is married to Eduardo T., a tricycle driver within their village. Her family lives in the beautiful village of Magsaysay Saguday, Quirino. They are blessed with two children: Edwin, who is 26 years old and a college graduate who is an OFW in Dubai. and Joel a 21-year-old 2nd year college student. Helen dreams that her youngest son will also finish his schooling.

Helen sells native cakes, vinegar, home made peanut butter and frozen products in the canteen in their school. Her frozen products and homemade peanut butter are quickly snapped up by her customers.are always quick to be sold out and same with her homemade peanut butter. Her products are in high demand, but she requires more capital in order to have the money for the ingredients for her homemade frozen food, native cakes, peanut butter and other snacks. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase the ingredients she needs to expand production. This increased income will help her see her second child through school.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and increase food production

loans.name: Lucia Otilia

texts.en:
Every day, Senora Lucia P. fills her large basket and sells different types of clothing in a little building, a “caseta”, on the edge of the street. Twice a month, Lucia goes to Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, to buy clothing for her store. She also buys some things from suppliers who stop by her store. She is going to use her loan to buy clothing for men, women, and children. Before she had a permanent location, Lucia carried her goods around the streets of Leon to sell them.

Lucia has had nine loans with Kiva partner, CEPRODEL. The loans have improved her quality of life and also improved her business in small increments. Lucia is married with three school-aged children.

loans.use: To buy clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Greisi

texts.es: Greisi es una socia  dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, madre de un hijo adolescente, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, esta actividad lo realiza en su casa, ya que ella trae de la ciudad de Lima su mercadería para vender. Greisi siente que todo este tiempo, en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su situación económica ha mejorado ya que ahora puede aportar un poco mas en los gastos económicos de su hogar, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es docente de educación. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina” desde hace ocho años.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo invirtió en la compra de blusas y polos para vender a sus clientes. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir de damas, caballeros y niños. La meta de Greisi es tener un minimarket en su casa y también dedicarse a la venta de calzados.
texts.en:
Greisi is a dynamic and hard-working partner who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the region of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and the mother of an adolescent son. She makes a living by selling garments, which she does in her house, after bringing her merchandise back from the city of Lima to sell. Greisi feels that during all of this time, in the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, her economic situation has improved, since she can now contribute more towards the economic expenses of her home. Also, she counts on the support of her husband, who is a teacher. She has been a part of the communal bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" for eight years. The first credit she received was 300 soles, which she invested in the purchase of blouses and polo shirts to sell them to her clients. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which will be used to purchase womens', mens', and childrens' clothing. Greisi's goal is to have a small market in her house and also to sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase womens', mens', and childrens' clothing

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en: Cecil V. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Cecil owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month. In 2009, Cecil joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Cecil is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Eudelia Mercedes

texts.es:
Eudelia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Eudelia es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Eudelia tiene un puesto en el Mercado "12 de abril", donde vende choclo (maiz sancochado), y en las épocas en donde no hay maíz vende papa y huevo sancochado.
Eudelia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas.
Los sueños de Eudelia son seguir trabajando, aumentar su mercadería y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eudelia is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. Eudelia is 45, married, and has three children. Eudelia has a stand at the 12 de Abril Market, where she sells “choclo” (parboiled corn). During the times that there is no corn she sells potatoes and parboiled eggs. Eudelia needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy gas. Eudelia’s dreams are to keep working, to increase her merchandise, and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Creceremos en quechua.
Marina es viuda, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Marina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Marina tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de ropa.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
El sueño de Marina es mejorar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiñarisun”, which means “We Will Grow” in Quecha. She is 48 years old, widowed, and has three children. Marina has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats every day. She plans to start selling clothing.

Marina needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to purchase a variety of clothing. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Teresa Hermelinda

texts.es:
Teresa Hermelinda O. tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos que se llaman Maria Jose de 15 años, Andres Joselito de 13 años, y Danya Victoria de 2 meses.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Teresa trabaja comprando grano, maiz, frejol, y trigo.  Compra los cultivos de los agriculores y los vende.  Hace las compras en los pueblos en la comunidad y en las ferias y vende a un comerciante mayoritario.  Solicita el crédito para comprar grano para el negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es que superen sus hijos y dependan de ellos mismos y no a otra persona.  Asimismo quisiera ganar una casita propia para mantener los hijos ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres.

A Teresa le gusta cuidar de su hijita y mantener la casa.
texts.en:
Teresa Hermelina O. is 38 and married. She lives with her husband and their three children. Maria Jose is 15, Andres Joselito is 13, and Danya Victoria is two months. She belongs to the San Jose de las Orquideas Communal Bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Farmers make up a big part of the community, and their main crops are potatoes and corn. Teresa works buying grains; corn, beans, and wheat. She buys the crops from the farmers and she sells the crops. She makes her purchases in the villages in her community and in the fairs. She sells to a wholesale merchant. She is asking for a loan to buy grains for her business. Her dream for the future is that her children succeed and depend upon themselves and no one else. She would also like to get a little house of her own in which to raise her children. She currently lives in her parents’ house. Teresa likes taking care of her little daughter and keeping house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains for her business

loans.name: Marichill

texts.en:
Marichill B. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Marichill is married. To make a living, Marichill owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marichill has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marichill joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichill is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marichill from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: este cliente es originario de telica, actualmente tiene 3 creditos, de los cuales los ha utlizados en pagos de  modulos universitarios en la preparacion academica personal y para mejoramiento de vivienda
texts.en:
This client comes from the town of Telica. He currently has 3 loans that he uses to pay for university classes for his personal academic training and for making home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials, labor, and paint

loans.name: Nerys Amarilis

texts.es: Nerys Amarilis tiene  26 años, es casada.  tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 4 años, por lo que aquí ofrece productos del consumo del hogar por lo que el inicio poco a poco pues los financiamientos fueron lo más importante para llevar a cabo su objetivo, con las ganancias que obtenía logro obtener mucho más productos, por lo que su negocio le ayudo mucho ahora tiene mucha experiencia con esta actividad. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y jugos. Ella sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nerys Amarilis is 26-years-old and married. She has a small grocery store located in her home. She began her business four years ago and was able to start it bit by bit with loans which were the most important part of achieving her goal. With the money she obtained she was able to purchase more products and this has helped her business a lot over the years. Nerys is asking for a loan so she can buy products such as basic grains, sweets, natural soft drinks, bread, and juices. She dreams of being able to increase her income and have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy grains, sweets, natural soft drinks, bread, and juices

loans.name: Tseinpil

texts.en: Tseinpil is a 50-year-old widow and lives with her three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Tseinpil operates a clothing trading business at a local market. She sells a range of women and men's clothing as well as underwear at her rental counter. She started her business in 2008. Currently she purchases clothing to sell to her customers once every month or two, depending on sales. Tseinpil has strong sales and communication skills. She says, “My dream is one day to open my own factory. In addition, the most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children.” She is requesting a 1,400,000-tugrug loan to purchase a variety of clothing in Ereen, a Chinese border town, to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor P. es un comerciante el cual se dedica a comercializar granos básicos como maíz, frijoles, arroz atreves de su negocio él junto a su familia han mejorado su hogar ya que poco a poco lo han mejorado ya que anteriormente el techo de la vivienda era de tejas y con los créditos brindados por ceprodel  el techo lo han cambiado ha zinc.

Este crédito lo solicita para la construcción de una bodega para almacenar el producto que vende ya que nos comenta que ya en la casa es poco el espacio que le queda para guardarlo
texts.en:
El señor P. es un comerciante el cual se dedica a comercializar granos básicos como maíz, frijoles, arroz atreves de su negocio él junto a su familia han mejorado su hogar ya que poco a poco lo han mejorado ya que anteriormente el techo de la vivienda era de tejas y con los créditos brindados por ceprodel el techo lo han cambiado ha zinc. Este crédito lo solicita para la construcción de una bodega para almacenar el producto que vende ya que nos comenta que ya en la casa es poco el espacio que le queda para guardarlo

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de laminas de zinc , piedra cantera y bolsas de cementos

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Paula es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Paula junto a toda su familia se dedican a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales, productos que venden a intermediarios y mercados. Además Paula tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende mercería.
Paula necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, betún y pila.
Los sueños de Paula son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula, 47, is a member of the Gabriela communal bank. She’s married and has three children. She, together with the entire family, manufactures artisanal weavings that they sell to middlemen and in the markets. In addition, Paula has a stand in the 12 de Abril market where she sells her merchandise. Paula needs a 900 sol loan to buy wool, die and a sink. Paula’s dreams are to improve her business and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, dye and a sink.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun P. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Pring in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Vorn Soem, are farmers who own a plot of land in order to cultivate rice. Her husband also works in a wood factory, where he can receive a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Sokhoeun P. is also a pig breeder at home. To support her farming and pig breeding business, she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides, to pay for a laborer to plow her farm, and to buy pig food for pig breeding.

Mrs. Sokhoeun P.'s husband is in the picture with her. This couple has two children. One child attends the local school, and their youngest child is just 18 months old.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides, to pay for a laborer to plow her farm, and to buy pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr Ángel V. O. se encuentra casado, tiene 5 hijos, viven en la comunidad de Chullpani Grande sobre la carretera Cbba - Santa Cruz zona rural dentro del municipio de Colomi.

Ángel y su esposa Bertha se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papa liza, para vender en  la feria semanal de Colomi según nos cuentan todo lo que llegan a cosechar no solo les sirve como ingreso si no también es su mayor fuente de alimento, Solicitan el crédito a la institución para compra de semilla de haba pues es el mayor producto que se siembra en la zona donde viven.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              El señor Ángel nos comenta que como actividad secundaria se dedica a la construcción de viviendas como albañil, de esta manera poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. Su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro comprar mas terreno para ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ángel V. O. is married and has 5 children. They live in the Chullpani Grande Community on the Cbba-Santa Cruz Highway in a rural region within the municipality of Colomi. Ángel and his wife Bertha grow potatoes, beans, oca (an edible root) and papa liza (a tuber grown in the Andean region) to sell at the weekly market in Colomi. They tell us that what they harvest not only serves as income, but also their main source of food. They are requesting a loan to buy bean seeds as beans are the main crop planted in the region where they live. Ángel tells us that he also works in housing construction as a mason in order to augment his income and to be able to give his children a better life. His dream is to be able to buy more land so that he can grow more crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bean seeds

loans.name: Mrs. Thorn Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn N. is 42 years old and the village bank president. He was selected by the 15 group members located in Andoung Thma village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it for a different purpose. Mrs. Thorn N. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Hoa, are farmers who own one hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mrs. Thorn N. is a pig breeder at home who earns a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income to improve the family's living condition, Mrs. Thorn N. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to dig a pond for fish breeding. This couple has four children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school who also help with their parents businesses. All the members are shown in the photo but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To hire laborers to dig a pond for fish breeding

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda A. is from the village of P-Bularan, Miputak. She is 56 years old and married with 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alfreda operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community.

Alfreda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Alfreda joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional inventory.

Alfreda is requesting her sixth loan, for 10000 PHP, which she will use as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is married and has two children. She first established a foodstuffs business, with a small business capital provided by her husband. She later changed to selling ready-made clothes after accumulating enough money from her first business. Ramatu has been selling ready-made clothes for the past ten years in the Silvanus market, Makeni city.  

Ramatu has a good credit history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to help her buy various types of clothes, so that she can meet the demand of her customers who normally buy more for the Ramadan season. Ramatu intends to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children and buy a vehicle for transportation. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her business.

loans.name: Tacku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TACKU LIGGEY est né le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NDIABOOT

Madame YAH GAYE D.,debout à droite sur la photo, en écharpe noir et foulard rouge sur la tête, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle fait un commerce de riz de la vallée. Elle s'approvisionne à bord champ pour revendre dans sa région à Louga. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 2 ans. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de constituer un bon stock et satisfaire le plus largement sa clientèle.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille, et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Tacku Liggey was created on December 5, 2007. It is made up of 11 women, all from the same neighborhood. The group is a part of the Village Bank of Ndiaboot. Mrs. Yah Gaye D., standing to the right in the photo, in the black shawl and red headscarf, is the leader of the group. She is 56 years old. She is married and the mother of 7 children. She sells rice from the valley. She stocks up in the fields on the edge of town to resell in her region of Louga. She has run this business for more than 2 years. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her supply levels in order to build up a good stock and to satisfy her clientèle to the maximum level possible. Her goal is to support her husband in caring for the daily needs of the family and to strengthen their level of savings.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell local rice

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah M. is a 48-year-old poultry farmer and a saloon proprietor in Shanzu Mombasa. Her husband supports her income and they are blessed with three children. She has been in these businesses for the last eighteen years and her income is great. 

With her second loan from KADET LTD, she would like to buy day-old chicks for her farm, rear them to maturity and sell them . She hopes to use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Annah would like to become a big farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy day-old chicks for her farm

loans.name: Arancy

texts.en:
Arancy G. is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: the buying and selling of Nipa, a type of leaf which is used to make various items, and pig farming. She lives in Toril, Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental, has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has used her membership to improve her life by making careful use of various loans. By working hard and paying careful attention to her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. To continue this improvement, Arancy is applying for a loan, her 11th, for PHP 24,000 to expand her businesses.  She aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon (or honorable) way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand two small businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying 80 lbs. of fish, 1 quintal of rice, 50 sacks of charcoal, 80 lbs. of beef, 100 lbs. of yuca, 60 lbs. of malanga, 80 lbs. of chicken and 100 units of coconuts

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
MARVIN ANTONIO C. C., Trabaja como Oficial de Mantenimiento en el Mercado Israel Lewites.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO : ZINC , PERLINES Y CLAVOS PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en:
This is Marvin Antonio C. C.; he is a maintenance worker at the Israel Lewites market.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials such as  zinc sheets, beams and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to re-roof his house.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena C. M. de 30 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 5 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Carmen posee una venta bastante grande de diferentes tipos de productos como: sopas instantáneas, granos básicos, detergentes, verduras, shampoo en bolsitas, especias y otros más. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual desea salir adelante, es por ello que desea aumentar los productos de su negocio, el cual se encuentra en el mercado municipal de Opico, lo que es muy beneficioso para ella, debido a que es uno de los mercados más grandes del lugar, por lo que las ventas son muy buenas. Carmen solicita un préstamo con el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Carmen Elena C. M. is 30 years old. She lives in San Juan Opico with her husband and 5 year old daughter, who is in school. Carmen sells a lot of different types of products such as: basic grains, detergents, vegetables, pouches of shampoo, spices and more. She is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead. That is why she wants to increase her business' products. Her business in the municipal market of Opico. This is very beneficial to her, since it is one of the biggest markets in the area and her sales are very good. Carmen is asking for a loan with the wish to grow her business and in this way improve her earnings.

loans.use: To buy basic neccesity products

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
A happy home is undoubtedly important to everyone, including Helen M.. A desire for a happy home and a successful business venture is something Helen is working hard to obtain. Evelyn is ever determined to break people's low expectations of her. She is a CCT* community partner and is married to Romeo, an auto mechanic. They live in Caloocan City, Philippines.

Helen's home serves both as an abode of rest and a venue for business, because at her home she has set up a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She sells a wide range of products to the neighborhood, which includes items from rice and noodles to detergent powder and soap bars. With this, Evelyn earns a net average of PHP400 per day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Helen is requesting for a PHP20,000 loan. Adding more products to her store is a priority for her to improve her business, and the money from the loan would certainly be used to purchase these additional products. She looks forward to making the store grow and eventually to expand.

At present, Helen finds it hard to follow up customers who do not pay their debts on time. But just like any other hardworking entrepreneur, Helen sees to it that no challenge will ever wear her out. She dreams of having enough money to sustain the needs of her family, good health, and a happy and abundant life.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Additional inventory for her variety store.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business.  She sells at the market to her neighbours. Mwatime faces a major challenge of seasonality. During hot summer season the cashew nuts supply is low compared to cold winter season.  She hopes to be self reliant in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Lira

texts.en:
Ma. Lira G. is a 24-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: rice retailing and a general store. She lives in Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. For her 7th loan, Ma. Lira is now borrowing PHP 17,000 in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Lira aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell

loans.name: Juana Maribel

texts.es:
Juana tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Vive con su familia en el distrito de Santa Rosa, distrito de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado dentro de terminal pesquero de su zona, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 06 años  aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección la actividad. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona que la estiman y la apoyan.

Juana quiere comprar más pescado, ya que por fiestas, aumentan los pedidos de su clientela, incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, de esta manera sacar adelante a su familia.  Para lograr su objetivo, Juana ha creido conveniente obtener un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa, el mismo que sería el cuarto crédito con la entidad.
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old; she's married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Santa Rosa district, district of Chiclayo, capital of the Department of Lambayeque.

She sells fish at the local fishing station. She has been doing this for six years. She learned the business from her parents, which is to say that she knows the business perfectly. She has an established local clientele who admire and support her.

Juana wants to buy more fish because due to the festivals her customers' orders increase, which increases her sales and earnings. In this way she can help her family move forward. To meet her goal, Juana hopes to get a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. This will be her fourth loan through this organization.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jidaini A

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Jidaini. He is married and has a one-year-old son. In 2008, Jidaini established his medical drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,680,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional medicine.

Jidaini hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 336,000. In the future, Jidaini plans to increase his business by buying even more drugs and building a bigger shop. Jidiani would also like to educate his son in the best possible way. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy additional drugs for resale

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a 52-year old married woman supporting her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, a vegetable-vending operation, and a gasoline retail business. A resident of Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental, Maria Fe has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable, and now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4000.

For her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 15000 in order to purchase more stocks to sell. Her previous loan of PHP 7000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Fe aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en: Ronita is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a vegetable farm. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard on her vegetable farm, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000. Ronita is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ronita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Taku Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKU LIGUEY est créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de TOUBA GUEYE qui abrite ledit groupe. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles sont toutes actives dans le domaine du petit commerce. 

Madame Déguène D. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 23 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend du mil et des noix d'acajou grillés et décortiqués. Elle a une bonne expérience dans la vente de mil et de noix d'acajou pour l'avoir pratiquée de puis plus de 05 ans. 

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter au moins 10 sacs de 50 kg de mil et des noix d'acajou qu'elle va griller et décortiquer avant de les revendre dans les marchés. 

Son objectif est d'acheter de la nourriture (riz, huile, lait etc.) pour la famille, et acheter éventuellement des médicaments en cas de maladie d'un membre de la famille
texts.en:
The Taku Liguey solidarity group has been created at the launch of the Banc Villageois of Tobua Gueye to which this group belongs. The group is composed of 10 women from the same village. They all work as vendors. 

Mrs. Déguène D. (standing to the far right in the photo) is the group’s leader. She is 23 years of age. She is married and the mother of five dependent children. She is a vendor. She sells millet and cashew nuts, shelled and roasted. She has a good experience selling millet and cashew nut, as she has been doing this for over five years. Her loan will allow her to purchase at least ten 50-kg bags of millets and nuts, which she is going to shell and roast before reselling at the market. Her goal is to be able to buy food (rice, oil, milk etc) for her family, and also have enough money to purchase medications should one of her family members fall ill.

loans.use: to purchase ten 50-kg bags of millet and cashew nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs and items for her house

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis K. B. is  fifty-eight years old, married, and a father of six children.   They live in Mosop, in the outskirts of Eldoret town.  His wife, Naomi, is a teacher. Francis is a maize farmer who grows maize for commercial purposes.  He has been in this business for twenty years and gets a monthly income of  KES.10,000.

This will be Francis' fourth loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. With the income from the produce, he plans to pay school fees for his children and buy veterinary medicine for his livestock.

In the future, he would like to be a dairy farmer and also educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and  fertilizers

loans.name: Peter Kinga

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.  He is 47 years old, married to Mary Njeri and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marythza

texts.es: La señora Marythza se dedica a la venta de perfumes y distintas variedades de maquilles y también trabaja como  impulsadota en un empresa de lácteos. El crédito lo requiere para comprar: cremas y perfumes de varón para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Vive en alquiler la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Santa Rosa de la ciudad de El Alto;  es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Marthyza works selling perfumes and various brands of make up and she also works as a product promotor for a dairy. She needs the loan to buy: creams and colognes for men to meet the demand of her clients. She rents her home, which is in the Santa Rosa area of the city of El Alto. She is single and doesn't have children. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: To buy creams and colognes for men for her business selling cosmetics.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 56 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirley has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy motorcycle spare parts for maintenance.

Shirley has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Neefe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité a été créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il est composés de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et pratiquent les mêmes activités (le petit commerce)

Madame Nafissatou (à la droite de la photo levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a en charge onze autres enfants en sa charge confié par ses parents et ses voisins.

Elle s'active dans la vente de fruits et légumes depuis très longtemps. Elle a une bonne maitrise de son activité et de sa clientèle.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses marchandises pour une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et de se procurer plus de bénéfices

Les profits lui permettront d'aider son mari à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille(nourriture, santé) et d'augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 9th July 2002 and is made up of women who live in the same district and have the same activities (small trading businesses).

Nafissatou (on the right of the photo and raising her hand) is in charge of the group. She is 50 years old, married and mother to eight children. She has eleven other children in her care, entrusted to her by her relatives and neighbors.

She has been selling fruit and vegetables for a long time and masters her business and her customers well. This loan will allow her to increase her stock of goods, thereby satisfying better customer demand and reaping in more profit. The profits she makes will enable her to help her husband to improve the family's living conditions (food, health) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Sebastiana Gregoria

texts.es:
Sebastiana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está   casada y tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes).  Tiene grado de instrucción 5to de primaria.
La señora se dedica al engorde de ganados como ovejas y alpacas.  Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con su primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles compró cuatro ovejitas.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles comprará doce corderos para engordarlos por cuatro meses y venderlos en la localidad de Totorani e Ilave.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos y amigos ya que su esposo trabaja de obrero en la ciudad de Tacna.
Además nos cuenta  que se dedica al tejido (esto lo realiza con otro capital).
Su sueño es tener una buena casa y una tienda de ferretería en la localidad de Ilave y Puno.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en: Sebastiana is a member of the communal lender “Virgen de Concepción”, in Ayrumas Carumas, Acora, Puno, Peru.  She is 42, married and has 6 children (two live independently).  She studied until the 5th year of primary school.  Sebastiana raises farm animals such as sheep and alpacas.  With her first loan last year with Movimiento Manuela Ramos of S/. 500.00 she bought 4 sheep.  Now she seeks a credit of S/ 1500.00 to buy twelve lambs to sell in the market of Totorani.  Her sons and friends assist her in her work, as her husband works faraway in the city of Tacna.  She also sews to supplement her income.  Sebastiana hopes to have a better house one day and open a local hardware store.  She enjoys her association with microcredit and especially the gatherings and seeing her projects pay out.

loans.use: to buy twelve lambs to raise and re-sell

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatille is 44 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 and 26 years old. Donatille sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap and so on. Her business is well organized. She employs one person to help her. Her business hours are from 6 am until 7 pm every day except on Saturday and she has 10 years of experience.

Donatille has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more products like juice, rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap and so on to sell. With the profits, Donatille will reinvest in her business and save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more products like juice,soap,rice,sugar,cooking oil,and so on to sell

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria tiene 49 años D. edad, ella vive separada su esposo y vive con su hija que  ya es independiente. Maria resiD. en una comunidad ubicada en la comunidad tranquila del distrito D. Guadalupe  en la provincia distrito D.  Pacasmayo en el departamento D. La Libertad.

Maria se dedica a la  venta D. artículos decorativos para fiestas infantiles (piñateria), haci como también artículos para otro tipo D. fiestas o eventos especiales. Además se dedica la  venta D. ropa  en general, ella se  ha instalado en su propio negocio y desD. allí ella distribuye sus productos, María cuenta con  varios años D. experiencia en el negocio.

María desea aumentar su inventario debido al incremento D. clientela que ha venido experimentando últimamente, por ello quiere adquirir más mercadería para su venta.  María esta  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000  nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo. 

Maria  es una mujer bastante creativa y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacerse mas conocida en el rubro.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old.  She is separated from her husband and lives with her daughter who is independent.  They live in a quiet community in Guadalupe district, in Pacasmayo province, in La Libertad department.

María sells decorations for children's parties (party supplies) as well as supplies for other types of parties or special events.  In addition, she also sells clothes.  She has set up her own business and she supplies her products from there.  She has several years experience in her business.

María would like to increase her inventory owing to the increase in customers that she has experienced recently.  For this reason, she would like to acquire more merchandise to sell.  She is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she plans to use to achieve her goal.

María is quite a creative and entrepreneurial woman.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and become more well known in her field.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for different types of parties

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is 43 years old and married. They have one child who is 10 years old. They want to give him a quality education to the university level. He runs a transport business in Thika where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been running this business for the last four years and has employed three people. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 10,000 to buy auto spare parts to ensure that his vehicle is well serviced and in good condition to do business. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, own a fleet of matatus for his transport business. He describes himself as a very patient man.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo's biggest dream in life is for his son to finish his engineering studies. Eduardo is 50 years old and is married to a loving, patient, and gorgeous woman. They are blessed with six children.

Eduardo is a farmer, and his wife is a housekeeper. Eduardo and his wife manage their corn farming business. Aside from that, Eduardo also manages a hog raising business, while his wife runs a small canteen inside the school in their village. His wife sells snacks like pancakes, juice, and soup.

Eduardo needs additional capital for his eight pigs. He wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He knows that this loan will be a big help for him in supplying the feed to his pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Joel has a food shop that sells snacks like banana cakes, pancakes, banana & sweet potato cues. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Joel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita is 47 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 15 years and earns additional income from growing rice.

Ronita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Duo Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Duo Nueva Esperanza: Isabel.de 55 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de granos basicos desde hace dos años, ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque le ha ido bien en su negocio,y gracias a Dios a progresado mucho en su negocio,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de granas basicos ya que ultimamente sus clientes han aumentado y nececita mas capital para trabajar.el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Duo Nueva Esperanza [New Hope Duo]: Isabel is 55 years old. She has been selling staple grains (pulses) for the past two years. She is very happy because her business is going well and thanks God for the growth of her business. She is requesting this credit to buy staple grains, since the number of customers has increased and she needs more capital to work. Her dream is to have a bigger locale and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy staple grains.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells rice porridge in the vicinity of Elmina in Cape Coast. She is divorced and has two children she is taking care of. Her business is about eight years old. She is responsible for caring for her home. Her loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk and other ingredients to make porridge to sell. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit back into the business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and other ingredients to make porridge

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 28-year-old business lady.  She runs a general shop so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  She also relies on her husband's support in the business.  Previously, she used to sell clothes.

Carolyne is grateful to Faulu Kenya because of the financial support. This has helped her to improve her business. She needs 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize flour, rice, cooking fat, sugar and soap.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, cooking fat, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Sam Ol (in the photo) and her husband, Chheng, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children - three sons and one daughter. 

She is a weaver and her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. She helps in her husband’s farming business when she is free. She is requesting another loan of $300 to assist in her husband’s farming by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide, so he can continue his farming business.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Nelly Ernestina

texts.es:
Nelly, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella tiende una granja de cerdos, inicio con esta granja por el apoyo de su esposo, ya que siempre le apoya en sus proyectos, la granja la tiene en su casa, no cuenta con un horario fijo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y de concentrado, la compra le permitirá ampliar la granja, y estabilizar el negocio.
Su aspiración  es darse a conocer con más clientes, para que aumente la demanda y pueda crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Nelly lives with her husband and two children. She has a pig farm which she began with the support of her husband, who always supports her projects. The farm is at her house. She doesn’t work on a fixed schedule.

Nelly is applying for this loan in order to purchase pigs and feed. This will permit her to enlarge the farm and stabilize the business. Her goal is to become acquainted with more customers so that demand for her pigs increases and she can enlarge her microenterprise.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq, 53, is a hard-working man with plans for the future for his children. Rafiq is married and has four children. All of them are adults. Over the past twenty years Rafiq has bred cattle. 

He applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN, and this is his second loan from AqroInvest CU. Rafiq will use the money to purchase large and small cattle. This will help him increase his profits, and thus attain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase large and small cattle.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en: Claver is 45 years old and married to a businesswoman. He has seven children between the ages of 1 and 22. He has been selling shoes for the last 9 years. Claver would like a loan to buy more shoes to sell. He would like to use the profits to buy a plot of land and a cow.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sell.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es: Bartola, necesita trabajar nuevamente con un préstamo, ya que quiere comprar cáñamo, manguios  y agujas, para continuar en su labor tejiendo hamacas de diferentes medidas y colores, ya que este oficio es el que le provee los ingresos para su hogar, el préstamo anterior le ayudó a comprar materiales para confeccionar las hamacas, dándole lugar a mejorar las ventas y a ganar más clientes.
texts.en: Bartola needs the help of another loan as she wants to buy items such as canvas and needles to continue her work making hammocks in different colors and sizes. It is this trade that provides the income for her home. The previous loan helped her to buy materials to make the hammocks, leading to improved sales and more customers.

loans.use: to buy items such as canvas and needles.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 48 años, hace 8 años formó su familia, junto a Eugenia. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Carlos y Carla a los que crían bajo el seno de un hogar propio, en la comunidad de Santa Rosa Palomar en la provincia de Chanchamayo (Selva central). La agricultura es su forma de vivir, por que le gusta trabajar en el campo. De niño aprendió esta labor gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Cuenta con parcelas de tierras de cultivos en los que siembra café, plátanos y paltas. En todo este tiempo tuvo que afrontar problemas como: las plagas, la baja de precios de los productos, falta de personal humano. Carlos es un padre admirable. Por motivos de trabajo, Eugenia tuvo que partir a la ciudad de Lima, por esa razón se dedica a la crianza y alimentación de sus hijos. Carlos cocina, lava y como si fuera poco también trabaja en el campo. Con la ayuda de personal operario, a quien paga por sus servicios al día, puede agilizar sus tareas agrícolas. Sus ventas son considerables en los meses de mayo y junio. En esos días el precio del café llega a costar a 1 sol y 50 céntimos (precio más alto), siendo muy beneficioso para él y su familia. Carlos ansía comprarse un carro. Con el vehículo ahorrará gastos en transporte de sus productos y de su persona. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 de MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como lo fue antes. A su vez, siente satisfacción de integrar el grupo comunal “Aroma de café”, por el trabajo en equipo.
Carlos invertirá el dinero en el pago de personal para la poda de sus plantaciones y adquirir nuevos viveros de café para una próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Carlos is 48. He and Eugenia started their family eight years ago. They have two children, Carlos and Carla, and are raising them in their own home. The live in the community of Santa Rosa Palomar, in the Chanchamayo province (Selva Central). He makes his living from agriculture because he enjoys working in the field. He learned this work as a child, thanks to his parents' teaching. He has his own plots of land where he sows coffee, bananas and avocado. Throughout the years, he has had to confront challenges such as plagues, low prices, and lack of labourers.
Carlos is an admirable family man. Because of her job, Eugenia had to move to the city of Lima; so Carlos takes care of the children. He does all the cooking and cleaning as if it were nothing, on top of working in the fields. With the help of labourers, whom he pays by the day for their labour, he is able to speed up his agricultural chores. His sales are considerable in May and June. At that time of the year, the price of coffee is around 1 Sol and 50 cents (the highest price). This is very good for him and his family. 
Carlos really wants to buy a car. With this vehicle, he will be able to save on transportation for himself and his produce. This will be his fifth loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual with the payments of his quotas, as he has always been. He is happy to be part of the "Aroma de Cafe" communal bank because of the group work.
Carlos will invest this loan in paying labourers to prune, and in acquiring new coffee plants for the next sowing season.

loans.use: to hire labourers and acquire coffee plants.

loans.name: Nivardo

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Nivardo tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Nivardo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Nivardo requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea desea para la canasta familiar.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] community bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who are trying to get their families ahead.  The majority of the members live and work in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, businesses, the traditional Inti Raymi celebration, and because it is located near one of the seven wonders of the world, Macchu Picchu.

Nivardo is 35 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which he has two children.  He was born in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco and he lives in the beautiful city where he was born.  Nivardo works providing taxi services in the city of Cusco.  He is currently requesting this loan for personal use to purchase staple products for his family.

loans.use: to purchase staple products for his family.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando reside con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad, uno de 10 y otro de 15 años, residen en la zona occidental del país, en casa propia, humilde.  Armando es una persona muy responsable, que siempre se ha dedicado a darle una manera de vida a su familia,  un hombre trabajador que con esfuerzo ha hecho que nunca haga falta el pan en su casa. El piensa que para seguirle dando una mejor vida a su familia, necesita incrementar su cosecha y es por eso que decidió ir a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y herramientas como: Abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y entre las herramientas: Cuma, Bomba, Corbo, Azadón entre otros.  Armando agradece de antemano la ayuda que primero Dios recibirá y esta seguro que tendrá la mejores cosechas del año, y su familia será la principal beneficiada con ello.

loans.use: para la compra de insumos agrícolas y herramientas como: Abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y entre las herramientas: Cuma, Bomba, Corbo, Azadón etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 35 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosie has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosie has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anthonia Osula

texts.en: Mrs. Anthonia Osula 32 years old, married with two (2) children, operates her saloon business in the ancient city of Benin Kingdom in Nigeria. She is a reliable client of LAPO who started her business in the year 2001. She wish that the above amount be given to her to enable her improve on her business

loans.use: To buy driers and materials for her business

loans.name: Tai

texts.en: Living near Yazaki is a blessing for Tai’s business. She makes a hundred traditional cakes, known as faapapa, a day and all of them are sold instantly by employees of the Yazaki Company. Her profit includes two hundred tala for flour and other ingredients for the cakes and three hundred tala for her loan repayments as well as income for herself and the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, foil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and diversify her grocery business.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Mrs. Va S., is 46 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement all the family’s expenses, Va S. has two sources of income. First, she runs a small grocery stand at home and second, she works as a baby-sitter looking after her neighbor’s kids. Together, she can typically make around $5 each day. 
Currently, Va S. needs to increase her inventory by adding more products to meet her clients’ needs, which is why she is asking for the loan to assist her. Thank you for your trust and support.

loans.use: Needs to increase her inventory by adding more grocery products.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Mrs. Khoun S., 53, lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Between them they have 5 children, of which 4 are employed at a company and make $200 per month between them, and the 5th is a student. Her husband works selling sugar cane juice, earning $3.60 a day. Mrs. Khoun S. herself earns $3 a day selling various rice dishes. She is now looking to expand her business by selling a greater variety of rice dishes and also diversifying into soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils and soft drinks for business expansion

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina K. is married and has a 19-year-old son. Their family lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. Galina owns a vending kiosk where she sells women’s clothing in the central trade center. There are always many customers there. Her business is well known in the city for having relatively low prices and good quality clothes. Galina has been in business for 3 years. Presently, she has $10,000 in inventory and her monthly income is about $1600.

Galina has a big responsibility as the only bread-winner in the family. Moreover, she pays her son’s college fees because she wants to give him a good education and have him take over her business later.

Galina would like a loan of $1000 to increase her assortment of inventory and purchase 50 dresses. She is ready to invest more finances and time into her business to see it grow and provide a better livelihood for her family.

loans.use: Increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en: Mehri E. is mother of four children. She has a big family and with her children she sells fabrics the in Spitamen bazaar. She has been working in the bazaar 10 years and started with very little capital. She has worked in various other industries. Mehri sells fabric and has found this business is the most profitable for her family. She is applying for a  KIVA loan in order to increase her goods assortment.

loans.use: Fabric business expansion

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
I. Muhabbat is 44 years old. She's married and has two school-aged children.

Muhabbat has been running her business for three years. She sells children's clothes including national dresses for girls. The store is located in a very busy part of the city. Muhabbat has a pleasant disposition and has many clients. The business is quite stable and the revenue that is generated serves as a significant source of income for the family.

Muhabbat has been a client of IMON for more than 1 year. She's managed to repay all her loans on a timely basis. Muhabbat is requesting an additional loan of $300 to purchase children's winter clothes for her store. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in two months.

loans.use: Purchase additional children's clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
A few months ago, Luz inherited her parents’ small and humble bakery. She learned this noble trade, which she loves so dearly, when she was very young. Because of her affinity, she has been able to move her bakery forward through efforts and perseverance, turning it into one of the biggest and most frequented bakeries in the city. Ms. Luz starts preparing her delicious, assorted breads from 1:00 to 7:00 in the morning, with the help of other people. After distributing her bread in the different shops and shopping centers throughout the city of Ayaviri, she helps her husband Manuel in his cattle business, thus offering their beloved family comfort and well-being. Luz would like to buy a mixer in order to accelerate her efforts as a baker. She appeals to your good heart with that goal in mind. Your generous support will help make Ms. Luz’s plans concrete.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz hace algunos meses heredó la pequeña y humilde panadería de sus padres, desde muy niña aprendió este noble oficio, por el que siente un especial cariño, gracias a esto ahora con mucho empeño y perseverancia está logrando sacar adelante su panadería, convirtiéndola en una de las más grandes y solicitadas de su ciudad.La señora Luz inicia su labor diaria con la elaboración de sus deliciosos y variados panes desde la 1:00 de la madrugada hasta las 7:00 de mañana con apoyo de otras dos personas, luego de distribuirlas en las diferentes bodeguitas y centros comerciales de la ciudad de Ayaviri apoya a su esposo Manuel en su actividad de comercialización de ganado, y así entre los dos tratan de ofrecerles bienestar y comodidad a su amada familia.Con el fin de agilizar su trabajo tiene pensado comprar una máquina batidora, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón.“ Vuestra desinteresada ayuda permitirá concretar los planes de doña Luz”

loans.use: Purchase of mixer

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en: Ernesa is a 24 year old woman from Zenica and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and  he can earn about 850 KM monthly. They get additional money by selling her handmade work. She does stiching and knitting. Ernesa will invest this loan in the amount of 1500 KM for kniting supplies in order to improve their monthly income.

loans.use: Invest in knitting.

loans.name: Farzada

texts.en: Farzada was born in 1969 and is the widowed mother of a12-year-old son. Her monthly salary is 460,00KM, while her son earns 70,00KM monthly. Farzada wants to use her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase both chicken feed and additional chickens in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is single and sells beauty and feminine care products by catalog. She started her business for extra income. She began by selling to her coworkers and family and, little by little, has been increasing her customer base.

She requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy new products. With your help, Julia will be able to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos para la belleza y cuidado femenino por catalogo. Inicio el negocio en busca de un ingreso extra. EIla inicio vendiendo entre sus compañeras de trabajo y familiares y poco a poco ha incrementado su cartera de clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para compra nuevos productos. Con tu apoyo Julia lograra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van P., aged 31, is a mother of two and lives with her husband in the town of Siem Reap, Cambodia. She owns a small fast boat that ferries mostly tourists and some villagers to the island. On average, she earns $6 per day. Her husband is a curator and makes $8 per day. Most of the family live in the countryside and rear animals to earn additional income.

To earn additional income to support the family Van and her husband are requesting a Kiva loan them raise pigs for meat.

loans.use: To rear pigs

loans.name: Sinaua

texts.en:
Sinaua A., 25, is married. She has many years of experience in the Elei printing business. She sells Elei, Samoan screen printed material, to the villagers and the public 2 days per week. She expects to earn a weekly profit of 250 Tala (about 104 USD).

Sinaua is requesting her first loan from SPBD. SPBD loans are Sinaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She plans to use the loan to purchase paint, raw materials, and carved wood designs to make more Elei to sell.

loans.use: Purchase paint, raw materials, and carved wood designs for Elei material

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung N. T. makes and sells Tofu. She had borrowed from Kiva before and has paid back her loan on time. She did her job well and increased her profits. She now requests a new loan from Kiva  in order to increase her business further.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her tofu business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 37 años, es soltera, vive con sus cuatro hijos; Rubén de 17 años, Huber de 12, Annabel de 10 y Yuliana de 2.
Al partir de su natural pueblo de Imata, con tan solo haber acabado la primaria, Beatriz decidió dedicarse a trabajar, lo cual hizo desde su juventud, hasta que hace tres años al haber juntado un poco de capital económico, le alcanzó para poner una tienda de comestibles en su domicilio, desde donde atiende a sus hijos y gana dinero para mantenerlos.A Beatriz le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede compartir con sus vecinos, con los cuales ya hizo amistad y siempre son fieles a su tienda, por otra parte el tener que atender durante todo el día hace que le resulte cansado, pero ella sigue y continuará trabajando hasta lograr todas sus metas.
Beatriz con mucha fe y persistencia trabaja para sus cuatro hijos, con el fin de apoyarlos económicamente para salir adelante, puedan estudiar, ganar dinero y formar sus propias familias.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá surtir su tienda, para vender mucho más, ganar más dinero y poner con el tiempo una librería.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 37 years old, single, and lives with her four children; Ruben, who is 17 years old, Huber, 12, Annabel, 10, and Yuliana who is 2. On leaving her native town of Imata, having only finished her primary education, Beatriz decided to work, which she has done since her youth. Three years ago, she saved up a little capital and managed to open a food store in her home, from which she looked after her children and earned money to support them. Beatriz enjoys her work, as she can share with her neighbours, with whom she is friendly and who are always loyal to her store. On the other hand, having to serve in the store all day long makes her tired, but she will continue working until she achieves all her goals. Beatriz works with faith and persistence for her four children, with the aim of supporting them economically so they can get ahead, study, earn money and start their own families. With the money from the loan she would stock up her store, in order to sell much more, earn more money and, in time, open a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with more merchandise.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
Octavio C. Alcaraz tiene 40 años de edad vive en la compañía Matchi de Roque Gonzalez es tejedor de colchas artesanales y esta casado con la Sra. Vicenta Sánchez hace más de 15 años, tienen dos hijos uno de de 20 años que esta estudiando en la Universidad y el otro de 11 años que esta realizando sus estudios primarios

Se iniciò desde muy joven en esta actividad y su padre se encargaba de la distribuciòn de la producciòn por la zana de de Caaguazù, mas adelante su padre le diò la oportunidad de independizarce ya que por su edad ya no podia realizar el trabajo.

Tomò el desafio y reuniò mas capital , gracias al apoyo de su conyugue y dieron continuaciòn al trabajo, hoy dia tienen muchisimos clientes y con el ingreso obtenido de la actividad consiguieron comprar una motocicleta para trabajar , comprar electrodomesticos y lograron mejorar su casa .

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de (hamacas, frazadas, manteles y sábanas).
texts.en:
Octavio C. Alcaraz is 40 years old and lives in Matchi de Roque Gonzalez area. He is a weaver of artisan bedspreads and has been married to Vicenta Sánchez for more than 15 years and they have two sons, one is 20 years old and is studying at an university and the other is 11 years old and in elementary school. He started his activity as a youngster and his father was in charge of distributing the product in the Caaguazú region; later his father gave him the opportunity to become independent since at his age he could no longer do the work. He took the challenge and gather more capital, thanks to the support of his spouse, and continued with the work. Nowadays he has many clients and with the income generated by the activity they managed to buy a motorcycle for work, to buy electrical appliances and to improve their house. He is requesting this loan to purchase hammocks, blankets, tablecloths and sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths and sheets)

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji, the wife of M. J., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her younger son is just 7 years old. Her daughters stay at home and do household work. 

Kosar baji’s husband buys fruit from a fruit market and sells it in the community. Kosar baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Kosar baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to repair her son’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
