She is joined in her loan group by five more members. Abida baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Suraiya baji and Zahida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy chick peas and rice for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Pheakdey

texts.en: Mr. Pheakdey O. is a 45-year-old who sells gasoline for wholesale or retail in front of his house to his customers across the street in the area of Poypet Commune.  His wife, Mrs. Sarin Pech, is 44 years old and helps her husband’s work and also lives with one son who is a minor and living at home. Both currently earn approximately $11 per day for income to sustain their family’s food. Pheakdey applied for a $1,000 loan to purchase gasoline stores for resale. They live in Banteay Meanchey Province.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline stores for resale

loans.name: Pienita

texts.en:
Pienita and her husband are photographers and videographers that manage a photo/video studio. The income from the studio enables them to support their two daughters aged eight and seven who are both in elementary school. They have a small happy family.

Their business which started its operation in 2003 is doing well. They are always being called upon during special occasions like graduations, nuptials, baptismals, birthdays and other important events. They also offer photo lamination and framing. 

Currently, they are planning to get a loan of PHP15,000 as additional capital for their business. The loan proceeds will be used to buy additional items like photo films, batteries, blank tapes for video recording, and more, which are often being asked by customers from their studio.

Their ultimate goals is for their children to have a better life and to grow with God's guidance.

loans.use: buy items for sale and needed in their photo studio

loans.name: Clariza

texts.es:
La señora Clariza R. se desempeña como vendedora de refrescos naturales preparados por ella misma y además vende gaseosas, jugos y agua estando ubicada en el mercado central de la ciudad de León desde hace varios años. 

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la venta de refrescos de la señora Clariza requiere con urgencia la compra de las gaseosas y la compra de las frutas para preparar los refrescos y es por esta circunstancia que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita dichas compras para su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Clariza R. is a seller of natural refreshments, which she prepares herself. In addition, she sells sodas, juices and water in the central market in the city of León, where she's been for several years. As it is for all growing businesses, the sale of Clariza's refreshments urgently requires the purchase of sodas and fruits needed to prepare the snacks. It is for this reason that she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow her to make these purchases for her business that so greatly requires the investment.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and fruit to make refreshments

loans.name: Amanullah

texts.en: Amanullah is the son of H. and lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a businessman and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He has a retail shop. He would like to advance his business and make some changes in it. He wants to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He says that this is a wonderful program that can support all entrepreneurs to start and sustain a business.

loans.use: Buying more materials

loans.name: Fawe Secondary School, Waterloo Group

texts.en:
These folks are teachers at the Forum for African Woman Educationalists (FAWE). This is a Junior Secondary School with classes I – III. It was built for girls in September of 2005 by FAWE, a local NGO, for the promotion of the girls' education. The school has a total number of 296 pupils and with a staff of nine teachers and two security guards.

Last academic year, the school sent thirty-three candidates for the Basic Education Certificate Examination (NPSE) and twenty-six candidates passed with flying colors. This was a very good result by national standards. FAWE, a donor-supported school, is the only school in Waterloo small-town that teaches basic computer skills to its pupils. However, to assist other schools, FAWE allows pupils from other schools to take computer lessons in their school.

Teachers and other professional workers come to SMT to seek loans for different reasons. For some, since salaries are usually very small, they are prompted to engage themselves in businesses to supplement their meager salaries. Others, however, can not directly do business themselves; rather, they will invest whatever little they have into their wives’ businesses. Some seek a loan in order to pursue further studies or to pay school fees for their children. And others want a loan in order to buy pieces of furniture like chairs or a bed. Some want to either start building a house or continue with a house-building project they have already begun. It is for some of these reasons that teachers from FAWE have come to SMT to seek a loan.

Aminata Victoria L. (first row, second from right) is the acting principal of the school. She has been in the teaching profession for thirty-three years. She was born in Songo, about eight miles from Waterloo. She is fifty-five, a widow with five children. Two of her children are grown-ups, one is in his second year in Fourah Bay College, University of Sierra Leone, the next is in Port Loko Teacher’s Training College and the last is in secondary school. With this loan, Mrs. L. will pay for her two children in college. This will make her a happy woman as she was having sleepless nights wondering where to get the money to pay her children's fees.

Note: SMT has just opened a new branch in Waterloo and teachers of FAWE are the first individuals to collect a loan from this branch. Waterloo is twenty miles (32 km) from Freetown.

loans.use: Pay college fees for children

loans.name: Yesenia Aparicia

texts.es: Doña Yesenia tiene una pulpería desde hace cinco años, que comenzó  a mucho esfuerzos con ahorros que su esposo dio. Luego ha venido incrementando su inventario con dinero que Afodenic a otorgado lo cual da gracias al apoyo de la institución por que se ha beneficiado en lo personal como el negocio. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, reside en campo bruce en la ciudad de Managua, tiene tres hijos, dos están estudiando. Su esposo trabaja como taxista en un carro que tiene lo cual es de mucho apoyo para su hogar. Con este crédito quiere comprar productos básicos, enlatados, en cantidad para este mes de la semana santa que las ventas son mejores. Sus planes es poder mejorar la infraestructura del negocio para dar mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Yesenia has had a small grocery store for five years. She started with a lot of effort with savings that her husband gave her. She has increased her inventory with money that Afodenic has offered her, and she thanks the institution for the support because she has benefited both personally as well as with her business. She is 36 and lives in Campo Bruce in the city of Managua. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and provides a lot of support to their home. With this credit, she will purchase basic products such as canned goods in large quantites since this month is semana santa (Holy Week) and sales are better. Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her business to be able to give better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda O. ventured into the “sari-sari” (convenience store) business in order to help her husband. Her husband is a farmer and a fisherman. She lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental and has 4 children. Today, she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional goods for her sari-sari.

Erlinda is a MIGS member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has already received several loans. She got additional working capital from the Coop in August, 2004. The proceeds of the loan were used for tuition fees for her children and fertilizers for the farm. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC because she was able to continue her business and send her children to school. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Magid

texts.en:
Magid has owned a grocery store since 1993. He is a 37-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. He has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Magid has requested a loan.

Magid carries a great variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Bach Thi

texts.en:
L. Bạch Thi makes a living from raising a variety of seafood for sale. She is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children. L. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her situation and enable her to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. L. is now requesting a loan of 13,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

No. 1602050079.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Test

texts.en: T.

loans.use: Test

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr:
Z. Paul  est né vers 1977 au quartier Latchè dans la Commune  d'Avrankou dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Paul réside dans cette Commune  d'Avrankou depuis son enfance et il y mène son activité. Paul est marié et père de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) scolarisé. 

Paul mène comme activité la coiffure ; mais en plus, Paul fait de l'agriculture comme activité secondaire. Paul a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en a actuellement pour équiper son salon de coiffure  en vue d’offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle et de faire plus de revenus pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire mieux les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paul Z. was born around 1974 in the Latchè neighborhood, in the city of Avrankou (Ouémé Department). He's been living there since his childhood. He's married and the father of two children, out of which one attends school. Paul is a hairdresser in Avrankou, but he's also a farmer as a secondary job. He needs more financial needs than what he's got today, in order to equip his hair salon to provide better services to his clientele. This will enable him to turn a higher profit, and to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipments and products for his hair salon

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith R. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is a 42-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Bernadith owns and operates a business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and daily use products in the local community through her store. Bernadith has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bernadith joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadith is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Liberty Group

texts.en:
Regina is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has two girls and one boy and all are currently in school. For five years, she has been a baker and uses flour for her production. In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes bread, cake, meat pie, plantain chips, etc., and sells them to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers and people also take bulk delivery from her. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children education. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Liberty’. She is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Help Us Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatmata B., Yeabu W., Hawa S., Hawa S. and Jeneba S.. They named their group "Help Us." This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in quality and quantity. Consequently, sales and profits will improve for these entrepreneurs.  As such, they will be in a better position to look after their families and meet their educational, nutritional and medical needs.

Fatmata B. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka thirty-three years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for more than ten years. She sells market food. She will invest this loan in her market food business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es:
La señora ROSA GLADYS R. L., tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LOS JAZMINES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Rosa GLADYS se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios, como: arroz, menestras, fideos, azucar, verduras, gaseosas, jugos, papas, etc.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, lo invertió para comprar dos vitrinas, para su tienda de comestibles. 
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles, lo utilizará para comprar mas productos alimenticios para surtir la tienda de comestibles (arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, etc.) y tener todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan.
ROSA, sueña con ampliar su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Gladys R. L. is 37 years old and lives in the Moche district, province of Trujillo, La Libertad state, Peru. She belongs to the Communal Bank Los Jazmines. The entrepreneur has studied up to the last year of high school. She has two children, who financially depend upon her.

Rosa Gladys is dedicated to the selling of food products, such as rice, soups, noodles, sugar, vegetables, soft drinks, juices, potatoes, etc. She used her first 300 new soles loan to buy two showcases for her food shop. This 800 new soles loan will be used to buy more supplies for her shop (rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.), so that she’ll have all of the products that her customers ask for.

Rosa dreams of growing her business, thereby obtaining higher profits.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy food products to supply her store

loans.name: Fausta's Group

texts.en:
N. Fausta is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 47 years old and married with four children aged 24 to 18 years. She cares for her parents in Bajjo.

Fausta has been a businesswoman involved in the sale of charcoal for four years now and she is able to make 20,000/= a week as profits. This has enabled her to look after her family. She also sells green bananas from the same stall and the strategic positioning of her business is key to its success. She strives to ensure that her businesses grow more to enable her to pay her children’s school fees until they are done with studies.

Fausta needs a loan as increased capital so as to be able to boost her business, especially to buy more bags of charcoal and green bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and green bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Al-Nelia

texts.en:
Al-nelia C. is from the village of P-9, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 32 years old. Al-nelia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Al-nelia owns & operates a specialized retail business selling purified water and offering Beauty Salon services in the local community. Al-nelia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Al-nelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Al-nelia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Al-nelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Soraida Azucena

texts.es: La señora Soraida Azucena G. F. vive sola con sus hijos ya que su esposo se fue a las Estados Unidos a trabajar y este le manda dinero para los pagos familiares e imprevistos que sucedan, ella labora para una empresa de promotora desde hace 2 años. Ella esta al cuidado de sus hijos y del hogar; y en estos momentos su hijo se ha enfermado y ella por lo mismo esta tramitando este crédito para la consulta de un medico particular y medicamentos.
texts.en:
Señora Soraida Azucena G. F. lives alone with her children, since her husband went to the United States to work. He sends them money for household and incidental expenses. She has worked for a firm that does sales promotions for 2 years. She takes care of her children and the home; recently her son became sick. For this reason, she is taking out this loan to consult with a doctor and to buy medications.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expenses of a medical consultation

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Mrs. Fely L. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, is married, and is blessed with two school-aged children.

Fely owns and operates a business selling of variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years earning 5,000 PHP net monthly.

In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to access its programs and services.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 43 años de edad y es madre soltera. tiene una tienda de abarrotes. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Rosa es secundaria  completa, tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para invertirlo en su tienda.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener un locutorio, y una tienda donde pueda vender artefactos electrodomésticos.  Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana , las reuniones y la puntualidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 3 de Mayo Communal Bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a 43 year old single mother. She has a grocery store. She completed high school, and she has two children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to invest in her store. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy groceries like sugar, rice, and noodles, etc. Her wish for the future is to have a telephone booth and a store where she could sell electro domestic appliances. Her biggest wish is that her children become professionals. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings that she gets, the meetings, and the punctuality of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of Cabaruan,Naguilian,Isabela. She is 29 years old and married. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Evelyn earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es casada tiene tres hijos, es oriunda de Chone al norte de Manabí y vive en Montecristi una bella localidad rodeada de mucha artesanía, se radicó hace cuatro años y  actualmente viven en casa de sus suegros pero espera poder llegar a tener su propia vivienda ese es uno de los sueños. 

Nuestra socia esta muy contenta trabajando con la Fundación pues gracias  los prestamos ha podido superarse en el aspecto personal y laboral y aspira seguir haciéndolo para el bienestar de su familia.
Ella vende en el bar de una escuela a la hora de recreo de 21H00 a 21H30  de lunes a viernes, además se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa, con los préstamo obtenidos de la Fundación ha logrado incrementar sus negocios por lo que ya tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes principalmente de Montecristi y Manta,  la mayoría de ellos son sus familiares y vecinos; nuestra socia viaja cada dos meses a Guayaquil para adquirir la mercaderia directamente de los distribuidores y obtener un poco mas de ganancia, una vez que entrega los pedidos espera reunir el dinero y seguir comprando para satisfacer los pedidos de su selecta clientela.

Ahora invertirá todo el crédito en sus dos negocios, comprará pan, papas, confitería, colas y más para abastecer su bar y además adquirirá  pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa interior de mujer para su negocio de ropa.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is married and has 3 children. She is a native of Chone, to the north of Manabí, and currently lives in Montechristi, a beautiful area where many handicrafts are produced. She settled there 4 years ago, and now lives in the home of her in-laws, but she hopes to eventually have her own house; this is one of her dreams. She is very pleased to work with the Foundation; thanks to the loans she has taken she has been able to improve herself both personally and in her work. She hopes to continue working for the welfare of her family. She sells at a snack bar during school recess from 12 to 12:30 from Mondays to Fridays. In addition, she sells clothing in the streets. With the loan she obtained through the Foundation she has managed to increase her business. Now she has various orders from her customers, principally from Montechristi and Manta; the majority of them are her relatives and neighbors. She travels every 2 months to Guayaquil to acquire merchandise directly from the distributors to increase her earnings. Once she collects the orders she hopes to gather the money and continue buying to satisfy the orders of her select clientele. Now she will invest the loan in her 2 businesses; she will buy bread, potatoes, candy, and soft drinks to supply her snack bar, and in addition she will acquire pants, shirts, blouses and women's underwear for her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bread, potatoes, candy, and soft drinks, pants, shirts, blouses and women's underwear

loans.name: Las Fatiguillas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Fatiguillas” esta representado por la señora Janet  y conformada por 15 miembros que han empezado en su 1er  ciclo, la mayoría son de la misma zona y se conocen bastante bien de manera que es un grupo muy solidario por que entre todas se ayudan para que el grupo marche bastante bien, los integrantes  son 10 mujeres y 4 varones.  Entre las actividades que realizan las socias podemos mencionar la venta de comida, manjar blanco, ropa cosméticos y el servicio transporte público de moto taxis y automotores. La competencia entre las socias esta realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta de cosméticos y de ropa, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y experiencia salen adelante en sus negocios ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito es poder hacer crecer sus negocios con la adquisición de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a  generar una mejor ganancia para el mantenimiento de sus hogares y para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayoría de las socias son personas, nuevas que ya conocen el producto por lo que se encuentran entusiasmados por el apoyo económico ya que muchos de ellos tienen grandes proyectos que desean realizar a futuro y saben que si cumplen con sus pagos en forma responsable contaran con el apoyo de la fundación siempre que lo requieran.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank “Las Fatiguillas” is represented by Ms. Janet, and made up of 15 members who are in their first loan cycle. Most of them are from the same area, and know each other quite well as it is a very united group that helps each other out in order to get ahead. The group consists of 10 women and 4 men. Among the activities they undertake, we can mention the sale of food, clothing, beauty products, and public transportation. Competition among members is difficult, particularly when it comes to the sale of clothing and cosmetics. However, thanks to their efforts and experience, they get ahead with their businesses given that supporting their families is dependent on it. The purpose of the loan will be to help them to grow their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, supplies, and work tools. This will help them generate more income, and therefore allow them to better maintain their homes and improve the standard of living for their families. A majority of the members are new, and know their products very well. They are enthusiastic about being able to access credit, since many of them have large-scale projects they would like to realize in the future. They know that if they make their payments on time, they will be able to count on the foundation’s future support as needed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lourdes Evelin

texts.es:
Lourdes Evelin G. L. tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, y no tiene hijos.  Vive con sus padres y 2 otros hermanos.  Son 6 hermanos, los demás ya son adultos y se fueron de la casa de los padres.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Actualmente Lourdes está estudiando Secretariado Ejecutivo en la Universidad de Bolivar.  Los fines de semana ayuda a sus padres en la agricultura a sembrar y cosechar sus cultivos de maiz, papas, habas, y arvejas.  De vez en cuando sale a ayudar a sus padres con las ventas de los productos en las ferias de San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, liquidos, y abonos para ayudar a sus padres en la agricultura.  Su sueño para el futuro es llegar a tener su propia profesion y conseguir trabajo.  También quisiera conseguir otra carrera en la universidad pero debido a la situación economica, eso no siempre es posible.  Le gustaría estudiar en otro pais pero actualmente los padres ya tienen que gastar entre todos los hijos y no es una posibilidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes Evelin G. L., 21, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and two siblings. They are six siblings but the rest are already adult and don't live with their parents anymore. She is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are corn and potato farmers. Lourdes is studying in Bolivar University to become an Executive Secretary . On weekends, she helps her parents to plant and harvest corn, potatoes, beans and peas. Sometimes, she accompanies her parents to the San Miguel market to sell their products. She is asking for funding to buy liquid fertilizers and manures to help her parents with their crops. Her dream for the future is to have her own career and to get a job. She would also like to study a second profession in the university but, due to the economic situation, this isn't possible. She would like to study in another country but her parent's already have to spend a lot with all the children so this isn't possible, either.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Darng

texts.en: Darng S., 62, grows rice and raises chickens and pigs.  She lives in Take province. She is married with two married children, who are employed as garment factory workers. Her husband is a bicycle repairman. She and her husband typically make a combined income of about US$5 each day, and would like a loan to expand her husband's business. In order to increase the family’s profits, she is asking for a US $600 loan for her husband to purchase mechanic tools. Darng S. is pictured with her husband and her grandson.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic tools.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Bernardo es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Bernardo junto a su esposa tienen un cafetín en donde vende golosinas, comidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Bernardo necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Los sueños de Bernardo son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Bernardo is married, 34-years old and has 2 children; Bernardo and his wife have a small café where they sell snacks and food every day. Bernardo needs a loan of 1250 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of snacks. Bernardo’s dreams are for his children to become professionals, and to have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy snacks.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de doce años a la confección de vestidos y blusas. El confecciona estas prendas para luego vendérselas a un comerciante mayorista que le hace pedidos por temporadas, este negocio es una fuente importante de ingreso a la economía de su familia, adicionalmente cría y vende animales para ayudar a solventar los gastos familiares.

La calidad con la que realiza su trabajo le ha hecho muy conocido y cada vez tiene más pedidos por realizar, por este motivo el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de hilos y telas para seguir confeccionando prendas y poder satisfacer la demanda por sus servicios.

Marcial es un padre responsable y bastante entregado a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza. En la imagen aparece junto a su esposa y una de sus hijas mostrando los productos que suele confeccionar.
texts.en:
Marcial is 37 years old, married and responsible for 3 children. He lives with his family in the Muy Finca sector of the Mochumí disctrict, in the Lambayeque province which is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over twelve years, he has sewn blouses and dresses. He makes the garments and sells them at a major shopping center that assigns him seasonal orders. This business is an important source of income for his family. In addition, he also raises and sells animals in order to help pay the family’s expenses. The quality of his work has made him very well known and each time he receives more and more orders. For this reason he is soliciting a loan of 800 Nuevos solves from Edpyme Alternativa. He is thinking to use the loan to buy thread and fabric in order to continue sewing and be able to satisfy the demand for his services. Marcial is a responsible father and is very devoted to his family. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem and consider him a trustworthy person. In the photo, he appears next to his wife and one of his daughters and is showing the products he makes.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dressmaking materials (fabric and thread) in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Dembagnouma ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Gonido, un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fana (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font essentiellement le commerce du charbon de bois, la vente de galettes et de grains de céréales telle Fatoumata Z..
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, les femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé par Fatoumata Z., pour constituer un important  stock de céréales sèches (maïs, mil, petit mil, fonio etc.) 
Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les environnants auprès des producteurs et grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente sur place (à domicile), au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women from the Dembagnouma group are on average 33 years of age and have three children each. They all live in traditional extended families in Gonido, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fana (Second administrative region of Mali). These women met each other through ties of kinship and sell mostly wood charcoal, flat biscuits and cereals as Fatoumata Z. does. After having fully reimbursed their first loan, the women form the Dembagnouma group are now on their second group loan. This loan will be used by Fatoumata Z. to build up a large stock of dried cereals (corn, millet, fonio etc.). They get their supplies locally and around the village from producers and wholesalers. They sell locally (from their home), at the Tingolé market and at the neighboring fairs. They sell for cash and on credit to customers who are women and men. They are each planning to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 Francs CFA. It will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in the activities.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales 5 son menores de edad. Este trabajador hombre se dedica a la agricultura; siembra habas, alverjas, papas y cebada. Cada día cuida sus campos durante las mañanas, porque sabe que el trabajo requiere de mucha dedicación, para que la cosecha sea todo un éxito y pueda venderla a los mayoristas de la zona, que le pagan muy bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque la agricultura es lo que aprendió desde  muy joven y es la mejor herencia que puede dejarles a sus hijos. Cuando la producción aumenta, sus hijos mayores la ayudan en la recolección, pues el resto del tiempo estudian en la ciudad. Como Raúl es un hombre que se proyecta al futuro, tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad habas y alverjas, ya que los precios de estos productos se mantienen estables en el mercado, además quiere empezar con la crianza de mayor cantidad de animal vacuno. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, además dice que su grupo de trabajo es uno de los mejores, pues todos los integrantes se mantienen puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas y esto les permite continuar adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar algunas cabezas de reses para engordarlos y venderlos luego.
texts.en:
Raúl, 42, lives in his own home with his 6 children, 5 of whom are still minors. This hard-working man is a farmer; he grows broad beans, peas, potato and barley. He tends to his crops every morning because he realizes that this work requires a lot of dedication so that the harvest will be completely successful and be able to be sold to area wholesalers at good prices. He enjoys his work very much because he learned farming from a very young age and it’s the best legacy he can leave his children. When production is large, his older children help with the harvesting but the rest of the time they go to school in the city. Because Raúl is a man who looks to the future, he plans to plant larger amounts of beans and peas because prices for these items are stable in the market; besides, he wants to start to raise more cattle. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he says that his group is one of the best ones because all the members are punctual with their payments and this allows them to continue forward. He will use the requested funds to buy a few head of cattle to raise for subsequent sale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Lucia Enole

texts.en:
Lucia Enole N. is 66 Years old. She is married to Francis N. and the mother of two children. Lucia has farmed her own piece of land for the last twenty years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her first loan of ten thousand shillings which she will use to prepare her land to plant maize and beans. Maize does well in her area due to good climate conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Lucia's dream is to build a nice house and educate her grandchildren. Lucia is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to prepare land to plant maize and beans

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda Q. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Rosalinda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yesu Nti Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Emelia describes herself as a hard-working woman who loves sales and serving customers. She is 54 years old and she is the leader of the “Yesu Nti” (translated as 'Christ’s sake') borrower group, made up of ten members.  Emelia trades in 'kente' cloth, the business through which she has made income to support her family for the past 20 years. Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors, usually worn on special occasions like festivals, parties, out-door events and other social gatherings. 

Emelia is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of kente cloth in bulk to expand her market. Emelia also engages in cocoa farming as her second business. She hopes to mobilize more savings to rent a shop to showcase her kente cloth and improve her business.

Emelia is married to a farmer with four children from age 14-22 years. She hopes to secure university admission for her first born. The other members of the group are also traders in kente cloth, smoked fish, and cosmetics. They live in the same suburb of the community and as the leader Emelia ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Walter Carlos

texts.es:
Walter tiene 28 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján, un distrito con movimiento comercial moderado que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para efectuar servicio de transporte), el brinda su servicio en el distrito donde vive y en los anexos y ciudades que lo rodean, como esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta el trata de mantenerse en el negocio brindando su servicio de la mejor manera posible.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad movil y el estado accidentado de la mayoría de carreteras del lugar han hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños en su motor que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para poder reparar estos daños y brindar el mantenimiento que su vehículo necesita, Walter ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Walter es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 28 years old and lives with his family in Paiján, a district with moderate business activity located in the Ascope province of La Libertad region. It is 2 hours from Chiclayo city, capital of the Lambayeque region. He works as a mototaxi (motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle attached to a cabin) driver, transporting cargo and passengers. Walter works in the district where he lives and in the surrounding districts and cities. This activity is his only source of income and he takes it seriously, providing the best service possible. Walter is legally able to use his vehicle. The rough condition of the roads has caused some problems with his motor, which require urgent repair in order to keep running. To repair the damages and keep his vehicle well-maintained, Walter has requested a 1,000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Walter is a hardworking man. His greatest wish is to keep working to be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Being a mother at the age of 19, Maricar E. is really doing her best to provide for the needs of her infant child.To make a living, Maricar raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maricar has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) whenever she sells a raised animal. Maricar's family is living in the city of Rizal Santiago. In 2010, Maricar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Maricar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Orlando Jesús

texts.es: El señor Orlando Jesús G. F., tiene 37 años de edad vive en el Barrio la Francia es casado y su esposa trabaja en el comercio, generando ingresos y apoyando económicamente a los gastos que se incurren en el hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que actualmente están estudiando, el señor es agricultor y tienen más de 10 años de experiencia en realizar esta actividad, fue con la ayuda de sus padres que logró adquirir una finca en la que ahora realiza sus siembras, y es para lo mismo que desea invertir en la compra de materiales agrícolas, con el propósito de mejorar la producción de las cosechas, este apoyo económico le brindará mejores resultados en su negocio que le permitirán una favorable condición económica que beneficie a su familia y como padres puedan tener los recursos para invertir en la educación Universitaria de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Orlando Jesús G. F. is 37 years old and lives in the Francia neighborhood. He is married and his wife works as a merchant, generating income and helping to cover the household expenses. They have three teen-aged children and all of them attend school. The gentleman is a farmer and they have more than ten years experience with this activity. He was able to obtain his farm, with his parents’ help, and he now raises his crops there. He would like to invest in farm supplies so that he can have a better harvest. This economic support will allow him to have better results with his business and will help to provide better economic conditions for his family. As parents, this will also allow them to have the financial resources to invest in their children’s university education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia K., age 30, sells charcoal from her home. She is requesting a loan in order to be able to stock more bags of charcoal. She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she will be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Djabirou

texts.fr: marié et père d'un enfant, monsieur D. exerce  comme activité le commerce de bois de chauffage,il est un homme à exercer ce commerce, ce qui pousse la curiosité des gens qui viennent acheter chez lui. sa clientèle est grandissante, il doit renouveler son stock pour bien les satisfaire. il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l'achat dune dizaine de tas de bois de chauffe. il s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays.
texts.en:
Married and the father of one child, Mr. D. is engaged in the selling of firewood. He is the man to have this business, which rouses curiosity in the people who come to his home to buy. His clientele is growing and he has to replace his stock in order to satisfy it. He is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy about ten stacks of firewood. He stocks up in the interior of the country.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Naluvule Rural Women's Association-Kampala Group

texts.en:
35-year-old N. Dorothy, who belongs to Naluvule rural women’s group, Kampala, radiates warmth, a sparky sense of humor, and above all good relationship skills. These have been virtues that have for the last decade championed her cause in her charcoal sales business in Naluvule-Kampala. 

With no prior business experience, this happily married mother of 10 knew the aforementioned attributes would come in handy, especially in helping her obtain a footing. In a week, she makes shillings 50,000 and with this loan she wants to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lecenia

texts.en:
Lecenia Y. is a 45 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store business. She lives in Purok 4, Brgy. Talavera, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loan to make her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000.

Lecenia is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lecenia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive en la parroquia de Ricuarte. Ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca, su población se dedica a agricultura y cría de animales, también laboran en  diferentes áreas de trabajo en la ciudad de Cuenca, su iglesia es un  atractivo turístico así como la gastronomía que se prepara en el sector.

Nuestra socia tiene  una tienda de abarrotes hace 6 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las cinco y media de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche. También de  jueves a  domingos vende un delicioso sancocho (sopa típica de yuca y choclo).
 
Doña María tiene 45 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Tiene casa propia la misma que es herencia de sus padres.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 6 años y los créditos le han ayudado en el crecimiento de su tienda, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, aceite, etc.
 
Su sueño es  que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the Las Flores communal bank and lives in Ricuarte parish located in the northeast of Cuenca canton.  The population is mostly dedicated to farming and raising animals although they also work in various jobs in the city of Cuenca.  Its church and the local gastronomy are tourist attractions.

She has had a grocery store for the last 6 years.  She is open from Sunday to Sunday from 5:30am until 10pm.  Also, from Thursdays through Sundays she sells a delicious “sancocho” (typical regional manioc and tuber stew)

María is 45 years old, single and has a 16 year old son who goes to secondary school in the city.  She has her own house which she inherited from her parents.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years and the loans have helped her store grow.  The new loan will be used to buy products like: rice, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Her dream is that her son becomes a professional.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sweets and wood to help her husband who is a bricklayer

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 60 years old. Rosita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2010, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma R. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Vilma is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Jyambere Mugore Group

texts.fr: Marie Gorette M. est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du group Jyambere Mugore.  Elle a 28 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 5 ans.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 6eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 300kgs de pommes de terres et intra-agricoles pour son agriculture a Rubavu.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir la capacité d’autofinancement, est d’améliorer des quantités pour son affaire.  Elle voudrait s’autofinancer, assurer le bien être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Marie Gorette est aussi élévatrice des vaches.
texts.en: Marie Gorette M. is a farmer and a member of the Jyambere Mugore group. She is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children between 2 and 5 years old. Two of her children go to school. She attended school until the 6th year of primary school. She will use her loan to purchase 300 kilograms of potatoes and agricultural inputs for her farm in Rubavu. Her strategy for business growth is to become self-financing and to improve the output of her business. She would like to be self-financing, ensure her family’s well-being and pay for her children’s school fees.  Marie Gorette also raises cattle.

loans.use: To purchase 300 kilograms of potatoes

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Vende leche de vaca que ordeña de sus propias vacas, actividad que lo realiza desde hacia varios años. Su familia la ayuda en esta actividad, llevan a pastear a sus animales en el campo, asimismo la alimentan con el forraje que ellos mismo producen. Por otro lado, elabora quesos, producto que es llevado a vender en las ferias comerciales de su localidad, de esa manera logra tener ingresos semanales o quincenales. Considera que su trabajo es rentable por lo que continuará dedicándose a la venta de leche, ya que desea más adelante tener una vaca más.  Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales.
texts.en:
Lilia is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.

Lilia sells milk from her own cows.  She has been in this business for several years.  Her family help her in her work.  They take the animals out to pasture in the fields and also feed them with fodder that they produce themselves.  Lilia also makes cheese which she takes to sell in the markets in her area.  This makes her income every week or fortnight.

Lilia considers that her work is profitable and so she would like to continue selling milk.  In the future, she would like to buy another cow.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Lilia is grateful to the people who will help fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: To buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris O. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Iris is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Iris owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling school supply products like papers, ballpens, pencils & crayons  in the local community. Iris has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 5000, Iris joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Iris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Iris is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like papers & colored bond papers. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Iris from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like colored bond paper

loans.name: Abass J.

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Abass J. K.. He is married and has two children, ages four and eight. He has four additional dependents who live with him because they help in his business. 

In 2001, Abass established his assorted foods business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-employed. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy more stock for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. In the future, Abass J. plans to open another shop, further his education, educate his children and build a house. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock to his business.

loans.name: Ma. Leonora

texts.en:
Ma. Leonora D. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old. Ma. Leonora is married and has 3 children aged 20, 17 and 16. To make a living, Ma. Leonora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Ma. Leonora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ma. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Гашова Мехринисо проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 38 лет. Разведена. Имеет 5 детей. Дети еще учатся. Сама Мехринисо имеет средне - специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности проработала два года. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Mehriniso G. lives in the region of Dangara. She is 38 years old, divorced and has five children. Her children go to school. Mehriniso has secondary specialized education, she is a nurse. She has worked for two years in her profession. Today she sells on the market. She has a vendor space where she sells men's shoes and clothing. She has been in this business for two years. She is taking out the loan to increase sales volume.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Don Samuel, de 40 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su esposa  y tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, tienen casa propia desde hace 16 años, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, la agricultura la inicio hace 11 años y la ganadería hace 5 años, este es el trabajo de don Samuel al que le dedica su tiempo y del cual recibe los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar maíz, este préstamo la ayudara a adquirir el abono y fertilizantes para dar los cuidados necesarios a la milpa.
Don Samuel espera que esta siembra le de buenos frutos, una cosecha abundante.
texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old and he lives in Usulutan. He lives with his wife and their three children, aged 17, 14, and 11 years old. They have had their own house for 16 years. He is an agriculturist and farmer. He started his agriculture business 11 years ago and the farming business 5 years ago. This is the business that Samuel dedicates his time to and through which he earns the income necessary to cover the household needs. 

He request a loan to purchase materials to plant corn. This loan will help him acquire fertilizers and to provide the necessary maintenance to the plantation. Samuel hopes that this cultivation will have a good yield, an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Elva Rosa

texts.es:
Elva tiene 34 años de edad. Vive con su esposo e hijos menores en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz  en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.  Su comunidad es grande, urbana y en proceso de expansión. 

Elva cuenta con una caretilla ambulante donde vende emoliente, una bebida caliente, típica de Perú a la cual se atribuyen diferentes propiedades medicinales, ya sea para el tratamiento del aparato digestivo, reproductor, respiratorio, circulatorio, etc. Vende su producto afuera del Mercado Atusparias en su comunidad. Cuenta con una experiencia de un año en este negocio y ya tiene una clientela establecida. 

Elva desea invertir su crédito en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Elva es muy trabajadora y responsable. Posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elva is 34 years old and lives with her husband and young children in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. This large urban community is in the process of expansion.

Elva has a mobile cart from which she sells natural remedies. These hot beverages are traditionally consumed in Peru for their different medicinal properties used in treating digestive, reproductive, respiratory, circulatory, and other types of ailments. She sells her product outside of the Atusparias Market in her community. Elva has one year of experience with this business and already has an established customer base.

Elva wants to invest her loan in the purchase of school supplies for her children now that the school year has started in Peru. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Elva is hardworking and responsible. She has good personal and work-related references from her urban community. Her greatest wish is to continue improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: La señora Shirley es comerciante; ella tiene una tienda donde comercializa al por mayor plásticos y el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de cristalería para así poder tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de su madre en la zona de El Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se el otorgaron y pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Shirley is a businesswoman who runs a wholesale store selling plastic goods. She is seeking a loan to buy glassware and thus offer her customers a greater variety of products. With the money she earns, she will be able to pay for the needs of her family. 

Shirley lives in her mother’s house in the area of El Gran Poder, in the city of La Paz. She is single and doesn’t have any children. She is very pleased with the loans that she has received; they have allowed her to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy glassware (glasses, cups, jugs etc)

loans.name: Isaboke

texts.en:
Isaboke M. has been operating a retail shop where he sells cereals. He has had this business for two years, and previously sold furniture to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.  He hopes to open his own company in the future.  He has requested this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more cereals such as maize and beans.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Isaboke M. is pictured with his wife.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as maize and beans

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan S. Delgado, tiene la edad de 66 años, está casado  y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el dinero comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal y ponerlo a producir en mejores condiciones. El quiere mejorar sus producciones en calidad como en cantidad y crecer con su negocio como persona y como caficultor. El cuenta con el terreno en producción lo cual hará es solo asistirlo con abono para mejorar la próxima cosecha. Su meta es generar ganancias para su bienestar y seguir creciendo como caficultor.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan S. Delgado is 66 years old and married.  He lives with his wife, who is his biggest priority.  He intends to use this loan to buy inputs for his coffee plantation, to put it in better production condition.  

He wants to improve the quality and quantity of production, and to grow his business as a person and as a coffee grower.  Juan counts on the land to produce, which he only helps by fertilizing to improve the next harvest.  

His goal is to generate earnings for his well being, and to keep growing coffee.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Juan has not had any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him this loan with the most ease and the lowest interest rate.

loans.use: purchase agricultural inputs for his coffee plantation.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Kandé

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Kandé est mariée à un militaire. Revendeuse de produits de beauté à domicile depuis 1999, elle se déplace certaines fois pour livrer certaines commandes des clientes elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est âgée de 31 ans et aime rendre beau son entourage. Ce prêt lui permettra d’agmenter  le stock de sa marchandise  et satisfaire les demandes
texts.en: A mother of two children, Kandé is married to a soldier. She has been selling beauty products out of her house since 1999, sometimes going from place to place to deliver certain orders for customers. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé. She is 31 years old and likes to make her friends and family look nice. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of merchandise and to satisfy the demand.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI III est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargie et ont en moyenne 39 ans et en moyenne 9 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide, du fonio et du haricot.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel de MAMINE, la première assise à gauche avec un foulard  vert à la tête, sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 22500 à 70.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi III is a group of married women from the village of Dangasso, part of San in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional extended families and are on average 39 years old and have on average nine children.

They cultivate peanuts, fonio (Western Africa cereal) and beans. In order to make their farms profitable, the group decided three years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. After successfully repaying previous loans, they are on their third agricultural loan.

Mamin, the first person on the left wearing a green scarf, will use her portion of the loan to buy peanuts for planting, small equipment and inputs for cultivation, at the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in San and in surrounding markets, retail (but often in bulk), for cash, to customers usually from large cities.
