After selling their agricultural products each group member hopes to achieve profits between 22,500 and 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover daily expenditures of the family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment

loans.name: Las Lecheritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS LECHERITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos crianza de animales, venta de verduras, venta de leche, crianza de cerdos, venta de ganado 

La señora Maria,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una de sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganados vacuno, negocio que inicio desde niña con el apoyo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra alimento para su ganado, el cual adquirira de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The community association “LAS LECHERITAS”  is starting its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.  The group is made up of ten members and is led by a board headed by Señora Maria.  The businesses that community association members lead are varied, including breeding animals, selling vegetables, selling milk, raising pigs, and selling cattle.  Señora Maria says that this is their first time working with Pro Mujer, which they joined at the invitation of one of her partners. 

Currently, Señora Maria has a business breeding cattle, a business which she started in as a young girl with the help of her parents.  The loan that she is will now be drawing on is to buy feed for her cattle, which she will acquire at the markets in El Alto city.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has two children in school. Stellah sells clothes to earn a living and she employs one person. She works hard in her business to be able to educate her children so that they can have a bright future. 

Stellah is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothing to sell. She hopes to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Maura Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maura es socia del banco comunal Las Orquídeas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo adolescente.
Su primer préstamo le sirvió para iniciar otro negocio que no requería mucha inversión, actualmente de dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, carteras, zapatos y otros accesorios.
Lleva ya tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su dinero lo invierte en la compra de mercadería, en Lima tiene una persona que se encarga de hacerle los envíos.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 18 pares de zapatos, 10 carteras, que los venderá a precios módicos para poder traer más productos en poco tiempo.
Con este negocio puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa porque un solo sueldo no alcanza para pagar los gastos del hogar, tiene un hijo que tiene muchos gastos en el colegio, su esposo es el que da el dinero para la comida del mes y algunos gastos basicos, ella se encarga de cubrir otros gastos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de hacer que sus ideas se puedan hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the communal bank named "Las Orquideas", meaning "The Orchids". It is located in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old, married, and she has an adolescent son. 

Her first loan helped her to start up another business that did not require a large investment. Currently, she sells articles of clothing, wallets, shoes, and other accessories. She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the last three years. The funds are invested in the purchase of merchandise. In Lima she has someone who takes care of all the shipments.

Her new loan is in the amount of S/.1500 nuevos soles and with it she will purchase: 18 pairs of shoes, and 10 wallets. She will resell the products at affordable prices to be able to bring in more products in less time.

She is able to help her husband with the household expenses through her business. One income is not enough to cover the household expenses. She has a son who has many school-related expenses. Her husband is who covers the food bill for the month and some other basic expenses. She takes care of the other expenses.

She is thankful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for giving her the opportunity to bring her ideas to light.

loans.use: to purchase wallets and shoes.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos está aplicando a su segundo credikiva porque con el anterior surtió su negocio con bebidas y abarrotes y le fue bien. En la actualidad solicita un nuevo financiamiento para comprar nuevamente bebidas porque le genera mayor rentabilidad.  Carlos envía el siguiente comunicado a sus financiadores de Kiva “Le agradezco mucho todo lo que hacen con las personas como yo, ya que nos ayuda a crecer e invertir un nuevo capital al negocio.”
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Carlos ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/218779
texts.en:
Carlos is applying for his second Kiva loan, because with the previous loan he restocked his store with drinks and groceries and it went well.  Now he requests a new loan to buy drinks again, because they generate the most profits for him.  Carlos sends the following message to his Kiva lenders: "I really appreciate everything that you are doing for people like me, because it helps us to grow and invest new capital into our businesses."  

If you want to know more about Carlos' history with Kiva, click on the following link:  http://kiva.org/lend/218779

loans.use: to buy drinks in large quantities to take advantage of a bulk discount

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 48-year-old married woma and mother of 3 children.  She started working as a tailor 18 years ago to provide her family with good and healthy living.  Mariam is a hardworking woman, she started her business from home because of the lack of money she was facing, and because she thought it's the best place to be next to her beloved family members to take good care of them and finish the requested work at the same time.  She is a talented woman with very good experience and her business has improved a lot through the increase in the number of customers she has gained over time.  

Mariam is a woman with a good reputation.  She does her best to improve her business and wants to update her machines.  She has requested a loan  from A. Majmoua  to buy two professionA. tailoring machines.  These will help her finish the requested work in a short period of time with the best quality.

Mariam hopes to open a tailoring shop in the future. She believes that when her business grows more, she has to expand to a bigger place to gain more customers.

loans.use: buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Regina has a shop that sells noodles, breads, snacks and detergents. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Regina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom, age 54, is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns $3 per day. This couple has four children: all are working and earning $14 per day. Every month, Rom has to spend $70 on food, $20 on rent, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $800 to buy wood, bricks, and other materials required for repairing her house. She plans to offer groceries for sale in front of her house so that she can help her husband in earning money to support the family.

loans.use: to buy wood, bricks, and other materials required for repairing her house

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco de 35 años de edad, habita en casa propia en zona semiurbana, junto con su querida familia la cual está conformada por su amada esposa de 35 años y su adorada hija. Juan es un hombre responsable, trabajador y sobre todo muy emprendedor. Hace varios años que logró establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia la cual le ha permitido dar a su familia el pan de cada día. Mantener el negocio en marcha no ha sido fácil, expresa Juan, ya que en la zona donde el reside hay otros negocios que compiten con su tienda y día a día aumentan los negocios que de una u otra forma van ganando terreno en la zona y consecuentemente restando clientes a su favor. Pero para Juan esto no es un obstáculo sino más bien un reto, ya que esto lo hace estar alerta ante los cambios en el mercado. Él cuenta con muchas ventajas ya que tiene mucha experiencia y además ya se ganó la confianza de sus vecinos, ya que para él lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos por lo que siempre se esmera por tener todo lo ellos necesitan. Juan es un hombre arriesgado y seguro, no le teme a ningún desafío. Todo esto lo ha motivado a  solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera logrará mantener su negocio en marcha por muchos años más. Con el préstamo piensa comprar variedad de artículos de tienda como: bebidas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, detergente, aceite, golosinas, etc. De tal forma que  los clientes lo sigan prefiriendo por su excelente servicio. De esta manera espera poder accesar a una mejor oportunidad de vida tanto para él como para su familia.
texts.en: Juan Francisco, 35 years old, lives in his home in a semi-urban area with his beloved family which is made up of his loved wife of 35 years and his adored daughter. Juan is a responsible, hard-working, and above all very entrepreneurial man. Several years ago he managed to establish a small store in his home residence which has allowed him to give his family their daily bread. Keeping the business going has not been easy, expresses Juan, as in the area where he resides there are other businesses that compete with his store, and day by day there are more businesses that by one way or another are gaining ground in the area and consequently taking way customers in their favor. But for Juan this is not an obstacle but rather a challenge since this has made him be alert to the changes in the market. He counts on many advantages since he has a lot of experience and moreover, has already won the trust of his neighbors. The most important thing to him is that his customers are satisfied, which is why he always puts a great deal of effort to have everything they need. Juan is a daring and safe man, and does not fear any challenge. All of this has motivated him to apply to Integral for a loan with the faith in God that in this way he will manage to keep his business running for many more years. With the loan he plans to buy a variety of store items like drinks, rice, sugar, beans, detergent, oil, candy, etc. so that his customers continue to prefer him because of his excellent service. In this way, he hopes to be able to obtain a better opportunity in life for him as well as for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of store items like: drinks, rice, sugar, beans, detergent, oil, candy.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Almost two years ago, Emily started playing roller derby and fell in love with the sport. After playing for some time, she noticed that there aren’t many retailers who sell roller derby equipment. In March 2011, shortly after selling equipment informally, Emily opened Blue City Skates. She moved the business to a store front and started a website for skaters who don’t have access to a local skate shop. She dedicates most of her time to her main job, but hopes to be at the store full-time after the business grows. Emily’s derby coach volunteers his time at the business to facilitate repairs and sales.
Blue City Skates sells roller skates, protective equipment and accessories for roller derby, hockey, figure skating, speed skating and skateboarding. The business has become increasingly successful, and Emily believes it’s due to the need for recreational skating equipment in her community. She opened the only local skate shop within 200 miles, and most of her advertising has been by word of mouth. 
Emily will use this loan to stock up on skating equipment for the web store. She will also use a portion of it for formal advertising, as well as paying for a sign to put in front of her store.

loans.use: to purchase skating equipment for her web store, and pay for advertising.

loans.name: Juvelene

texts.en:
Juvelene is 26 years old and single. She lives in Talibon, Bohol where she manages a hog-raising business. She raises pigs in her backyard for fattening and sells them at her town's market. Juvelene also sells sausages to the people in her community.

She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feeds as well as sausages to sell. Juvelene hopes to have a stable business. She also plans to save for her future family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu was born in 1970. She lives in Thac Qua village, Duc Tu commune, with her husband and four children, who are still small. Her husband is a worker. He has income. Mrs. Thu is a farmer. She not only grows rice, but also she has many other jobs for more income. Her main job is farming. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 7,194,000 VND to pay tuition for her children and repaid this loan punctually. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to repair her house. She always wants to have a better life.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es: José, nuevamente se decidió a adquirir un préstamo, porque necesita comprar más herramientas para su taller como: repuestos y laminas, además comprar maiz para el consumo diario, el objetivo de el es que se facilite el trabajo y tener lo necesario para atender a sus clientes. El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho pues logro más clientela y solventar los problemas económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
José decided to request another loan because he needs to buy more equipment for his repair shop such as spare parts and metal sheets. He also wants to buy corn for daily consumption. His goal is to make his work more efficient and have everything he needs to serve his customers.

The previous loan was a great help because he was able to attract more customers and resolve his family’s financial problems.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, metal sheets, and corn.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married to a farmer and has 5 dependants. She sells maize dough and rice porridge at Dompoase. She has been selling maize for 15 years.  Aba supports her husband to pay the school fees of his children.  

She will use her loan to purchase bulk maize and rice. Aba will expand her business with her profits.

loans.use: purchase bulk maize and rice.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, así como extrovertida y alegre, es conviviente con Carlos, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hermosos hijos de 18 y 4 años de edad, todos instalados cómodamente en una casa que es de su propiedad. El negocio que tiene Elizabeth es la venta de ropa de diferentes marcas y modelos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Por tanto debe viajar a la ciudad de Lima a comprar la mercadería que le solicitan sus clientes, pues ahí donde encontraran a bajo precio dichas prendas. Su estilo de venta es dejar a crédito el producto que vender y cada 20 días realiza la cobranza. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad son los viajes que realiza, porque se distrae, asimismo las ganancias que percibe de su negocio le ha dado la oportunidad  de comprarse sus artefactos electrodomésticos. No obstante, no le gusta cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en le pago de sus créditos, aún así tiene planes de abrir una tienda donde pueda exhibir su productos, en alguna zona comercial de su ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, Esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio o trabajo. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de ropas de todas las marcas y modelos en mayor cantidad, así podrá tener un mayor margen de ganancias en esta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 40, is a hard-working and dynamic woman, as well as extroverted and happy.  She lives with Carlos and from this relationship has two beautiful children, ages 18 and 4, all living comfortably in a house that is their property.

Elizabeth's business is selling clothing of various brands and styles for women, men, and children.  For this reason she has to travel to the city of Lima to buy the merchandise that her customers request, since there she will find the clothes at low prices.  Her sales style is to leave the product to sell on credit and collect the payments every 20 days.

What she likes about her work are the trips she makes, because she amuses herself.  She also likes the profits she makes from her business, which has given her the opportunity to buy herself her electrical appliances.  Nevertheless, she does not like when some of her customers get behind on their payments.  Even so, she has plans to open a store where she can display her products, in some commercial area of her city.

This will be her eleventh loan with the MFP institution.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since in that way she will feel secure about moving forward with her business and job.

With the requested amount of 3000 PEN she will invest in buying all brands and styles of clothing wholesale so she will be able to have a greater profit margin in this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Gian Mark

texts.es: El señor Gian es soltero,  tiene su negocio de parchado de llantas por la zona virgen de lujan trabaja 7 días a la semana  ya que esta actividad es sus única fuente de ingresos, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, se esfuerza para seguir adelante,  con el dinero del crédito comprara materiales de construcción para ampliar su negocio y también algunas herramientas de trabajo para su taller de gomería,   El cliente agradeció a la institución por la rapidez que fueron atendidos y el buen trato que se le
texts.en: Gian is single and has a tire repair business in the “Virgen de Lujan” zone.  He works seven days a week since this is his only source of income.  He’s a hardworking, responsible man who makes a great effort to get ahead.  He will use the money from this loan to buy building materials to expand his business.  He will also buy some tools for his tire shop.  [Gian] is very grateful to the institution for the speed and good service he received.

loans.use: to expand his tire business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Austin, Texas' "Anytime Labor" is a start-up staffing company that was started in August by 35-year-old Joseph. His business currently employs only Joseph who works with construction and warehouse companies on light manual labor such as cleaning up after construction projects. Joseph is using the loan money to purchase equipment such as shovels, gloves, rakes, hard hats and other work-related tools needed to perform the job. These devices are needed but not offered through the construction companies. 

Joseph decided to become an entrepreneur because of the flexibility it gives him to juggle returning to school, focusing on his career and making his own decisions. Though this is a recently opened business, Joseph said by next year, it should be up and running. He plans to hire 10 to 20 employees depending on how many companies are willing to take advantage of his services. 

When he realized he could not afford everything needed, Joseph turned to ACCION Texas Inc. for his business loan. He said he has good credit but lacks any credit history. Joseph said ACCION Texas gave him a head start, "and I appreciate that. " Without the loan, "I think I would have started everything with my own money. (The loan) is going to help me a lot." Joseph thanked ACCION Texas for the help and stated that it is a great place to receive a business loan. In addtition to working and attending school, Joseph is a father of two children, both under the age of 18.

loans.use: To pay for construction clean-up supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 36 years old and married with two children who are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a business buying and selling snack foods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of snack foods to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more snack foods to sell

loans.name: 03.05.121 Thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên Lê  works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and sell in future.

Liên Lê is 61 years old and she is married with 3 children. Liên Lê is the group leader of the 03.05.121 Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2003, Liên Lê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên Lê  has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên Lê  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Liên Lê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên Lê hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (father). She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years, and she works seven days a week. 

Joyce has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more utensils, rice, bunches of bananas, and beef. Her major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Her aspirations and goals are to install piped water in her home and to own a fully stocked restaurant. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, utensils, beef and rice.

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Mrs. Endurance O. is a 34 years old woman. She is happily married and blessed with two (2) children. She testifies that LAPO has lifted her up from the grip of poverty. She wishes that the above amount comes to her for business boost.

loans.use: To buy more baby wears for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Madame A. sells kenkey, a local food made from corn. She sells to a large group of people in their homes and workplaces. She wants to cook more to meet the demands of her customers. She is seeking a loan of $650.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich T., 42 years old, has two children and lives with her husband in Preyveng, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by running a grocery shop in the village and typically make around $4/day. Her children are students and they help her business when they are free. T. hopes the loan will assist her in increasing her business. With the loan, she will purchase various kinds of products to sell. She plans to use the remaining loan money to repair her house to protect it from leaking during rainy season.  In the future, her family hopes to own a bigger grocery store to satisfy all her clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase some grocery products to run a business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Prica wants to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Helena Estefano

texts.pt:
Location: Chali area - Maputo
Client: Helena Estefano S.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 10,000.00 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 400.00)
Use: Purchase products for resale
Start date: 08/26/2007
End date: 11/17/2008

Helena Estefano S. was born in Maputo in 1951. She attended school only up to the 6th grade due to her family's financial situation. Her father worked as a servant for the Ministry of Planning and Finance and had many children.

At the age of 22, she married and had 4 children. However, her marriage only lasted 8 years. After her separation, she studied typing and found a job right away as a typist. She held this job for 3 years but had to leave it due to the long distance between her home and the workplace. In order to survive, she became involved in small businesses and in 1989 obtained another job at the Ministry of Agriculture, where she worked until she got back on her feet. Even while she was working, she continued to run her business which in turn led to the creation of three new jobs. She currently sells peanuts and has two public telephones (One Cell). Thanks to the loan she was able to increase the sales volume of her business. The impact of her business is well known -- besides having created more jobs, she provides access to peanuts (an essential product) and communication services for the community.

In the future she plans to further her business and become a successful entrepreneur like other women who started out like her.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali - Maputo
Cliente: Helena Estefano S.
Actividade: Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo: 10,000.00MT (400.00US$)
Aplicação: compra de Produtos para revenda
Início: 26/08/2007
Fim: 17/11/2008

Helena Estefano S. Nasceu em Maputo em 1951, Estudou apenas até 6ª classe devido a debilidade finaceira dos progenitores pós este trabalhava como servente no Ministério de plano e Finanças e tinha muitos filhos .

Aos 22 anos contraiu o matrinomio o qual resultou em 4 filhos mas no entanto o seu casamento durou apenas 8 anos, depois da separação formou se em Datilografia tendo em seguida conseguido um emprego como datilógrafa,onde trabalhou durante 3 anos e veio a disitir do emprego devido a longa distância que lhe separava da casa ao posto de trabalho. Para a sua sobrevência dedicou se a pequenos negocios e em1989 conseguiu outro emprego no Ministério da Agricultura onde trabalhou até a sua reforma mas mesmo trabalhando nunca deixou de desenvolver a actividade comercial a qual criou 3 postos de trabalho. Actualmente vende Amendoim e possui dois telefones públicos ( one cell),com o valor de crédito aumentou o volume do seu negócio. O impacto da sua actividade é notório póis para além de ter criado mais posto de trabalho fornece o amendoim( produto básico) e providencia serviço de comunicação acessiveis para a comunidade.

Futuramente pretende desenvolver mais o seu negócio e tornar se numa grande empresária como outras que começaram com ela.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Angela Teresa

texts.es:
Sra. Angela belongs to "Las Triunfadoras" (The Triumphant) community bank in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 51 years old and the mother of 7 children, 3 of whom live with her. Her husband died 5 years ago, leaving her a widow with kids to support and no immediate source of income. She decided to take out a loan for a new business so that she and her children could get on with their lives. With a prior loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) from Manuela Ramos, she set up a meat-selling business in a stall at a local market. Her children have helped her with the business, organizing themselves so that they could both help their mother and complete their studies.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (about US$333), to be repaid in 4 months, Angela will be able to increase the size of her orders and buy 150 kilos of meat at only S/.6 (about US$2) per kilo and 10 "visceras" (cow entrails?), each for S/.50 (about US$16).

Angela is very pleased because she knows that her efforts will improve her quality of life and her children's.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Angela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, su vivienda esta ubicada en la Av.Alfonso Ugarte 258 del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre de 7 hijos, de las cuales 3 aún viven con ella y 4 son mayores independientes, ella quedó viuda hace 5 años, al encontrarse sola con sus hijos y sin apoyo económico ella decide hacer un préstamo para trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, entonces con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 soles, puso un negocio de venta de carne roja en un puesto del mercado. En la actualidad cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en la venta, donde cada uno de ellos se organizan para poder cumplir con sus estudios.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, incrementará las cantidades de sus productos y podrá comprar 150 Kg. de carne a S/ 6.00 c/Kg. y 10 Visceras a S/.50.00 C/uno.

Angela está muy satisfecha porque sabe que su esfuerzo mejorará la calidad de vida de ella y la de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar lives in Khachmaz region. He is single and 41 years old. He has been as a joiner for 12 years. He buys the materials and makes doors and windows in his shop. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy necessary materials for making doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for making doors and windows

loans.name: Rohyati

texts.en: Rohyati is a 34-year-old woman who sells chickens to support her family needs, earning US$10.5 a day, while her husband, M. T., has no regular income. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$150 to increase her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Zenaida's Group

texts.en:
Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecilia are members of the community bank “Gracias Morenita”.  They have belonged for one year, four months, and eight months respectively.  In the community bank they have learned to save, to be punctual, to be honest, and to be organized in their business.
Zenaida is 50 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Zenaida sells food from a cart in the suburb of Enace.  In addition, on Saturdays and Sundays Zenaida sells cebiche, a typical dish maD. from marinating fish in lemon juice, from her house.
Yudith is 18 years old.  She has a store where she sells food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar.  Yudith’s father helped her start the business so that she would be able to pay for school.  Yudith is studying accounting and in her free time she does accounting for a small office.
Cecilia is 24 years old and lives with her partner and two children.  Cecilia sells fruit from a cart near the bus station.  Previously, Cecilia had a laundry business but her niece convinced her that fruit would be more profitable.
Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecelia need loans of 200, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, sugar, soap, detergent, mangos, apples, grapes, other regional fruits, plates, cups, and spoons.
Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecelia dream of owning a home, giving their children a good education, and becoming professionals.

loans.use: Zenaida, Yudith, and Cecelia need loans of 200, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, sugar, soap, detergent, mangos, apples, grapes, other regional fruits, plates, cups, and spoons.

loans.name: Armina

texts.en: Armina was born in 1977  and she is married. She lives  with her husband and 2 children in Nemila, near the town Zenica. Her husband does seasonal agriculture work and  can earn about 600 KM monthly. Armina  crochets and she intends to use this loan in the amount of 1000 KM for buying material for crochet. She hopes that she will increase her household income by selling her handmade work.

loans.use: Buying material for crochet.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz Adriana Z. A. is 23 years old and was born in Monterrey. She is single and has two children, ages two years and six months.

After her husband moved to the U.S., at first it was so difficult because she was working but also needed to take care of her baby. She decided that a business could be the best option, because she could make some money and care for her baby at the same time.

She is an enterprising woman, so she started selling tacos at her home two years ago. At first she was just selling tacos in the morning, but as time passed by, she became well-known in the neighborhood and her business grew. Recognizing this, she decided to sell tacos in the morning and hamburgers in the evening.

Now she needs $375 in order to buy some tables and chairs. She promises to repay it in four months. The tables and chairs will help her to sell more and she will become a more successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro is married and has a 23 year old son. 8 years ago he decided to start a charcoal business. Thanks to his hard work he was able to purchase a truck which he uses to transport and sell the charcoal. He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 6 months, so he can increase his inventory and provide charcoal to other towns nearby, expanding his sales and increasing his income. With your support, Pedro can grow his business.

Pedro, es casado y tiene un hijo de 23 años, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de carbón, gracias a su trabajo arduo ha logrado comprar un vehiculo que le facilita el transporte y venta del producto.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses ya que desea incrementar su inventario para cubrir otras poblaciones cercanas y tener mejores ganancias. Con tu apoyo Pedro lograra incrementar sus ventas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE INVENTORY FOR HIS CHARCOAL BUSINESS, ENABLING HIM TO SELL TO OTHER TOWNS IN THE SURROUNDING AREAS, GROWING HIS BUSINESS AND INCREASING HIS INCOME.

loans.name: Shahnozajon

texts.en: B. Shahnozajon is 23 years old. She is married and has two children of school age. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Shahnozajon and her husband are raising their children with love and try to provide them with everything that a teenager may need. In order to support her husband and increase their family budget, Shahnozajon has been running her own business for the past 4 years. She sells fabrics for the making of national Tajik dresses that are very popular and important for the dowry of any girl. All the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring wholesale market in Dushanbe. Shahnozajon has a rented trading place in a store. Being very polite and having a good taste, she has been able to attract many loyal customers. Shahnozajon tries to offer a wide range of goods to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of the clients with different levels of income. She is therefore asking for a loan of US$1,000 that Shahnozajon will repay within 12 months and that will be spent for purchasing new, modern fabrics. She would like to thank everybody for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabrics for sale

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en: Pamata V., 44, is married with five children.  She has many year of experience in the taro-growing business. She sells to the villagers and the public two days per week and has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~62 USD). SPBD loans are Pamata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy weed killer, barbed wire, nails, fertilizer, bush knives, and transportation. Pamata's husband is a musician who is the only other income earner of the family. He will sometimes work on the plantation when he is available.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, fertilizer, and other agricultural implements for her farm.

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Jiamini Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 45 years old. She is a single woman with 2 children aged 27 and 22 and also cares for 2 other people aged 75 and 60. She has owned a small restaurant since 1998. She works everyday from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25.

Mwanahawa requests a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with clothes and food sales, rice and tea sales, making bricks and owning a restaurant.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica J. has been selling bags of rice, flour, and other foodstuffs at Asebu on the Cape Coast since 2000. Veronica has received a primary education, is married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice and flour for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to assist her husband in building a family house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and flour for resale

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció es medico y a base de mucho esfuerzo logro poner un consultorio en lo que le asignaban su plaza en salubridad, además de desear obtener ingresos y poner en practica su carrera profesional. Comenzó hace diez años primero hacia solo consultas médicas en su domicilio, hasta que logro establecerse.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar medicamentos.
texts.en:
Roció is a doctor who through much effort was able to open her own office while awaiting to be assigned a position with the national health system, in order to earn income and begin her professional career. She started 10 years ago, first doing single medical consultations in her home, until she could establish herself. She needs a loan of $925, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy medications.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medications

loans.name: Anasthasie

texts.fr: Mariée à AFFOGNON Rémy, dame K. Anasthasie est agée de 38 ans et est née au BENIN. Elle vit avec son mari à Cotonou, plus précisement dans la zone des ambassades. Elle distribue à ses clients qui ont dans leur majorité des boutiques, des cacahouètes qu'elle met en bouteilles. Indépendamment de cette activité, elle vend de la bouillie et des beignets. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anasthasie K. is married to Remy Affognon. She is 38 years old and was born in Benin. She lives with her husband in Cotonou, more precisely in the embassy zone. Anasthasie distributes peanuts that she bottles, to her clients, who are mostly shop owners. Besides this business she also sells millet porridge and doughnuts. She is requesting this loan to improve her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sack of bottles, a sack of peanuts and a sack of cashew nuts

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Mrs. Maristela Sugano B., commonly known as “Tilay”, is a member of Mangrove 1 Center, Danao, Plaridel, Mis.Occ.  Maristela is 27 years old now. Her husband is Joy B., from Cotabato.  She is a secondary graduate, and she has also completed her first semester in a vocational school. The couple is blessed with 2 beautiful girls, and a new baby is on the way.

The family’s main source of income is fish vending. Tilay’s husband is also helping her sell fish to the market.  Their average daily income from fish vending is five hundred pesos (P500.00) per day. Her husband’s other source of income comes from his work at LANSA, which is done at night. LANSA is a big fishing boat that needs 40 workers.  Most of the time, LANSA workers earn at least two thousand pesos (P2,000.00) per month.

Tilay is applying a for loan amounting to twenty thousand pesos (P20,000.00) for the purpose of buying additional fishing accessories, such as a fishing net with an estimated cost of 10,000 pesos. The rest of the loan proceeds will be applied as revolving capital for the purchase of fish from the fishermen.
 
Tilay and her husband dream of acquiring an engine for their boat so that they can have their own fishing business and increase their income. They would also like to finish construction on their new house, and they hope that all of their children can finish their studies, the only legacy they may able to give to them.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets and other related accessories

loans.name: Elsia

texts.en: Elsia is 44 years old and is married, with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has a shop where she sells CDs. Elsia started this business in 2006. She is requesting a loan to purchase more CDs to sell.  She says, "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more CDs to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Chaguaya Group

texts.es: En el grupo "Virgen de Caguay" esta representado por la señora Jacinta, dentro del grupo existe un parentesco consanguíneo entre la señora Giovanna uy el señor Iván ellos son hermanos pero ambos tienen ingresos totalmente independientes uno del otro. Los socios (as) tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de comida, carne roja,  jugos caseros, frutas, transporte público, venta de alfombras y cosméticos. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de mercadería e insumos para la venta así como al mejoramiento de las herramientas de trabajo. La mayoría de los socios cuentan con buenos antecedentes crediticios en otras entidades financieras por lo que conocen de grupos solidarios, en general alguno de los miembros del grupo ya trabajaron con la fundación Agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad y cumpliendo a la hora de los pagos del financiamiento
texts.en:
The group "Virgen de Caguay" is represented by Jacinta. Two members of the group are related: Giovanna and Iván are siblings but their incomes are entirely independent. The members have a variety of businesses: food sales, red meat, homemade juices, public transportation, carpet sales and cosmetics' sales. The loan will be used to buy more goods and foodstuffs for resale as well as to improve the tools for work. Most of the members have a good credit history with other financial institutions known as solidarity groups. Some of the group members have already worked with Agrocapital and shown that they are responsible, having repaid previous loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Fatma is a clothes and chicken seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar, work she had done for five years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125 and every day she works at her business from 8am to 10pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and chicken for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business. Fatma is 45 years old, married, and has five children ages 20, 18, 12, 10 and 8.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanahamis, Maryam, Khadija and Asha. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 41 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hussein has been selling new and used spare parts. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and tools for his business. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.
His previous loan helped him improve his income. Hussein is special in his work because of his good reputation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase merchandise and tools for his business.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, tiene 23 años y vive junto a sus dos menores hijos Gian Marco de 3 y Maricielo de 6 meses en su propia casa. Se dedica a vender papa en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Puno, (mercado muy conocido), ella es muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren, trabaja junto a su madre, quien fue la que le enseñó este negocio. Ricardina disfruta mucho de conversar con sus vecinas de venta, mientras trabaja, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que al terminar el día se encuentra muy sucia por la tierra de la papa. Ricardina desea tener en el futuro una tienda donde pueda vender su productos y otra cosas más, de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y darle a sus hijos buenos estudios superiores. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más papa, para incrementar la cantidad que vende diariamente en el mercado.
texts.en:
Ricardina is a very sincere and honest woman. She is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her two young children; 3-year-old Gian Marco and 6-month-old Maricielo. She works selling potatoes in the Mercado Central in the city of Puno (a well-known market). She is very happy and outgoing, which makes her customers prefer her. She works alongside her mother, who is the one who taught her this business. Ricardina very much enjoys talking with her neighboring salesladies while she works. She has done this job for 5 years and what she least likes is that at the end of the day she is very dirty from the dirt of the potatoes. In the future, Ricardina desires to have a store where she can sell her products as well as other things, and in this way improve her quality of life and give her children a good higher education. This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to make all the payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for her community bank, where she is beloved by the rest of the members. With the money she requests she will buy more potatoes to increase the quantity she sells daily in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg C. lives with her mother and younger sister in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.  During the last few years, the importation of cheap clothes from Ereen, China has become a lucrative business for locals in Arhanghay.  Ereen is a Chinese border town where many small business owners travel to import cheap products for resale at their local markets.  

Erdenetsetseg started traveling to Ereen in 2006 to buy cheap, quality apparel for women and men.  While she is away her sister, Chuluuntsetseg, runs the stall.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and diversify her products. She requests a loan to purchase more apparel from Ereen, China.

loans.use: Purchase more apparel.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 21 años, a su corta edad se siente en la responsabilidad de apoyar con los gastos familiares, ella vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más quiere es ayudarles a tener una vida tranquila. Para ella, su juventud no ha sido un impedimento para querer salir adelante, lleva 5 años trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes y lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes, de esta manera hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Bertha pudo poner su bodega gracias al apoyo de sus padres, quienes no dudaron en invertir todo sus ahorros, con tal de ver a su hija feliz y forjando su propio futuro. Bertha espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus productos, ya que lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo, es que debido al espacio reducido de su tienda no puede atender a muchas personas a la vez, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para mejor la vida que actualmente lleva. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida, ya que es la socia más joven y alegre. Bertha planea invertir los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados en incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene actualmente en su tienda, de esta manera espera aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Bertha is 21 years old. At her young age, she feels responsible for helping out with the family expenses. She lives in her parents’ house, and what she wants the most is to help them have a peaceful life. For Bertha, her youth has not impeded her from getting ahead in life. She has been working in her own general store for 5 years, and what she likes most about her business is having conversations with her customers because it makes her long work days more enjoyable. Bertha was able to set up her general store thanks to her parents, who did not think twice about investing their life savings so that their daughter can be happy and form her own future. Bertha hopes to have a bigger store in which she can sell her products with ease. What she most dislikes is that because of her small shop, she cannot serve too many customers at a time. Even so, she she knows that she has to work hard in order to improve her current living conditions. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels very confident that she will be able to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause any problems at her microfinance institute, where she is dearly loved for being the youngest and most cheerful member. Bertha plans to invest 800.00 PEN in increasing her store’s inventory so that she can boost her income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en:
Olufunke O., 58 years old, is married with four children. She earns her living by selling wooden planks.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N40,000, with which she plans to purchase more planks for sale.

She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Sengchan

texts.en:
Mrs. SengChan H. is a villager in Praek Doung village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates mangoes. Now her operation has a problem because the field has a lot of insects damaging her produce.

In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. SengChan H. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides. She would use the rest of money to purchase fertilizer to support the field and make it more productive.

She is a 44-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are shoe sellers in the local market while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa  Leny

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92715&_tpos=4&_tpg=1
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. 
Se dedica  hace 8 años a la  venta de  ropa, que  ofrece  a sus amigas y vecinas.  
Rosa solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  comprar ropa Sport de temporada.
Desde que Rosa está en Finca trabaja con tranquilidad, se siente respaldada por los prestamos.  
Continua con su sueño de poner un bazar en su propia casa.
texts.en:
You can look at Rosa's first loan through Kiva by clicking on the following link; http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92715&_tpos=4&_tpg=1 Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Avancemos Juntas" (Together We Move Forward). She has been making a living by selling clothing for the past 8 years. She sells the clothing to her friends and neighbors. Rosa is requesting a loan for $425 (1,200 Soles) so that she will be able to buy sports clothing that is in style this season. Since Rosa has been part of the organization Finca she has been able to work with a sense of calm. The loans have helped her a lot and she continues to dream about opening up a store in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sports clothing that is in style this season.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Note: Seng R. was not available for photographing, so her husband is shown in the picture instead.

Seng R., 50, sells fishes that she gets from her husband's fishing. She also buys fish in bulk from other fishermen and brings them to sell at the market.

She is a good mother blessed with five children; four of them are single and one is married and has started a new family home.

Seng R. will use her loan to purchase additional equipment for her husband to use for fishing. Her loan will help the family accrue their income and better manage their daily finances.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her husband to use in fishing.

loans.name: Nyame Tumi So Group

texts.en:
Anna is a food vendor selling kenkey with fried fish and pepper spices. She sells kenkey in the mornings, afternoons and in the evenings. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. 

Anna is 53 years old, divorced and the mother of three kids. All her children are girls and they are all traders in the community market. Anna is very resourceful in the provision of food and payment of bills for her family. She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her business output. 

Anna is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame tumi so’ which means ‘God power is great’. She is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Sungane

texts.pt:
Sungane M. nasceu na província de tete (a 2800 km a norte da cidade de Maputo onde existe a terceira maior hidroelétrica de áfrica) tem 59 anos de idade e pai de uma filha de 17 anos de idade. Estudou ao ate 5 classe tendo parado quando saiu o seu nome para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório.

Cumpriu o serviço militar na província de maputo onde, depois de desmobilizado, veio a casar com sua esposa no distrito de boane. Vive com a família, na casa própria, sem ninguém sob sua responsabilidade. É pensionista do Ministério da defesa nacional auferindo 4.082,00mt, com os quais sustenta a família e paga o credito. Tem experiência na área de agricultura, produz horticolas no vale do rio umbeluzi desde 1988.

Conheceu a Hluvuku graças às informações obtidas através de um amigo vizinho.
Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições, sendo este o seu segundo credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT que vai aplicar na compra de blocos para construção da sua casa de material convencional. O primeiro credito foi de 3.950,00MT que se destinava para compra de insumos agrícolas e tendo reembolsado sem problemas.

Sungane compromete se a reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com o intuito concluir a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Sungane M. was born in the Province of Tete (2,800 km north of the city of Maputo, where the third largest hydroelectric power station in Africa is). He is 59 years old and is the father of a 17-year-old girl. He studied until fifth grade, having had to stop when his name came up to do his obligatory military service. He carried out his military service in the province of Maputo where, after demobilization, he married his wife in the district of Boane. He lives with his family in his own house and has no other dependents. He is a pensioner of the Ministry of National Defence, giving him 4,082 MT, with which he supports his family and pays his loan. He has experience in agriculture, he has grown vegetables in the Umbeluzi River Valley since 1988. Sungane got to know about Hluvuku thanks to information he received through a neighbouring friend. He has never had loans with other institutions, and this is his second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 10,000 MT. It will be used in the purchase of construction blocks for his house, made of conventional materials. The first loan was for 3,950 MT, which was for purchasing raw agricultural materials, was repaid without any problems Sungane promises to repay the loan without problems so that he can access more loans with the intention of finishing the construction of his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es: Rosalbina es un mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 35 años, vive con el padre de sus 3 tres hijos en su casa propia. A temprana edad se casó y cuando nació su primer hijo trabajaba con su pequeño en la espalda. Actualmente continúa con su labor como agricultora, en apoyo a su esposo, por lo que se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y luego ir a sus chacras. Lo que más le gusta sembrar a su esposo es la papa, por ser un producto rentable, ya que de una sola siembra obtiene papa para consumo y papa como semilla, y ambas las vende. Cuando es para consumo las lleva directamente al mercado mayorista de Tarma (a una hora en carro de su chacra) y en el caso de la semilla, la vende en su mismo pueblo obteniendo muy buenas ganancias. El deseo de Rosalbina es incrementar sus siembras para obtener mayores ganancias al momento de vender sus productos. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente, ya que espera seguir contando con más préstamos para seguir creciendo mediante sus siembras. Por el momento, ya que cuenta con el guano de corral como abono y con el dinero que solicita  comprará fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
At 35 years of age, Rosalbina is a hardworking woman. She lives with the father of her 3 children in their own home. She married at an early age, and after she gave birth to her first child, she returned to work while carrying her little one on her back. Rosalbina continues to work as a farmer with the help of her husband. She wakes up at 4am to prepare food and later begins her work in the fields. She enjoys harvesting the potatoes planted by her husband because they are a profitable crop. From a single harvest, they can produce potatoes for consumption and potatoes to use as seedlings, of which both can be sold. The crops that are designated for consumption are sold directly at the wholesale market in Tarma (which is a one hour drive from their farm). The potato seedlings are sold in town and can generate a good profit.

Rosalbina hopes to increase her plantings so that she can earn more revenue when she sells her products. She will be taking her ninth loan with MFP, which she promises to repay on time. She hopes to receive more loans in the future so that she can continue growing her crops. At the moment, she is using animal manure to fertilize her fields. With the current loan she requested, she plans to buy chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Stella Osbohen

texts.en:
Stella Osbohen is 37 years old and married with three children. She is in the catering business. She also sells clothes and jewelry.

Stella Osbohen is requesting a loan of 60,000 NGN to buy more clothes and jewelry to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mirjahan

texts.en: Mirjahan was born in 1956. She is a mother of 4 children. 7 years ago she started poultry business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy poultry for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Nike Bakat Group

texts.en: Nike Bakat is the leader of this group, which has four members. Each member wants a loan to expand their business, so the group is requesting a loan of 40000 Afghani. Nike Bakat is seeking a loan for a tailoring business. Sadiqa wants a loan for the business of quilt making. Gul Handam and his wife N. would like a loan to support their general store. So they are happy for the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet P., 26 years old and the married mother of three school-aged children, is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main income comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Janet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, Janet is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP for the same purpose.This will be her second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum T. currently operates a small basket-weaving business from home. Chum T. makes and sells her finished baskets to buyers who order directly from her house. She also saves up 20 sets of baskets before selling outside. To meet the needs of the family a little more, her husband takes time to provide a taxi service when he is free from weaving baskets. 

This couple lives with two kids who go to school or work. Chum T. hopes to invest in becoming a grocery seller and is taking out her loan to buy various grocery items to begin selling. This will provide her with an extra income source.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items to begin selling

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria T. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Gloria owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pig feed. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda Dave is a 48-year old married woman who lives in the village of Barangay Carabalan Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Her family depends on the income from her general store, from the pig fattening business and from rice farming.

Luzminda’s husband, Rodolfo, is a farmer. They have 7 children who are between 7 and 28 years of age. One of her children is a high school graduate and helps in their business. The other children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Luzminda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hopes that she would be able to assist her husband to improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by opening a general store, engaging in pig fattening and farming rice. Now, she earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000 from her business activities.

Luzminda is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing, for her 7th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 14,000. She intends to use this loan to buy fertilizer for the rice farm and towards her general store. Luzminda is working hard to achieve her the dreams and aspirations she has for her family. She wishes to provide her family with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon; (a Hiligaynon  word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"- a title of esteem  that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store and fertilizer for rice farm.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 54 years old. She is a married mother of six kids. One of her children is in school while the rest are learning a trade. She lives, together with her family, in a community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Agatha is a very hard working woman who supports her husband in taking care of their children. She enjoys selling goods in a business where she makes her living. She has been selling food items, like tubers of yam, cassava, vegetables and plantains, for five years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of goods from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of cassava, plantain and vegetables, etc. to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of yam, cassava, plantain and vegetables etc.

loans.name: Norma Adilia

texts.es: La señora Norma tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el bario Memorial Sandino, casada y con dos hijos estudiantes,  su esposo trabaja  en la administración de la empresa en donde ha logrado con sus ingresos hacer mejoras a su casa.  Doña Norma su negocio es la venta de cajeta la cual ella elabora desde hace cinco años, cuando comenzó lo hizo con la iniciativa de tener su propio dinero y no solo depender de su esposo para hacer algunos pagos oh necesidades diaria. La cajeta la elabora de leche de vaca, azúcar, canela, vainilla el cual compra diario un bidón de leche para prepararla. Con este financiamiento lo quiere para hacer una división en un cuarto de uno de sus hijos el cual le urge reparar. Es por eso que esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar, materiales como: plycem, clavo, pintura y otros para comenzar la obra. Contenta con el apoyo de Afodenic ya que será una puerta al desarrollo para hacer más grande su negocio, como en hacer las mejoras necesarias en su casa.
texts.en:
Norma is 46 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has two children in school. Her husband works in business administration and his earnings have helped them improve their house. Norma’s business is the manufacture and sale of “cajeta” [caramel]. She has had this business for five years. She started the business for the purpose of having her own money and not having to depend on her husband for every expense. The cajeta is made from cow’s milk, sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla. She buys a large drum of milk each day for its preparation. The purpose of this loan is to rebuild a wall in the bedroom of one of her sons. He has asked her to repair it. She will need to buy materials, including cement board, nails, and paint. Norma is happy with the support provided by Afodenic. It is a way for her to expand her business as well as make needed improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement board, nails, and paint to repair a wall

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen, tiene 44 años, vive en el Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. La Socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”. Es Casada y es madre D. 03 hijos, 01 que aun esta estudiando y depenD. D. ella, la Socia presenta Estudios D. Primaria Completa.

Carmen es  una mujer perseverante, con las ganas D. salir siempre adelante, decidió por voluntad propia vender comida en un ambiente limpio y acondicionado, ubicado en un puesto que tiene al frente D. un Hospital D. su Distrito, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, es reconocida por la sazón rica que le da a sus comidas, con su primer crédito D. 300 Nuevos Soles compró, arroz, azúcar en kilos, aceite en litros y utensilios para una mejor atención.

Se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que siempre  le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes  para la preparación diaria D. sus comidas  como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras y  parte D. dinero invertirá en utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Carmen, esta llena D.  vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante, su meta es seguir creciendo en el rubro D. venta D. comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old and lives in the Bellavista Province of the Department of San Martin. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Brisas". Carmen is married and the mother of 3 children, 1 of whom is still studying and dependent on her. Carmen has completed primary school, and is a persevering woman with the desire to always go forward. As such, she voluntarily decided to sell food in front of a general hospital in her district. She tells us that her daily sales are quite high, and she is known for her tasty food. With her 1st loan, Carmen purchased rice, sugar, oil, and utensils. She is very happy with her job, and personally working with her customers. With the loan she currently requests, Carmen will buy the ingredients necessary to prepare her food, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chicken, and vegetables. She will also use part of the money to purchase utensils. Carmen is full of life and eager to develop her business. She thanks Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy C. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Nancy is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for omore than 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan she has taken  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en: Five people, who all live in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province, make up this group loan. Mrs. Orn T. is the group leader, as selected by all the members. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Orn T. is a rice seller in the local village and, in her free time, is a Khmer cake maker also. Her husband, Mr. Soeurn Nget, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for supporting his family’s living. However hard they tR. to work, they earn little income. Thus, in order to improve their business, Mrs. Orn T. decided to seek a loan to buy more rice to mill for re-selling. She is a mother of a child who is attending the local public school. Mrs. Oeurn Sous, a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice to mill for re-selling.

loans.name: Zadi

texts.es: Zadi tiene 39 años, separada del padre de sus dos hijos, actualmente vive con sus hijos, en la casa de su  segundo compromiso. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa, pero tras la separación de su esposo, tuvo que dejar el negocio. Con el tiempo se dedicaría a vender refrescos, golosinas, galletas y demás dulces, en un puesto de venta dentro de un colegio privado. Es entonces que desde las 7:00am de la mañana hasta las 7:00pm de la noche trabaja sin parar, siendo el horario de refrigerio que no se da abasto, por faltarle ayudante. Sin embargo le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que de ese modo se siente una mujer muy útil haciendo lo que mejor sabe hacer. En el futuro espera comprarse otras vitrinas, en donde pueda exhibir sus productos y puedan incrementar más sus ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que desea contar con posteriores créditos, puesto que los considera de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas, además de una vitrina.
texts.en:
Zadi is 39 years old and separated from the father of her two children. She currently lives with them in her second home. Zadi previously worked as a clothing vendor, but after separating from her husband she decided to leave the business. At the moment she sells soft drinks, candies, cookies, and other sweets from her vending post inside of a private school. She works nonstop from 7am until 7pm supplying refreshments without the help of an assistant. Zadi enjoys her work because it makes her feel like a useful woman who is able to perform at what she does best. In the future, she hopes to buy more display cases so that she can exhibit her products in order to increase her earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP. Zadi commits to making her payments on time because she wants to become eligible for future loans that will be of great help to her business. With the money she requested, Zadi will invest in the purchase of more candy as well as a display case.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy & a display case

loans.name: Adelere

texts.en: Adelere is a business woman who has been grinding food like tomatoes. seeds, pepper, meat, beans, etc., for her customers. She is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Ibadan town, in Oyo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 20 years and with LAPO microfinance for over 2 years. Her greatest joy is the one on one interaction she has with the customers. Adelere is requesting for a loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase a grinding machine. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine.

loans.name: Julia Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Julia Pérez es una de las socias fundadoras  del banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito pues ya lleva tres ciclos en él,   vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sector Carmen de Guzho en  la parroquia Turi  ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, limita al norte con la ciudad de Cuenca al este la parroquia Valle, al sur, la parroquia Tarqui, y al oeste la parroquia Baños, ésta es una localidad que  tiene una superficie de 26,2 km² ocupa el 0,8% del territorio, considerado por los cuencanos como el  balcón porque desde aquí se puede divisar la hermosa ciudad de Cuenca, la iglesia parroquial y la  loma de Hitocruz  considerados atractivos turísticos para el turista nacional y extranjero.
