Nuestra socia  se encuentra casada y ha concebido cuatro  hijos  que oscilan entre los 32 y 24 años, sólo su hijo mayor vive independiente en unión libre, los otros tres son aún solteros  trabajan en un centro comercial de  la localidad y son quienes le ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar  junto a su esposo que  trabaja como chofer de una fábrica, juntos han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
A sus 52 años Julia sigue trabajando en  la venta de granos tiernos y verduras en el mercado de la feria libre de Cuenca y en  Totoracocha los días miércoles y sábados con un  horario de 6 a.m. a 12 p. en  un puesto propio que lo tiene hace siete años. Con su nuevo crédito adquirirá fréjol, arveja, habas, chochos, rábano, acelga, apio, zanahoria, etc., para incrementar un poco más su puesto de granos tiernos

Su meta es seguir con su negocio e irlo incrementando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Julia Pérez, 52, is one of the founding members of the Mujeres de Éxito (Successful Women) communal bank; she has been involved in three cycles with it. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca in the Carmen de Guzho sector of Turi parish located in the south of Cuenca. It is bordered on the north by the city of Cuenca, on the east by Valle parish, on the south by Tarqui parish, and on the west by Baños parish. This location has an area of 26.2 square kilometers and occupies 0.8% of the territory. It is considered by Cuenca’s residents as its balcony because one can view the beautiful city of Cuenca from here: its parish church and Hitocruz Hill, considered tourist attractions both for nationals and foreigners. Julia is married and has four children who range from 32 to 24 years of age. Only her oldest son lives independently with his partner; the other three are still single and work in a local shopping center. They, together with her husband who’s employed as a driver in a factory, contribute to meet household expenses. Together, they have managed to build their own home. At her age, Julia continues to sell basic grains and vegetables in Cuenca’s free market and in Totoracocha on Wednesdays and Saturdays from 6am to noon in a stand that she’s had for seven years now. She will use the requested funds to buy beans, peas, broad beans, chayote, radish, celery, carrots, etc. to enlarge her stock a bit. Her goal is to continue in business increasing her stock gradually.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, peas, broad beans, chayote, raddish, beet, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Fanny Patricia

texts.es:
Fanny de 34 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, se separo de su esposo hace 5 años, pero tiene dos hijos que viven con ella y estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Ella es vendedora Yambal y Avon (son compañías de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales con un porcentaje de ganancia por venta),antes ella salia a vender a las zonas de Guayaquil perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, todos los productos que le pidian sus clientes. Ahora ella vende desde su casa tiene vitrinas de productos Yambal y Avon como mostradores. 

Con el préstamo quiere perfumes, cremas, colonias para poder surtirlo mas. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender sus productos y otro para un restaurante.
texts.en:
Fanny is 34 years old and lives in the urban area Suburbio de Guayaquil; she separted from her husband 5 years ago but she has two children who lives with her and are in primary school. She sells Yambal and Avon (companies that provide commissions to Ecuadorian women for selling catalogue cosmetic products). Before, she used to go out sell perfumes, creams, deodorants and other products in various areas of Guayaquil; now she sells them in display cases out of her home. She would like to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams and colognes to stock her business better. In the future, she'd like to have a store where she can sell her cosmetics and another locale where she can run a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, lotions

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad, comparte su vida con Rodolfo de 42 años y sus hijos Rubén de 12 años y Dayat de 5 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la elaboración y venta de prendas tejidas a mano, lo cual le da los ingresos necesarios para compartir con su esposo los gastos de su hogar. Desde muy niña ella aprendió esta labor de su madre, quien con mucha paciencia le enseñó lo secretos para realizar un buen tejido, hoy en día pone en práctica para darle los últimos acabados a sus prendas. María trabaja realizando los tejidos por pedidos, la ventaja de vivir en una zona, donde su cultura se caracteriza por ser buenos tejedores, eso le ha dado la ventaja para este arte en un trabajo muy rentable. En un futuro desea seguir trabajando muy duro para tener su propio taller, además de comprarse máquinas tejedoras. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por tanto se ha comprometido ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales, como: lana, agujas nuevas para poder continuar tejiendo y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and shares her life with Rodolfo who is 42, and her children, Ruben, 12, and Dayat, 5. Together they live in her own house. Her work is to elaborate and sell decorative garments woven by hand. This provides the necessary income to contribute with her husband to household costs. From a very young age, she learned this skill from her mother, who with much patience taught her the secrets of realizing good weaving. Today she puts into practice these techniques to achieve a high quality of goods. Maria does weaving by request, taking advantage of residing in a zone where the culture leads one to be a good weaver. This has given her an advantage in this art; the work is very profitable. In the future, she wants to work very hard to have her own workshop, and in addition, to buy weaving machines. This is Maria's 6th loan with MFP, and she has committed herself to being very punctual in all her payments. With the loan she solicits, Maria will buy supplies, including wool and new needles, in order to continue weaving and in this manner, to augment her production.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WOOL AND NEW NEEDLES FOR WEAVING

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
37-year-old Fidela B. is married to a 39-year-old hired laborer. Without any offspring since their marriage life started, Fidela and Nolie are enjoying the company and the love of each other as husband and wife.

For as long as they are together, life, despite poverty, seems to be happy and easy. However they don’t deny the fact that both of them are excited to, in the future, have their own child and feel the real essence of a family. But, for now they are working so hard to earn money through a business to be financially prepared for having children.

Fidela runs her small sari-sari (variety) store financed by loans she has received from ASHI since her membership in 2006, while her husband earns sporadically as a hired laborer.

For Fidela’s dream of renovating their house for a better and safer shelter against storms and any other forms of calamity, she has to grow her business to make it profitable. Then she will be able to put up a savings fund meant for her plan. To make this possible, she therefore would like to request a loan.

Having a very good performance as an ASHI member since joining, in terms of attendance to weekly center meetings, loan repayments, and managing a business, she is confident to request a much larger loan.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of foodstuffs, beverages and grocery items for her sar-sari store

loans.name: Mariana Judith

texts.es: Mariana Judith R. R. de 33 años de edad, posee una sala de belleza, en la cual realiza cortes de cabello, tintes, pedicure, manicure, faciales y todo lo relacionado con el cuidado de la imagen. Ella vive junto a su esposo y junto a dos hijos menores de edad. Marina coloco su propio negocio en su casa de habitación ubicada en Tonacatepeque, con el enorme deseo de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su casa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria la cual no solo realiza diferentes tipos de servicios, sino también comercializa perfumes, tratamiento para el cuidado del cabello, peines, cremas para el cuerpo, shampoo y otros productos más, a pesar que cuenta con un año y medio de poseer su negocio, en la actualidad cuenta con varios clientes, quienes se sienten a gusto con el trabajo hecho por Mariana y por sus precios tan accesibles. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos, así mismo introducir a su salón nuevas marcas las cuales son de mucho prestigio, con lo que desea atraer más clientes a quienes les pueda elaborar un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Mariana Judith R. R. is 33 years old and owns a beauty salon where she provides haircuts, coloring, pedicures, manicures, facials, and other services related to the care of one’s image. She lives with her husband and two young children. Mariana established her business at home, which is located in Tonacatepeque. With great desire she was able to improve the financial stability of her household. Being a hard worker and a visionary, Mariana sells perfumes, hair treatments, combs, body crèmes, shampoos, and other products in addition to providing different types of beauty services. Despite being in business for only a year and a half, she already has several customers who feel comfortable with her work because she has affordable prices.

Mariana is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products. She hopes to introduce to her salon new brands that are more prestigious in hopes of attracting more customers who might be in need of better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty & personal care products

loans.name: Concepcion Del Rosario

texts.es: Concepción del Rosario tiene 37 años, Ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo pues se preparan para estudiar  gracias al gran sacrificio de Concepción. Ella se dedica a una pulpería que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante sus inicios se dan porque su esposo le ayudo a establecer este negocio con muy pocos recursos por lo que él se salía vender bolsas plásticas, por lo que con el apoyo de ambos han mejorado. El destino del financiamiento es para golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, pan y detergentes. Sueña con establecer su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Concepción del Rosario is 37. She has 4 young children who will go to school thanks to her sacrifices. She has a general store that she has gotten going with a lot of effort. Her husband helped her start the business with the very few resources he could offer from his sales of plastic bags. With their each helping out, they both have gotten ahead. The loan will be used to buy candies, soft drinks, juices, bread and detergents. Her dream is to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar Antonio G.  G. él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Asistente de servicios municipales tiene  dos  años de trabajar para esta empresa es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Antonio G. G. is an employee of the town hall of San Rafael del Sur. He has been working for this institution for two years and he works as a municipal services assistant. He is currently married. He has had three loans through CEPRODEL and he has used them for the purchase of construction materials and to improve the house where he lives. The loans have benefited him in a great way since, as a result, he has improved his living condition and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc

loans.name: Bong

texts.en:
Bong S., 26, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. S. is a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of $5 per day. S.’s wife sells meatballs, earning an income of $5 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a plot of land to sell meatballs. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot land for his wife to sell meatballs

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia G. is a single woman who lives in Sitio Canggadas, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  general store and pig fattening.

Sylvia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sylvia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and household consumption. Sylvia G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Pastora Genedi

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar. Este lugar es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.
 
La señora Pastora es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace dos años y le gusta el banco por la seriedad de las compañeras,  esta muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le han brindado para salir adelante. Tiene 48 años de edad y está casada  hace 30 años, de esta linda unión tuvo cuatro hijos los cuales son mayores de edad e independientes, solo una hija vive con ella con sus dos hijos pequeños. Su marido es comerciante.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado junto a su esposo, el se levanta muy de mañana y se va a la playa donde llegan los pescadores en sus pangas y canoas trayendo el fruto de su trabajo y allí ellos le entregan su mercancía, el mismo que luego  lleva hasta su casa para que la señora Pastora le ayude a limpiar para luego revenderlo a comerciantes que llevan el pescado a Quito.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado ya que el dinero esta invertido y necesitan de capital para poder surtirse y no dejar a sus clientes inconformes.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa más amplia y mejor arreglada.
texts.en:
The 'Esperanza Para Superar' community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a beautiful beach where the Portoviejo river meets the sea.  This place is visited by many national and international tourists.

Pastora has been a member of the community bank for two years and she likes the bank because of the reliability of her companions.  She is very grateful to Fundación Espoir for the support which they have given her to help her get ahead.  Pastora is 48 years old and has been married for 30 years.  From this beautiful marriage she has four children who are all grown up and independent.  Only one daughter lives with her, together with her two small children.  Her husband is a merchant.

Pastora buys and sells fish together with her husband.  He gets up very early every morning and goes to the beach where the fishermen arrive in their skiffs and canoes, bringing with them the fruit of their labor.  They hand over their goods which Pastora's husband then takes home so that Pastora can help him to clean them and then resell them to traders who take the fish to Quito.

This loan will be used to buy fish since their money is invested and they need capital to be able to stock up and not leave her customers dissatisfied.

Her dream is to be have a bigger, better house.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: Juana tiene 59 años, vive en casa con sus hijos los cuales estan en edad universitaria, ella se dedica al alquiler D. cuartos, negocio que le brinda buenos ingresos, recibiendo un promedio mensual D. 600 nuevos soles, ella sueña con poder darle a sus hijos todo lo mejor y una buena calidad D. vida, solicita el crédito para la compra D. un módulo pre-fabricado, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Juana is 59 years old and lives at home with her children who are school-age. She rents out rooms, a business that provides a good income, receiving a monthly average of 600 new soles. She dreams of being able to give her children the best and a good quality of life.  She is requesting a loan to buy a pre-fabricated unit. She is being granted a loan because she has good personal references

loans.use: Purchase of a unit.

loans.name: Ses

texts.en: Ses S., 32, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She makes and sells brooms in the local market, earning $1 USD profit each day. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes approximately $4 USD per day. This couple has four children – two are in school and two work in a garment factory. Ses S. is asking for a loan of $800 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. The motorbike will cost her around $600 USD and with the remaining $200 USD she will raise cows.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children

loans.name: Reynaida

texts.en:
Reynaida A. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 54 years old. Reynaida is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Reynaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables, spices & food seasonings in the local community. Reynaida has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Reynaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Reynaida is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Reynaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Urumuri Group

texts.fr: Therese N. est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du groupe Urumuri.  Elle a 52 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 4 enfants entre 15 ans et 30 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 5eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400 kgs de pommes de terre et intra-agricoles pour son activité d’agriculture.  Son stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer son activité âpres avoir bien remboursée ce prêt, et augmenter les produits.  Elle voudrait financer les autres, et avoir propre capital.  Elle voudrait le bien être de sa famille, acheter les vaches pour eux, et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Therese N. is a farmer and a member of the Urumuri group. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four, from 15 to 30 years of age. All four of her children [have gone or] go to school. She has completed fifth grade of elementary school. She is going to use her loan to purchase 400 kg [900 lbs] of potatoes and agricultural inputs for her farming business. Her strategy for growing her income is to improve her business after repaying this loan, and increasing her produce. She would like to be able to provide financing for others, and to have her own capital. She would like to provide for the well-being of her family members, to buy cows for them, and to pay for her children’s studies.

loans.use: Purchasing 400 kg of potatos and fertilizers for her field

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene D. G. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo.  She is 29 years old.  Eugene is single.  To make a living, Eugene owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Eugene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eugene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Eugene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eugene from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey B. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 18 years old and single. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling toy products like plastic water guns and plastic cooking sets in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Jeffrey is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like toys. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional toy products to sell

loans.name: Salmos 91 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Salmos 91 esta ubicado en el barrio la Cruz de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, cada uno de los integrantes tienen su propio negocio, son muy unidos y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Maria Lidia G. tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella y de su esposo, Maria tiene una pequeña pulperia y tambien produce tortillas , por las mañanas hasta las dos de la tarde atiende la pulperia y despues elabora y vende tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir la pulperia.

la señora Reyna Isabel G. tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos, Reyna se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas y tambien cria cerdos. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal para tener mas produccion de tortillas.
El sueño de Reyna es tener su casa, ahora ya tiene un solar en donde va a construir.

el señor Jose Francisco G. tiene 38 años de edad, esta soltero pero tiene dos hijos que dependen de el,  Jose vive en casa de su madre y se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de pescado blanco, rojo y babosa.\
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado. hace poco compro un carro en donde transporta el producto y esto le facilita sus ventas. en estos momentos se queda sin producto rapido y tiene que viajar hasta donde venden el pescado para seguir vendiendo, esto le ocaciona perdidas en tiempo y dinero pudiendo comprar mas por semana y llenar su carro de pescado.
texts.en:
The group 'Salmos 91' ('Psalms 91) is located in the suburb of La Cruz in the city of San Lorenzo. Each one of the members has their own business. They are very close and determined to move forward in life. Each one carries out different activities, which are as follows: 

Maria Lidia G. is 33 years of age, married and has three children who rely on her and her husband. Maria runs a small local store and also makes tortillas. She works in the store each morning until 2pm and afterwards she makes and sells tortillas. She will use this loan to purchase groceries to stock up her store.

Reyna Isabel G. is 47 years of age and a single mother to four children. Reyna makes and sells tortillas and also raises pigs. She will use this loan to purchase corn, wood and lime to increase her tortilla production. Reyna's dream is to have her own home, now that she has a site where she will build her house. 

Jose Francisco G. is 38 years of age and single, but he has two children who rely on him for support. Jose lives in his mother's house and he has sold white fish, red fish and aloe vera plants for the past year. He will use this loan to purchase fish. A little while ago he purchased a car to transport his products and this made his sales easier. At the moment he is quickly running out of products to sell and he has to drive to the area where the fish is sold to keep reselling them, which means that he loses time and money. With this loan he will be able to purchase enough fish to fill up his car each week.

loans.use: Purchase of white fish, red fish, aloe vera plants, corn, wood, lime, beans, rice, sugar, soap, toilet paper, bread, soft drinks, churros, cornflour, butter, oil and eggs

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy N. is a 30-year-old farmer. He is married to Vivian N. and a father of three schoolchildren. Sammy has been farming in the town of Narok for the last eleven years.

Sammy learned about KADET from a friend who is already a registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to buy farm inputs and hire field hands to prepare the land. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his maize output and to build some rental houses.

Sammy's dream is to educate his children and improve his family's standard of living. Sammy is thorough, and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and hire field hands to prepare the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for the preservation of fish

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia de 32 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella se dedica a una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, el negocio nació hace 4 años y lo atiende de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, con el propósito de mantener siempre su inventario abarrotado de buenos productos, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener a los clientes contentos con el buen servicio.
El sueño de Idalia es poseer un negocio amplio, en un local más grande y bien abastecido de aquellos productos que necesitan los clientes en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Idalia, 32, lives in Usulután with her husband and son.  She has a store where she stocks basic need items.  The business was born four years ago and it’s open from Monday through Saturday.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to always have her store well stocked with good products.  This loan will help her keep her customers happy with good service.

Idalia’s dream is to own a spacious business in a larger locale that is well stocked with the products her customers need for their homes.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a young woman from Bethlehem city, a mother of two daughters and five sons. Claire and her husband share in taking care of their big family. Claire produces favors for birthdays, weddings, baby showers...etc.

Claire who is photographed above in FATEN's branch in Bethlehem took a loan from FATEN to purchase a large amount of raw material to double her production. Claire started this work 15 years ago and has a good number of regular clients.

loans.use: Purchase raw material to produce a larger number of events favors.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: La señora Lucy se dedica a la comercialización de peluches por mayor y su esposo es empleado publico; el crédito lo necesita para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de peluches y juguetes, para su venta y así generar mejores ingresos que le permitan cubrir los gastos de su familia y empezar a ahorrar. Vive en  casa propia ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Es casada y tiene nueve hijos. Lucy es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Lucy sells wholesale stuffed animals and toys for a living  Her husband is a public employee.  She needs the loan so she can get more product to sell and generate more income so she can pay household expenses and start to save.  She lives in her own house in the 16 de Julio area of the city of El Alto.  Lucy is married with nine children.  She has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy toys and stuffed animals to sell.

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé le 08 avril. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Leur activité principale est l'embouche ovine.

Madame Bintou Léye à droite de la photo et emmitouflée d'une écharpe orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans est veuve et a en charge ses deux petits enfants. 

Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine  mais fait aussi du petit commerce de bouillie de mil et d'arachides. Elle a une expérience de quatre ans dans ces domaines.


Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la région.


Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter des moutons pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi faire de gros revenus.


Elle participe aux charges de la famille surtout pour la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok Jom was created on April 8th. It is composed of 14 women who all come from the same village. Their group was formed based on family and neighborly connections. Their primary activity is raising sheep.

Mrs. Bintou Léye, on the right in the photo wearing an orange scarf, is the group leader. She is 66-year-old widow who looks after her two grandchildren.

Her activity is sheep fattening, although she also sells millet and peanut porridge. She has four years of experience in these fields. She buys her supplies weekly at the local markets.

This loan will allow her to buy sheep to increase her livestock and boost her revenue.

She takes care of the family’s needs, especially with respect to food and health care.

loans.use: to buy sheep to be fattened and sold

loans.name: Victor  Bacilio

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor es un comerciante muy emprendedor que en compañía de su esposa atienden una tienda de abarrotes que le pusieron por nombre "Estanquillo Diana" en honor a su hija , con  el  transcurso del tiempo las  ventas han ido   mejorando día a día, solo que les hacen falta unos productos que sus clientes les solicitan, y como el se preocupa por  otorgar  un excelente  servicio  al  cliente en esta  ocasión  requiere surtir  mercancía  para  su negocio, agradece   el  apoyo  brindado  para   realizar   su proyecto.
texts.en: Víctor is a very enterprising merchant who, together with his wife, run a grocery store they called “Estanquillo Diana” in honor of their daughter.  As time has passed, sales have improved daily.  They only lack a few of the items their customers request.  Because he strives to provide excellent customer service, on this occasion he needs to stock merchandise for his store.  He is grateful for the support provided for his project.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Née en 1955 au Bénin, Elisabeth est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Valentin. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge tous scolarisés. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Elisabeth contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Elisabeth prépare en effet de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce) qu’elle vend depuis près de vingt cinq ans à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Elisabeth vend d'autres produits divers à son domicile. Elisabeth  s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Elisabeth sollicite pour une cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1955, Elisabeth is married to a chauffeur named Valentin. The couple is raising five children, all in school. Thanks to the income generated by her business, Elisabeth contributes to the family's various expenses. She lives with her husband and children.

Elisabeth prepares food (corn paste and rice accompanied by sauce) which she has been selling from her home for more than twenty five years. As a secondary business, she sells various other products from her home. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In order to satisfy her clientele and to improve her standard of living, Elizabeth is seeking a loan through ALIDé for the fifth time.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, and sauce condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, cigarettes, etc. in bulk to add to her inventory

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad nació en el departamento D. Apurímac (Perú) y tiene 65 años D. edad. Actualmente, Soledad vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Soledad es periodista D. profesión y trabaja en la radio Voz y Coraje  D. la ciudad del Cusco.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Soledad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para su salud.  La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Soledad was born in the Department of Apurímac in Peru. She is 65 years old. Soledad lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and two children. She is a journalist by profession and works in radio for the “Voz y Coraje” (Voice and Courage) network in the city of Cusco. Soledad has been in this business for several years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her job. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use, specifically to pay expenses related to maintaining the health of her bones.

Soledad is a responsible and hardworking person. These qualities prompted her fellow members to extend an invitation to her to join the Communal Bank “Hatun Rumiyoc”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses related to her bone health.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Mamajon

texts.ru: Мамачон жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в России. У нее трое детей. Сама Мамачон занимается торговлей. Она радом с домом открыла ларек, где занимается продажей продуктов питания и овощей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Mamachon lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is 39 years old. She is married. Her husband works in Russia. She has three children. Mamachon works in trade. Near her home she opened a stall, where she sells groceries and vegetables. She has been doing this work for five years. She is taking out a loan to buy food. She wants to increase the variety of foods she sells.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, fresh milk and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, fresh milk and rice.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Nancy has a business selling vegetables and spices including bell peppers, cabbages, and root crops. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more spices and vegetables for resale.

Nancy became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices for resale

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio lives in the Philippines. He is happy living with his wife and his one child. Emilio has been managing his hog raising business for 15 years. Emilio describes himself as patient and industrious.

His business serves as a source of income for the family that helps him provide his child allowances in school. Now, Emilio is happy because his child has finished his education. He says that his success is just a product of his good character.

Emilio is looking for a loan of P15,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed for raising his piglets. He wants to develop his business, earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies in his family.

loans.use: to buy feed to raise his piglets

loans.name: Nohely

texts.es:
Nohely  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con educación superior.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra  de seis animales,  los mismos que comprará en las ferias de Zepita, Juli, Huacullani, Acora.  Nos cuenta que los animales  a veces los engorda para conseguir un mejor precio, también los compra  y los carnea al instante, la carne la vende en la ciudad de Arequipa e Ilave.  En el negocio le ayuda su suegra y su esposo.
La señora desea tener una casa para vivir mejor.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la cordialidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Nohely is a member of the 'Central Vaqueria' community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 22 years old, single, and has one child.  She completed her higher education.

Nohely is a new member who recently joined Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles which she will invest in buying six animals.  She will buy the animals in Zepita, Juli, Huacullani and Acora markets.  She tells us that she sometimes fattens the animals to obtain a better price but she also buys them and slaughters them right away.  She sells the meat in the towns of Arequipa and Ilave.  Her mother-in-law and husband help her in her business.

Nohely would like to own a house so that she can live better.

What Nohely likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans and the friendliness between the members.

loans.use: to buy six animals

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany, de 21 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Lorena, su esposa desde hace un año. Ambos vive en su casa propia. Apenas 3 años que comenzó a forjar sus propios ingresos económicos. Desde niño sus padres le enseñaron a producir la tierra y vivir de ella. Sus principal cultivo constan de café, los cuales comenzó a sembrar en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, por el momento cuenta con una pequeña parcela; pero más adelante comprará más. “Con trabajo, empeño y ahorro lo lograré”, menciona muy entusiasmado. Pues ahora que comenzó a trabajar con su banco comunal, espera ahorrar y tener el capital para invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas y poder incursionar en la siembra de otros productos oriundos de la selva. Además desea tener la estabilidad económica para la llegada de sus futuros hijos, que espera tener más adelante con su esposa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Dany de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para la siembra de plantitas de café y si el dinero le alcanza; comprará herramientas para la limpieza de sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Dany, 21, lives in a house in his native village of Santa Maria and has been married to his wife, Lorena, for one year.  Barely 3 years ago he began to earn his own money. Since he was a child  his parents taught him to produce from the earth and to live with her. His main crop is coffee that he started planting on his own fields.  Currently he has one small parcel but he would like to buy more in the future.

He says enthusiastically, “With hard work and savings, I will succeed“.  He has begun to work with his communal bank and he hopes to save and have the capital to buy more fields and to be able to start planting other native products of the jungle.  He also wants to have economic stability for his future children that he hopes to have with his wife.  He belongs to the “Los Amigos Cafetaleros” communal bank and this is his second loan from MFP where he appreciates the support of all of you.
He also promises to be punctual with his payments.  Dany will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers to plant his coffee seedlings and if he has enough money, he will buy tools to prepare his fields.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer and perhaps some tools

loans.name: Madonna Jane

texts.en:
Madonna Jane is 26 and newly married to a farmer. They live in a village planting and harvesting rice for sale. Due to financial difficulty, she engages in hog-raising to generate additional income. They aim to earn more income to build their own house and save for the future of their children to be. They also plan to expand their piggery and put up a variety store in the future.

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional capital of P27,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business. She mentioned that through her patience and hard work, she will make the business grow and become profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for hog-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of merchandise in order to expand her business

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es: Oscar Alberto se dedica a la venta de dulce, desde hace más de 4 años. El es una persona trabajadora sale todos los días temprano para ofrecer cajetas, que son muy ricos. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el tiempo pues tiene que salir a vender y al mismo tiempo dedicarle tiempo a su familia Oscar aprendió este medio de vida por su Madre que le enseño a tener su propio negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de leche, coco, dulce entre otros productos.
texts.en: Oscar Alberto has been selling candy for more than 4 years. He is a hardworking person who goes out every day very early to sell his delicious fudge. One of his biggest challenges is time as he not only has to go out and sell but also needs to spend time with his family. Oscar learned this way of life from his mother who taught him how to run his own business. The loan he is asking for is to buy milk, coconut, candy and other products.

loans.use: to buy milk, coconut and candy.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of 16 years old and 11 months.  Four of them go to school. 

Regina runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for one year. She has no employees. Regina heard about Finance Sudan through advertising done at her market. She is taking out a loan of 600 SDG to purchase more food items like Irish potatoes, onions, and spices. In addition to this business, Regina has no other source of income. 

In five years' time, Regina would like to hope for growth in the business and at least sell in a shop. Her major challenges include high household expenses.   

Regina says that she is happy about Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like Irish potatoes, onions, and spices.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells oranges, bananas, groundnuts, cassava and plantains at Besease near Elmina. Ekua is married to a teacher and has six dependents.  She has been selling the above for 12 years.  She uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills. Ekua will use her loan to purchase more fruit and foodstuffs for sale. With the new profit, Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more fruit and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
María forma parte del Banco comunal “Carlos Ibáñez del Campo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la confección desde hace 10 años, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye en dos secciones de 9ºº a 12ºº y de 16ºº a 19ºº horas. De lunes a sábado.
Sus clientes preferentemente son particulares y colegios quienes solicitan sus servicios durante todas las temporadas del año, comprendiendo la temporada de colegio (enero, febrero y marzo), fiestas patrias (septiembre) y navidad (diciembre). Para realizar confecciones y arreglos de ropa. El resto de los meses del año confecciona buzos para colegio, pijamas, sabanas, manteles y arreglos a pedido.
María amplió su casa para habilitar un espacio como su taller de costuras, ahí cuenta con diferentes tipos de maquinaria, entre máquina de coser con puntada recta, una overlock, una bordadora y una colleretera (máquina especializada en la costura de cuellos y puños). 
Su mercadería la compra en el sector de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago y también en la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Con la mitad del crédito comprará insumos para realizar confecciones para la temporada de navidad y la otra mitad la invertirá en insumos para confeccionar ropa de colegio durante los meses de enero y febrero.
Sus metas son expandirse con su negocio y contar con un taller más amplio, mayor producción y contratar a personas para que le ayuden con su negocio. 
Ella vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 23 años, quien trabaja de manera dependiente y que además estudia la carrera de técnico en electricidad. 
Sus sueños son prosperar en su negocio y que su hijo sea un profesional.
María está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte es bien unido y responsable, además las capacitaciones impartidas en estas mismas, le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio de mejor manera. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Carlos Ibáñez del Campo” communal bank, located in the city of Valparaíso.

She’s been sewing for ten years and works split shifts from 9:00am to 12:00pm and from 4:00pm to 7:00pm, Monday through Saturday.

Her customers are schools and individuals who request her services to make or repair clothing throughout the year; during the school year (January, February, March), patriotic festivals (September), and Christmas (December).  She makes school hoodies, pajamas, sheets, tablecloths, and does repairs on request during the rest of the year.

María expanded her house to set up a space to use as a sewing workshop.  There she has different kinds of machines, including a straight needle machine, an over lock machine, an embroidery machine, and collar machine (a special machine used to make collars and cuffs). 

She buys her merchandise in the cities of Satiago and Valparaíso, within the Independencia sector.

She will use half of the money from this loan to buy sewing supplies for the Christmas season and will use the other half to invest in supplies for making school clothing in January and February.

Her goals are to expand with her business, have a larger workshop, increased production, and to hire people to help her in her business.

She lives with her husband and her 23 year old son, who works for someone and also studies to be an electrician.

Her dreams are to prosper in her business and for her son to become a professional.

María is very happy and grateful for the support she’s gotten through “Fondo Esperanza.”  It’s allowed her to invest in her business.

She says that her group is very responsible and united.  Besides, the training has helped her better organize her business’ accounting.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers to the northeast of Santiago.  It’s the regional capital and the center of power for the national congress.  It’s the nation’s first port and it offers a great variety of beautiful, picturesque places, such as the home of Pablo Nerda, the great poet and winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Noelia

texts.en:
Noelia is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreuners. She came to us because she need to reinvest in her business. This is her first loan and she is very excited to be part of Esperanza. In her community there are some groups with loans and all the members are very happy and increasing their business.

Noelia sells clothing and jewelry. Her clients request the items or order them. She will use this loan to reinvest by purchasing jeans, blouses, shirts, etc, and silver and gold jewelry like rings, bracelets, necklaces and chains.

Noelia said her most important challenge is to buy  a vehicle because she wants to travel to different places and carry her merchandise. She enjoys her business. Noelia will use her business profits to reinvest and save. She is dreaming of having her family and her own house. Noelia thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothes and jewelry.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 61 years old, and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Vicenta has a buying and selling of fish business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Lucita has a food shop that makes & sells meals like adobo & afritada. She is also buying & selling vegetables & spices. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making meals. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Yavo De Seme Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YAVO DE SEME est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même ville. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Viviane (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 44 ans a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Viviane est mariée à un technicien du nom de Pierre. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Viviane vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Viviane vend de haricot, du maïs, du sorgho, des pâtes alimentaires et du charbon de bois dans sa boutique depuis dix-huit ans environ. Viviane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Viviane ensemble avec les membres du groupe YAVO DE SEME sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs, de sorgho, d'igname

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in African masks and carvings. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stains, polish, and beads.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"While in junior high, I lived in a neighborhood where there are a lot of carvers and I assisted them in sandpapering masks and other carvings. This got me interested in woodcarving, and I also did well in art classes at school. After graduation, I decided to go back and assist the carvers. Even though they couldn't pay me much, I felt happy and satisfied, and was glad to go to work with each new day. Now I work on my own. The most challenging part of this craft is when am designing my work, and the nicest part is when I mix colors to paint. My hope is to become an excellent designer."

"I will always be grateful to the people who help to fund my loan request. I pray for Allah's blessing for you all."

Use the link below to view Abdul's African masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8770

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stains, polish, and beads

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is 44 years old woman with two (2) children. She sells clothes for the community. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy 40 chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a grocery shop and expand her farm
